This has opened my possibilities of replacements and I'm very happy with it.These are still the best headphones I've ever owned and I've no intention of upgrading to anything else anytime soon :) These are monsters.

I bought this as a second controller for my Xbox One. The controller that came with my Xbox One purchase has been fitted with a Play and Charge kit so I wanted another controller with that set up.Pros1. Charging solution + controller in one package. Don't have to worry about buying both separately and it costs roughly the same either way.2. The Xbox One controller is a fantastic controller. Comfy to hold, easy to use..3. Connecting to the Xbox One was easy (instructions included)4. Charing cable works and plugs into any USB port. This could theoretically be used on computers as well as the Xbox One.5. Officially licensed by Microsoft. That's always a pro when it comes to gaming accessories. Officially licensed by any company (sony, nintendo, etc) generally has higher quality than third party. Not always, but most of the time.6. The cable is very long. Sufficient for most set ups.Cons1. There really isn't much of a price break for buying the whole pacakage as opposed to separately. I think it's like $5 less (at least what I paid). As I understand from having this in my wishlist for 3 months, the product goes in and out of stock all the time so I guess that probably affects pricing.2. The micro-USB port on top of the controller has always felt a little wobbly and flimsy to me. I've had my Xbox One for 6 months and my original controller hasn't broken and doesn't seem like it's going to, but it's a long-term concern of mine. Not much I can do about it.Overall, this is the controller package you want. Wireless, charging enabled, and officially licensed. About the only other charging solution I'd recommend is the Nyko charging dock. Between this and that, there aren't any other really good options for rechargeable batteries for Xbox One controllers (at the time of this review)
I bought this for my roommate for his birthday. I can't comment on anything specific, but he can't put it down so I guess it's pretty good.

These Leaves from the Last Home books are great. Excellent reference books for Dragonlance fanboys (and fangirls) like me. I can't leave too long of a review because these are 1. out of print and 2. hard to find but if you were a huge fan of the Dragonlance series and you can find a used copy cheap, it's worth owning for nostalgia value.Thankfully, the used version I picked up was in good condition and that makes me happy.Also, I love the recipes :D

These Leaves from the Last Home books are great. Excellent reference books for Dragonlance fanboys (and fangirls) like me. I can't leave too long of a review because these are 1. out of print and 2. hard to find but if you were a huge fan of the Dragonlance series and you can find a used copy cheap, it's worth owning for nostalgia value.Thankfully, the used version I picked up was in good condition and that makes me happy.Also, I love the recipes :D

These Leaves from the Last Home books are great. Excellent reference books for Dragonlance fanboys (and fangirls) like me. I can't leave too long of a review because these are 1. out of print and 2. hard to find but if you were a huge fan of the Dragonlance series and you can find a used copy cheap, it's worth owning for nostalgia value.Thankfully, the used version I picked up was in good condition and that makes me happy.Also, I love the recipes :D

Like his other work as of late, Stuart Woods seems to have slowed down a bit. He's pushing 80, it happens. That said, I found the story fun. Not like 1991 Stone Barrington "fun", but still fun nevertheless.Pros1. The story isn't bad. Bringing back some old bad guys and revolving around some old concepts. Woods is trying to find Stone some consistent enemies in the later part of the series. It works in some cases, not in all cases.2. There is actually some "oh no, I gotta hide because people are trying to kill me" in this one. It removes Stone from his wealth and power for a bit which is actually refreshing to see.3. People actually shoot people. More than once. Not as "polished" as his other later novels.Cons1. Like many, I find myself ready to skip pages that are heavily political. I don't find it annoying or "bad". It is his books, his art, and so he can do what he wants with them. But still, a little toning down would be nice.2. Like his other later works, Stone becomes a bit less relate-able in every new novel. He is, after all, super wealthy and one gets a bit tired of the weird food names and expensive alcohols.Overall, I would only really recommend this to people who don't mind Stone's new life. Yes, it doesn't have the grunge anymore but he's rich and partially famous, he doesn't need to be grungy anymore. I just hope Woods at least works on his story pacing. It seems like he did a bit in this one.

It's true that Stuart Woods has lost his edge a little bit. He's pushing 80 years old and Stone Barrington has been around for going on two decades now. It happens. You can't expect a mind to stay sharp forever. That said, the book is okay (3 stars on Amazon means "okay").Pros1. The story moves briskly. The late 20's in the series were a lot of words without a lot of movement. Even if the story isn't as captivating as it once was, it at least moves as quickly as it used to.2. I found it actually a bit interesting to see Stone try to manage all these political friends and enemies.Cons1. Like many, I'm not all about pushing political agendas via creative works. Unlike many, I understand that it's his art and therefore can express whatever views he wants. I'm actually a liberal-minded moderate, but even I'm like "okay Mr Woods, tone it down a bit."2. I miss the "grunge" feel of Stone's life. It just seems so polished and proper. Everyone's eating foods with french names and bottles of wine that costs more than my entire life. I guess it's the whole "can't relate to me because he's a poor guy trying to make it."It's an interesting book and I managed to finished it without problems. I'll probably buy the next one because I'm lazy and don't feel like finding another series. I don't regret my purchase, but I would only recommend this to people who don't mind the changes in feeling in these novels.

This thing is quite possibly the nicest can opener I've ever owned. I bought this after my cheap, dollar store can opener broke.Pros1. It's heavy and feels very well made. This is not some lightweight POS you can buy at the dollar store.2. The gear-driven mechanism turns very smoothly. It just feels smooth and nice, even if it makes the cans turn a little slower.3. the handle is well constructed and the turning handle is large which provides a lot of leverage. Very well designed.4. Cheap, at the time of this review, it's under $10. I didn't think you could get things this nice for under $10.Cons1. None that I can think of so far. About the only thing that may bug me long term is that the handle is still "plastic covering metal". My last can opener broke when the black plastic handle snapped and it became barely usable thanks to the metal being difficult to hold. Assuming these don't do that, then there's nothing wrong with this can opener.Overall, this is a hand-crank can opener. It's made in the USA and it's surprisingly well crafted for a $10 item. It's worth a shot. Worst case, you've lost one trip to McDonald's, right?

I bought this for my mouse after a 6 1/2 inch wheel was too big for him. He's a smaller field mouse (I think).Pros1. Good size, he was able to move it easily.2. Attach on the cage or free standing, your choice.3. Good color and design.4. Silent for now, but I'll adjust the review if it ever changes.5. Mouse likes it.Cons1. The tension of the wheel changes depending on how tight it's screwed it. The yellow bit in the center doubles as a screw that holds everything together. When it's really tight, the wheel is a bit harder to turn. I loosened it a little bit, no big deal.Overall, good little wheel. It's under $10 so it's kind of hard to take its flaws too seriously.

It's a very capable wheel. I bought this after my little field mouse broke his other wheel.Pros1. Seems well constructed.2. Didn't make any noise, although I didn't see it in action very long.3. Free standing or cage connection. Love options.4. Nice color and design.Cons1. Was too big for my mouse. That's probably my fault but he tried and couldn't get it to go as fast as he wanted.Overall, would recommend but not if you're mouse/gerbil/hamster is one of the smaller varieties. You'll need a smaller wheel for them.

I got the khaki pair because I was looking for a cheap pair of khakis.Pros1. Good fabric. Thicker than I had anticipated but not too thick. Comfortable to wear.2. Deep pockets.3. Good fit.4. Cheap price.5. Free belt.Cons1. The fabric has a square pattern that I don't like so much.2. It comes with a belt and also with a tie in the front like swimming trunks. I don't know why.Overall, my issues with them are purely cosmetic. They are a solid pair of shorts, I just wish they didn't have the square pattern. Still wearable and definitely not a deal breaker.

I ordered these because I needed a pair of shorts and these didn't look bad. Plus they were cheap.Pros1. Good fabric. It won't win any durability awards but it is more than I was expecting at this price.2. Fun design. Again, won't win any awards but sometimes you need something that isn't all one color. This fits the bill.3. It also fit as expected. Ordered a 36, got a 36.Cons1. None yet.Assuming these don't fall apart in a year, this was a good purchase. If anything goes wrong I'll update but otherwise, this is a solid pair of shorts for the price.

This is a fun little time waster that's a mix between infinite runners (e.g. Temple Run) and Frogger.Pros1. Cheap (free)2. Fun and challenging3. Colorful and pleasing to look at4. Easy to put down and pick up. No time commitment and no saving to worry about. Just play when you can.Cons1. Simple game with no story and no point. You're just dodging traffic for some reason forever.Overall, it's a fun little game. Recommended for toilet gaming or when you're waiting in line somewhere and wherever you won't feel bad if you have to turn it off right then.

I bought this so I could connect my Nvidia Shield Tablet to my television and play it in both console and HMDI mirroring modes.Pros1. It does work with the Nvidia Shield Tablet.2. The cable feels well made. Nothing is wobbly or coming apart.3. The picture is crisp and stable. No fluttering, no static, and the sound works as well.4. It's cheap!Cons1. The cable isn't very long (I knew that going in) but if you're trying to get a device from your TV to your coffee table, you'll need something longer.I'm very happy with my purchase. There are cables "special made" for the Nvidia Shield and Shield Tablet that are two-four times as expensive as this one but this one works just as well. Unless it fails, I can't see anything really wrong with it and would recommend it to fellow Shield Tablet owners.

I have a desktop PC along with a podcast set up, speakers, and dual monitors. I'm also a tech blogger so I always have an assortment of mobile devices laying around. I needed something to plug them all into.Pros1. 12 sockets! This makes life better.2. The fact that some sockets are on the side allows for large brick plugs that would otherwise take up multiple spaces on the power strip due to its size. With this, that's no longer an issue.3. It's wide and heavy. Wherever I put it, it stays.4. Feels well made. Not some cheap plastic thing like many cheaper ones. Those still work obviously but this feels more sturdy.5. The coaxial Jacks on the back are a nice touch. I'll never use them but it's good to know they're there.Cons1. According to other reviewers, I guess there's a safety issue with these and electric surges. I always unplug my desktop set up during severe weather (I never risk it) but you may want to read some of the negative reviews before trying this out. It doesn't sound like much would survive a direct lightning strike and I'm impressed there are so many people who have lightning strikes that affect their electricity and own this power strip (really, what are the odds?) but better safe than sorry when dealing with thousands in electronics. Also, read the warranty before buying. It's available on Belkin's website.Overall, I needed something with more sockets and this provided me with what I needed. I'm a tinfoil hat kinda guy when it comes to unplugging things during severe weather so I don't have to worry about safety. Other than that, this thing is beastly.

I bought this for my girlfriend as a birthday present (she's a Zelda nut, I'm a Final Fantasy guy... See? We can get along). I haven't played it  but she has.According to her, it's a great Zelda game. It's a 3DS remake of Ocarina of Time from the N64 and comes with the extra content from other previous remakes. Since that's regarded as one of the best games ever made period, that gives you an idea of how good this game is. The 3D part is a bit gimmicky but underneath it's still the same great game.It's an essential title in a Zelda fan's life and a great overall game.

I bought this because of peer pressure. Two of my friends have Ruby and that means I had to get Sapphire. I also bought this for my girlfriend.Pros1. Classically long Pokemon story. I haven't played one since the red/blue/yellow days but I can already tell I'm going to spend way more time in this than I did on those.2. There's a lot to do. On top of the main story there are a bunch of Pokemon to catch and train. There's also online battling and trading. You can also a with your Pokemon and train them to make them stronger. I'm at the third gym leader and I'm already overwhelmed by how much there is to do.3. The game is large and beautiful. The graphics aren't like Final fantasy 15 good, but they're colorful and cartoon-like and fit the theme and atmosphere of the game perfectly.4. The various dexes make for a fun experience. Way better than just having the plain old Pokedex.5. The music doesn't suck.Cons1. The Pokemon sounds still sound like it was done in 8 bit. Seems oddly out of place with the Polish of the rest of the game.2. The story isn't much different from the first Pokemon games. Catch all the Pokemon and be a great trainer. It's not unenjoyable but it's definitely like "oh here we go again".3. The menus seem unnecessarily tedious. There always seems to be one click more than is needed to do what you need to do but then one less click when needed. Like in the computer, when you back out, it asks if you want to back out even if you aren't in the middle of something. But then in battle you can't confirm attacks, they just go. This is maddeningly inconsistent and took some time to get used to.Overall, this is the best Pokemon game I've played. It's world's above the originals and it's awesome to not have to trade with a link cable anymore. Worth it, especially if you can get 4 or 5 friends to play it too. So much battling and trading!

I bought this as a Christmas gift for a friend who is into ironically ugly sweaters. She's also into cats. This seemed like a perfect gift for her and she loved it.Some thoughts1. Comes a little larger than expected.2. It's apparent quite comfortable. She wears it frequently and says it feels good.I don't have a pros and cons because I did not personally use it but she wore it two days in a row so apparently I did well. Great gifts for those who like cats, ugly sweaters, or both.

I bought this as a birthday present for my girlfriend. I got a new one so it didn't appear beat up or anything which is good news. Does, in fact, come with Mario Party.Pros1. The 3DS XL is gorgeous. The blue and black design looks crisp and clean. My girlfriend literally squealed when she opened it.2. All parts work. Sound, WiFi, 3D slider, buttons, etc all function.3. Mario Party is a fun game. A good basic bundle game.4. Good price. There are new 3DS models that cost as much as this but this comes with a free game. Buying a plain black and blue and the game separate would've cost more money.5. The girlfriend loves it. Score points for me!Cons1. It's just a black and blue 3DS XL with a bundled game. No special identifying marks or anything. If you don't like Mario Party then you can just get a blue and black normal one and it's the same thing.Overall, this was a good purchase. Mario Party is fun and the 3DS XL came in good condition. It was intended as a gift and the receiver loved it.

I bought this for my girlfriend after I accidentally broke her incense holder. I figure go big or go home right?Pros1. It's hefty and has good weight. It feels of high quality.2. The colors are good and the art is detailed. It doesn't look like it was crafted by unskilled hands.3. Like the other reviewer said, it fits well with fantasy settings. Also, fans of fairies and nature could get into this.4. Holds standard incense well.5. Came in a bag that was placed in a block of Styrofoam carved specifically for its shape inside of another box inside of an Amazon box with bubble wrap. #dedicationCons1. As with any piece like this, I worry about the wings and other smaller parts chipping.2. The sticker on the bottom is hard to get off.Overall, this makes a good gift for fans of fantasy, fairies, nature, and/or incense. My girlfriend loves it and uses it all the time.

I bought this because the desktop mic stand I was using started taking up too much space thanks to its tripod-style stand structure.For comparison purposes, here is the mic stand I was switching from: http://www.amazon.com/Hamilton-Nu-Era-Tabletop-Mic-Stand/dp/B003VYBD58As you can see, the legs are so wide on that model and my desk is pretty thin so I wanted something with a heavy, rounded base to use instead because it's more efficient and saves space. That's why I bought this one. I do podcasting along with voice overs and YouTube videos.Pros1. Nice and heavy. I have no fear of my mic or stand tipping over.2. Variable height. I keep it on the lowest setting but it's nice to know I can extend it if needed.3. The threading fit my microphone clip (whatever came with the GLS ES-57)4. Takes up so little space on the desk. The base is 6-inches in diameter and can be easily moved out of the way.5. My Nady pop filter fits the stem.6. Cheap and solid. It's all metal.Cons1. The one I got actually wasn't the one pictured and I could tell by the tightening handle. In the picture, it's shiny black plastic and kind of short. On the one I got, the tightening handle is larger and actually better. No complaints but just be warned that there are at least two variants of these floating around.Overall, I'm happy with the purchase. My last desktop mic stand took up so much space that it was a hassle to work with pretty much all the time. This is much smaller, heavier, and better built than my last one and that's what I wanted. Would recommend for podcasters, YouTubers, etc.

I want to start this review with the observation that most people rated this game before all the patches. If you see any reviews from before around December 27th, disregard them because those people were judging a game that hasn't had the patches released to fix errors and add features. That makes all those angry release day reviews wrong and you shouldn't pay any attention to them. Anything updated or written after December 27th is probably okay assuming it isn't an angry, dejected fanboi. Okay, so my quick review.Pros1. The multiplayer does, in fact, work. It's a little wonky here and there but it does work and it works about as well as prior Halo games (which have always been wonky). I don't know if people are mis-remembering "the good old days" or if they simply didn't play that much, but matchmaking always took 3-5 minutes on a good night and 5-10 minutes on a bad night to get into a game. That hasn't changed at all from any of the online Halo games. I've had matchmaking do its "search loop" twice since I started playing it and a quick "exit and re-enter" fixed it both times. It's not nearly as bad as the angry mob of 1-star reviewers make it seem. Some people like to just be angry.2. The 60fps makes these games look intensely smooth. It's most notable during Halo 3 because it is so much smoother than it used to be. 60fps ftw.3. The graphical enhancements are awesome. Especially for Halo 2. The ability to turn it on and off is not only amazing and impressive, but also tactically useful. When I need the textures turned down to differentiate from landscape and bad guy, putting it down to the old graphics settings with the older lighting and textures makes it way easier to see bad guys at a distance and in low-light scenarios. Cool!4. Halo 1, 2, 3, and 4 campaigns in all of their glory for under $60 is glorious.5. I like in matchmaking that any game could be any map from any title. You could play Blood Gulch one game then Valhalla the next. Halo 2 mechanics one game and Halo 4 mechanics the next. That's really fun and a good way to shake things up and keep matchmaking interesting. I think it would've been an inferior experience if playlists were done "by game".6. Halo 5 Guardians preview until January 15th = win.7. The ability to customize controls, armor suits (colors, etc), and more for each individual game was a good touch although I generally just leave everything the same from game to game.Cons1. The matchmaking stats don't report right. I went 5 kills, 17 deaths in my first match (I hadn't set the controls yet and kept tossing power drains at myself...oops). I came right back and went 13-10 in the next game, and then 17-9 in my third game. Despite winning 2 of 3 games, the game reports my wins at 1 and my Kill/Death as 5-17. This hasn't changed much in the week I've been playing it. The same goes for campaign. I've done 2 Halo 2 missions and it says I've done 6...and I even got some achievements I definitely didn't do.2. The customization is about 50% there. You can change your armor colors but you can't actually see the change in the menu. In the later Halo games, you could pick your individual pieces of armor (especially Halo 4) which you can no longer do. Either let us customize or don't, but don't give us half of it...and not even the cool half.3. There are small graphical glitches here and there. Parts of the menu kinda bug out (they still work) every now and then. I suspect future patches will fix this and it doesn't affect game play so I'm not overly concerned.4. There is one ranked playlist on multiplayer and I don't like the game type. Lame.5. I bought the game and the next day they announce that they're giving away ODST to people who bought it before I did. Lame.6. No Halo: Reach online playlists, maps, or mechanics. Lame because I really liked Reach's multiplayer7. After matches, the game bounces you from the lobby in matchmaking. Given that it's much harder to see who you've played with recently (compared to the Xbox 360), that means it's harder to find the people you just played with and invite them to a game. It's essentially anti-social unless you're already in a party with friends. This is as much Microsoft's fault as it is 343's because the Xbox One's menu system kind of puts the "social" aspect in the background for some silly reason.Overall, this title has had a lot of problems. However, I bought the game anyway because even if multiplayer was broken, there are still 4 Halo games worth of campaign and that alone is worth the $60. As it turns out, 343 has been doing a LOT better than the reviewers here would have you believe. Multiplayer feels like a Halo game and the minor issues don't affect the game play very often. Given that 343 has announced that they're holding back work on their next Halo game (due out in Spring of 2015...and no I'm not talking about Guardians, I'm talking about another side game) to fix this one, I have confidence that the game will be more or less what was expected.Yes, it sucks that the game was released in the shape it was in. Sometimes budget constraints and deadlines are a real pain. Anyone who has ever worked in a deadline-driven environment can tell you that sometimes you release things you didn't get to finish all the way. At least 343 is doing something to make it right. Take a lesson, Ubisoft, because Assassin's Creed Unity still sucks.I would recommend this game to Halo fans who have dealt with "those Halo issues" through the first 4 Halo games (and those who believe those issues didn't exist are wrong or stupid, it's always taken several minutes to get into a matchmaking game). Casual gamers may want to wait a few more months for 343 to sort out the remaining issues...but there really aren't all that many.

Square Enix wanted to get back to their roots and Bravely Default was the result. As someone who has been playing those games since Final Fantasy 2 on SNES, I was curious and excited.Pros1. A fast paced story that takes you across the map before chapter 4. You get the airship quickly. There's a world map. The story and setting of the game are flawless old school Final Fantasy.2. The graphics are phenomenal. The 3D effects are subtle and enjoyable but even in 2D mode the hand drawn graphics look exquisitely old school while still being modern and pleasing.3. The job system is extensive and upgrades quickly as you progress. They're earned by side quests given throughout the game which makes them worth doing and they're actually relevant to the story.4. The Brave/Default battle system is genius. It makes battles fast and adds some much needed depth to the old school ATB style combat while not warping it into something convoluted. I'll also add here that you can fast forward battle animations by 4 times which makes grinding so fast and easy.5. Engaging characters with distinct personalities. Tiz is a little boring when it comes to dialogue but let's face facts, Chrono didn't even talk and Chrono Trigger was still great.6. The Norende rebuild, summon friends, abililink, D's journal, and the tutorial quests add some really fun depth and give players something to do.7. You can increase and decrease the random encounter frequency by a fairly wide margin. Crank it to grind, tank it to enjoy the story. Love it.8. The soundtrack is amazing. It's catchy when it needs to be, epic when it needs to be, and highly varied in tempos and instruments. Hands down one of the best video game soundtracks of the last decade. The guy who is doing Bravely Second has some mighty big shoes to fill.9. The ability to pause combat at any point and act using SP is awesome. Yes, you can buy it but really you don't have to. Just leave the game on and close the 3DS lid and you'll earn them pretty quick. A good night's sleep gets you 1 SP and the work day or school day gets you another. You can only have 3 total so it really doesn't take long to get it without spending real money. Also the functionality is wicked awesome when a battle is going South.Cons1. While the characters are billed as 18 year old adults, their Chibi appearance gives them a much younger look. This makes certain parts of the game feel awkward and a little creepy (Edea's bakini scene, the old sage drooling over Edea and Anges, Ringabel's personality in general). Word is that Bravely Second will feature more adult looking characters which will be better.2. The stat system is more in depth than they explain. It takes things like job level into consideration for things like weapon damage so even if a weapon seems powerful, they're still kinda pathetic when in the hands of someone low level in their job (even if the job is suited for it). This isn't bad, it's actually great for strategy but I wish they'd put more focus on it. Don't ever go into a boss battle on a fresh job change. Revert back to a class and equipment set that's been developed.3. It's really easy to get over leveled and it takes a lot of the challenge out of it. For those who want a challenge and not just enjoy the story, you may want to take advantage of the "turn experience off" function in the Settings to keep it tough.4. It's hard to get the AR cards working if you're a noob at it like me.Overall I love this game. This is what I always imagined the jRPG genre would evolved into and it's great to see that Square Enix is still capable of releasing a game with this much charm and enjoyment. If you liked the older final fantasy games or jRPGs in general, you'll probably love this.

I bought this because I live in an apartment complex with a shared backyard and no fence. I own a chow/retriever mix who weighs roughly 35lbs and thought this would be good for her.Pros1. The one end has a spring built in so when my dog tugs on it, it lets her bounce instead of choking her.2. Seems of solid construction. The various parts feel sturdy and the cable is heavy enough to feel reliable but no so much so that it weighs the dog down.3. 30 feet as advertised, more than long enough for the pup.Cons1. None yet but I'll update my review if anything goes wrong.Overall, I'm happy with the purchase. I haven't owned it long but this thing has been out in the weird, awkward weather of Ohio during the winter so I'll know if features like the rust resistance work soon enough. It holds the dog in her area and doesn't choke her. I can't attest yet to the longevity of the product but, again, I'll update if anything goes wrong!

I bought these after my 4 year old pair of C1RCA's finally started falling apart. I wanted to go for something a bit different so I went with these (in the cream/black/acid because my girlfriend insisted that I can "totally rock them"...I don't think that's the case but I bought them anyway). I'm used to the huge, padded skate shoes so transitioning to a cloth-style shoe was an adjustment.Pros1. The shoe fit well. I wear a men's 9.5, that's what I ordered, and that's what I received. Shoe fit with about a thumb's width of room to spare which is what I wanted.2. I like the design. I got the tie-dye ones. I have no intention on trying to keep these sparkling clean. Thanks to their messy, but fun design, I can spill pretty much whatever I want on these and it'll just blend right in. Ultimate lazy shoes ftw.3. They are comfortable and they fit well. I keep mine looser so I can slip them on and off like slippers and that works for me even if my foot comes out of the heel a little bit when I walk. When tied tight, they're very snug.4. Reasonably priced. I bought these for under $30. A name brand shoe for under $30 is uncommon. It also makes me less concerned about destroyed them because I can more easily justify destroying a $30 pair of shoes than a $60 pair of shoes.Cons1. They are not for wide-footed people. I have a medium width foot and they are comfortable but I can definitely feel a bit of a squeeze on the bottom of my feet. I wore them for 12 consecutive hours when I first got them and didn't experience any pain or discomfort but if my foot were even a quarter of an inch wider, that would not have been the case. If you need wide shoes, these aren't what you're looking for.2. These are not for walking, running, skateboarding, or any other physical activity. They're "fashion" shoes meant to be worn to places like a movie theater, out to dinner, or going to parties/bars/etc. They give a skater look but are not a skate shoe. Since I don't skate, that works for me but athletes looking for an athletic shoe need to look elsewhere.3. In cold weather or when there's precipitation (rain, snow, sleet, etc), you might as well be outside wearing 2 pairs of socks. They don't keep your feet warm or very dry thanks to their cloth design. Not a deal breaker (I knew this when I bought them) but just pointing it out.Overall, I'm happy with the purchase. If I'd bought these for, say, $60, I probably would've dropped it to a 4-star rating so price was definitely taken into account here. They are comfortable for "goofing around" which is good because that's what I was looking for. I'll likely get a second pair of the thicker skate shoes for those days where I'm talking around somewhere and need the extra ankle and arch support. I would recommend these but only if you have medium to thin feet and just need a shoe for goofing around.

I bought this for my brother for a Christmas present.Pros1. It's thicker than I thought it would be. It'll probably last a long time.2. The outside of the wheel cover has various grips which I liked. It definitely helps improve grip. The design is a little tacky but not unpleasant.3. It's inexpensive, which was nice.4. As advertised, there is no stench or anything untoward about it. I don't think I would've really cared if it had a smell "Cons1. It was a little big for my brother's steering wheel. We ended up using some double sided tape to make up for it. Make sure you measure your steering wheel! Since this was a "my bad" thing, I didn't dock a star but learn from my mistakes.Other thoughts1. This ships from China. The free shipping was nice because shipping overseas is really expensive for some items and I did, in fact, receive the steering wheel cover. However, it took about 3 weeks to get here and the shipment tracking was kind of useless. It said it had left China then just showed up one day without any tracking updates. This is not a con, simply the "usual experience" of dealing with sellers through China so I wanted to put that out there so you can plan accordingly. If you're buying it as a gift, order it well in advance. I bought this in mid November and it made it here for Xmas with a week to spare.Overall, my brother is happy with it. It matches an orange/black seat cover that I also bought him (link at the bottom) so it helps make his car all themed and such. I don't regret the purchase and I would recommend this to my friends as long as they measured the steering wheel first. It's not the world's best steering wheel cover or anything, but it does what it needs to and it's cheap.Here's the link for the seat covers I bought with this: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B009ET14E4/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_4
This has a 4.9 out of 5 rating for a reason. If you're easily offended, don't buy it. Otherwise, have fun!

I bought this to keep me going until I buy a second controller and one of those Nyko charge docks.1. It's simple. A charging cable and a battery. That's it. No weird parts or confusion at all.2. It works well. Every part worked as expected.3. Battery keeps a charge for a good long time. No issues. I don't have exact estimates, suffice it to say that I've forgotten the last time I'd charged it a few times.4. Lithium ion battery.Cons1. Kind of expensive for a battery and a cable.2. Didn't come with the controller like it should have. Kind of upset I had to buy this separately.Overall, it's either this or the Nyko charge base. They're both great options but until I get a second controller, a dock seems too much.

I bought this to protect my Nintendo 3DS XL Nintendo controller edition (I have no idea what it's actually called). I was going to get a Nerf one but found out that the XL versions have a history of scratching 3DS XL's and I didn't want that at all so I searched around and bought this instead.Pros1. It covers the top and bottom to satisfaction. The design on my 3DS XL is protected and most of the surface area is protected. The parts that aren't protected aren't parts that touch a table or anything.2. It's easy to put on. The top slides on. The bottom slides on and hooks into the two square holes at the top which makes it feel secure.3. All the ports, holes, and other things are accessible including the buttons, stylus, game cartridge, lights WiFi slider, 3D slider, volume, headphone jack, and lanyard hole.4. It's clear enough to where I can still see and enjoy the special design on my 3DS.5. It's inexpensive.6. The plastic of the TPU makes it easier to grip the 3DS XL.7. As a fun, unforeseen benefit. When I hold my 3DS XL, I consistent (on accident of course) turn the volume up with my palm as I'm holding it. Thanks to the case, I now hold my DS slightly lower than before and I no longer accidentally hit the volume slider.8. I also like that the inside of the DS is protected by a lip. When I close the DS, the lips of the case meet instead of the inside of my 3DS.9. It still fits my AmazonBasics 3DS carrying case so I don't have to buy another one of those.Cons1. It provides more scratch and dirt protection than drop and shock protection. You'll need to pick up something with a little more girth and bulk to protect from drops. This case also doesn't protect the bumpers or hinge at all so if you do decide to drop it, at least try to drop it on any other edge or side than the one with the hinge and bumper buttons.2. It is more of a frosted clear. This isn't a huge deal because I can still see the design on the 3DS clearly but it is not "crystal clear" or anything like that. It's definitely frosted.Make sure you wipe your device down really well before sticking it in there and do make sure you take the case off and dust/clean the 3DS and the case every now and then. Since it is so open at the top, dust can still get in there over time and mess with things. It's not a huge deal but it's something to keep in mind.I've never owned a limited edition of a game console before so I wanted to make sure I protected this one at least a little bit. At the very least the design on the front (the original NES controller) from getting messed up. This case does that and that's what I wanted so 5 stars out of me.

My roommate bought me one of these for Christmas because a local game shop had it on sale and he wanted to get me something awesome.Pros1. The screen is huge. Easily the largest mobile gaming display I've ever played with. It's gorgeous. Especially when playing graphically pleasing games like Bravely Default.2. The 3D slider has an off switch. I guess, according to my roommate, the regular 3DS has a slider but no click to turn it off (I guess sliding it down eventually just turns it off). The extra click is nice.3. Holds a charge for days.4. SD card slot let's you expand your memory which is nice.5. The design is wicked. It's not like a sticker or anything, it's painted on like the rest of the color. Feels very high quality. The back is a darker gray which makes the front stand out even more. The retro NES controller design just looks so cool.6. The buttons all have a very satisfying click. The joystick feels smooth and wonderful.7. Still plays regular Nintendo DS games. My copy of Chrono Trigger isn't useless yet!8. The peripherals all work well. WiFi connects without problems. Speakers work fine (that other guy seems to have gotten a dud, that sucks and he should've had it RMA'd before posting a review). 3D screen works. AR stuff works. No real issues in the software.9. I love that I can buy (most) 3DS games online and download them. Digital downloads rock.Cons1. The hinge wobbles ever so slightly when holding it up and playing it. Being a long time DS owner, I knew that was coming. They all wobble just a little bit but it's not a big deal. Not enough to be worried. If you don't treat it like garbage, it'll never break. Just don't be surprised if there's just a bit of wobble.2. I'm torn because I never want to cover this baby up but I want to save it from fading or scratching so I can't decide whether or not to buy a case for it.3. Nintendo just released "The New Nintendo 3DS" otherwise known as the Nintendo 3DS LL (Google it). It'll be in the United States in 2015 which means these bad boys will be out of date in the next 12 months. Here's hoping that most 3DS titles moving forward still accommodate all 3DS models and not just the new one (which features some extra buttons and slightly upgraded hardware). Would be unpleasant to have to upgrade next year for Bravely Second or some other game.Overall this is a great system and an improvement over pretty much every prior DS. The retro design makes it feel unique and fans of old school video games will enjoy that. Make sure to let the speakers burn in a bit (leave it at half volume for a week or two) because that allows them to go louder without blowing them out. Also never set the game sound to max and you'll avoid burning it out.I would buy this again if my first one broke someday. Can't wait til they have more themes!

What's weird about this one is I enjoyed it more than the last few Stone Barrington novels and in this one, Stone really plays more of a side character rather than a main character.What I liked1. Advances the stories of Kate Lee and Ed Eagle. Stone is just kind of there but it's still actually oddly enjoyable.2. The Barbara Eagle storyline was fantastically done. Especially the end. It was the first time my eye brows shot up reading Stuart Woods in a while.3. I hope Woods keeps Ann around for a while. I really liked her character.What I disliked1. As per the norm, these characters manage to pull off some dramatic stuff without much effort. If these books were D&D games, I'd be calling the dice loaded. Lots of lucky breaks in this one.

Carnal Curiosity is another chapter in the fascinating life of Stone Barrington and, personally, i feel like this is about as much as a "callback" to Stone's earlier life as Stuart could possibly do.What I liked1. Stone actually does some of the same stuff he used to do as a detective. I'm not a hater of "the rich and powerful Stone" but it's nice to see him call back some of those intimidation tactics and such from his cop days.2. The story in this one is actually pretty good. A little more mystery than many of Woods' more recent Stone books. Of course, it's fairly obvious who the criminal is but finding the evidence to prove it feels like a callback to the "Stone was a cop" days.What I disliked1. Stone's ridiculous luck. A part of an armed robbery and didn't even take a gun-handle to the noggin.2. Also, Stone's women for this particular book really didn't try all too hard.Overall, not a bad book. I would read it again and my nit picks are small issues and not things that ruin the book.

The first 60/70% of this book was phenomenal... man I was hooked into this beautiful story of first love. But, for whatever reason the story took a huge turn in the end and just lost me. If the entire book had held onto the humorous/entertaining relationship they had in the beginning, which was my favorite part of the book, this would have been an easy 5 star read for me. It just got a little too ugly for me towards the end and the beauty of the story got lost in all of the unnecessary drama.I loved Ben!  He is one of my favorite male characters I've read in a long while. And Fallon, I loved how much her character grew as a result of their relationship. Just wish the book had kept the tone I felt in the first half all the way to the end.There are plenty of glowing 5 star reviews for this book so probably just another one of those books that for whatever reason I am in the minority!  Happens to me all the time... :)

This is a great adjustable, folding tablet stand for those light, smaller tablets in the house!  I have been trying it out for my small android tablet and kindle and it does an excellent job of holding up both devices.  I love the fact that this is extremely portable.  It folds up nicely AND it is easy to adjust to fit the size of the tablet.  The pics below are of my Android tablet and my kindle...  both are slightly different in size but I am able to adjust it to fit both.  This does have a weight limit!  When I tried to use it for my spouses Windows tablet, which is pretty heavy in comparison to these lighter ones, it would collapse the stand.  So, I would not recommend this for large, heavy tablets...I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest feedback.  Please feel free to let me know if you have any questions/concerns about this product and I would be happy to help you out.

Oh my...  that wasn't what I expected...  :(  It was too disturbing for me personally.  I am so freaking sensitive to child abuse.  And it happens not only to Reyes but also to Charley.  I want to erase one scene right out of my head but can't.  I guess it would be kind of hard to tell this story without going to that dark place.  If you are like me and this is a trigger topic, I would avoid reading this BUT if you're not then it will probably be a nice quick read to help fill in some blanks.  Nothing in this that you need to read in order to continue on with the series so no worries if you wanna' skip it.I've loved the entire series...  first time I haven't been swooning over a release so I'm going to just move on to the next release with a clean slate!

Oh my heavens... that WAS so dirty, and hot and I must have more! LOL...I've only read "Dirty" by Ainsley Booth from this set and it was so stinking good, well worth the .99 cents just for that one alone.  :)  Tabitha is a female character like no other. She will definitely shock you, she is so bad. But that doesn't stop Wilson... he can see right through her. The sexual chemistry is AMAZING between these two and once again Ainsley has this magical way of making something dirty into something "heartfelt"??? How does she do this?? Talent... just pure talent!Can't wait for the rest of their story...

This is such an entertaining, erotic and suspenseful series! I would not recommend reading these as stand alones. It is best to start with book one because you will want to be able to follow the mystery that is slowly unfolding surrounding the death of the Sloan family's father, the gang they think is responsible and their mother who is in prison. This third book definitely revealed some big surprises in the mystery/suspense plotline. A new character is revealed that totally changes the game!Elle and Colin are definitely one of my favorite couples so far in this series. Not only are they pretty good at the off the charts sexy time, they are both just very good people. Colin has a past that he is ashamed of and it haunts him. He pours himself into his physical activities as a way to control his addictive urges. I love characters like Colin who have found a way to stay on the straight and narrow path in a way that is positive. I also love that instead of hiding from his mistakes, he uses that knowledge to help others not make the same ones. This makes Colin: The.Most.Awesome.Guy!I love that the relationship between these two revolves around the youth center and that they both feel strongly committed to helping young people. I guess that's why this couple stands out for me, because it's something that I believe in doing in real life. So, it helped me to connect with them a bit more.Watching these two move from the "friends with benefits" to opening their hearts to something more was a refreshing story indeed. Both of them were guarded for their own reasons, but as a couple they were stronger together when they broke down those protective walls. Sometimes you just have to take a chance even when it's risky... that's what they both had to realize.Great installment to this series... one more to go! Can't wait for the next book so we can see how the mystery unfolds so the Sloan family can finally put away the ugly past and move forward to a better future.Lauren Blakely is my favorite erotica author... no one does it better!

This is a great corset for such a low price.  Very well stitched and really comfortable.  There are a lot of hooks to match together and it takes a bit of work to get them all linked together but once it's done it fits really well.  We ordered a large on purpose because my daughter likes to get them larger so she can cinch them to fit with her sewing machine. Corsets can be expensive.I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest feedback.  Please let me know if you have any additional questions/concerns and I'd be happy to help you out.

This is a really nice wig!  Very soft, very well styled and came very nicely packaged.  I have some pics below for you to see how it looks on a real person.  My daughter does cosplay and she has quite a lot of wigs.  This one is a good choice for quality at a good price. We requested this wig in pink...  there are pics below for you to see the color and style.  It's a very light shade of pink. Fantastic conclusion to this series!  I was intrigued with book one, blown away by book two and well, totally invested in the finale with book three. :) Great PR series and an author that I've grown to really love as one of my favorite in the PR genre. Can't wait to see what else she has up her sleeve...

This is a sweet office romance that is all about getting a second chance at love. I really liked how the story revolved around the 12 days of Christmas. This warmed the heart and put a smile on my face... what more do you need to cheer up the holidays?? :)This novella can be read as a stand alone but it is also part of the Blue Moon Lake series.  I LOVED the first book in this series called Share the Moon and can't wait to read the next full length book which is releasing soon.Wonderful and talented author...  looking forward to more of her work.

My love affair with these characters all began with Silver Nights With You... and then, it continued with the second book Desert Sunrise. Needless to say, I was waiting to dive into book three with great anticipation AND the author not only did not disappoint me, she blew me away. I just can't recommend this trilogy of books more to the lover of Western Romance. Wonderful characters and a heartfelt storyline that is laced with humor, romance, suspense and even a few tears.Each of these books can be read as a stand alone but, I think the reason why the third book touched me so much was because I had grown to love Marlena aka Ruby, Dalton and all of the other characters in the previous books. This made their story so much more engaging. So, I do recommend starting from book one because they are all equally as good and it will help you understand the emotions of the characters and how they ended up where they are now.This last book of the series is just something special. The way the author built this story around the Ruby... the symbolism behind it all was very touching. The way she tied Shakespeare into the story in such a way that offered not only a touch of romance but also added an edge of suspense was very clever and such a nice way to enhance and enrich the plot. I also loved how the plot was so cleverly tied together with the title. Ruby's Song... yes, indeed... she did sing her song beautifully. And there was one point in the book towards the end when she was singing to an audience with a few little helpers that just had tears rolling down my cheeks. Oh man, I love it when that happens, when an author can so successfully bring on tears of happiness and joy and put a big smile on my face!This is a book that weighs heavily on the concept that love has no barriers. It doesn't care about age or where you fall in the hierarchy of social class. And, sometimes the heart just wants what it wants even when it's under impossible odds. But, love also makes the impossible possible if we just let our hearts guide us. There are times in life when we set out on a particular journey only to find that it's not where we belong. And, that is very much how I felt about both Marlena aka Ruby and Dalton. They were both on very different paths but once they followed their hearts desire they ended up exactly where they belonged. It was quite the journey for them to get there, but worth the trouble!This author is so very talented. There is just something appealing about her voice and writing style. As I mentioned in an earlier review, I used to sit and watch the old western romances with my mom when I was young. Reading these books took me back to those days. Felt like I was sitting on the couch again with my mom eating a bowl of popcorn. Perhaps that is why I enjoyed this series so much.

This is not a stand alone... part 7 of an on-going series!In this installment, we have yet another Dragon King fall into the mating trap... yep, this time it's Thorn and he falls hard for the determined and spirited American southern gal Lexi. Lexi is out for revenge and Thorn has stepped in to make sure her need for revenge doesn't end up getting her killed. What follows is an undeniable passion between the two while at the same time the Kings are in neck deep with the beginning of a war with the Dark Fae. It is a fight to see who will control the human realm. The humans are unknowingly caught between a delicate balance of peace and safety under the rule of the Kings, or their demise at the hands of the dark Fae.This was a really great installment, the action has stepped up a notch and hopefully we will be moving soon into a grand finale. I've made it no secret that my favorite character in this series is Rhi, the light fae. I love the direction the author is going with Balladyn and Rhi which is why this installment truly struck a chord with me. Balladyn is one of those characters that has me bouncing back and forth between love and hate, but right now I'm leaning more towards a growing love for him as we learn of his conflicting emotions towards Rhi. I have my own predictions of how this story will play out for them and if my predictions are true I will be really, really happy with the outcome.As much as I've been enjoying this series, I am ready for it to be drawn to a close. It's time for all of the kings and their allies to come together and put an end to the impending takeover by the Dark Fae, as well as coming to a resolution for the growing angst between Con and the banished dragon king Ulrik.I was worried that I was losing interest in this series all together since the last two installments didn't resonate with me as much as the beginning books. But, this installment changed my mind. I like that it seems like all of the pieces of the puzzle are finally starting to come together. And, I have to absolutely know what is going to happen to Rhi. This story ended in such a way that definitely has my curiosity peeked. So, yep, I'll be sticking around for more.Great series for the lover of dragons!

Another great installment... this series is still one of my favs! Felicity Heaton has a talent for keeping us on our toes and leaving us wanting more with each book. This one has me waiting in anticipation for the Incubus/Huntress storyline... are we getting one?? I hope so...AND... I CAN'T WAIT FOR BLEU'S STORY!!! I know it's coming soon... the author has promised us it will. I'm positive that the wait will be worth it... :)This book is bringing us back to the shifter world again and we follow the story of Harbin, brother of Cavanaugh who me met in a previous book. Harbin is now living a life on the dark side after being banished from his pride many years ago. He is now an assassin and his new mark is about to change everything and set him on a path he had not expected. Aya is his mark, and as the story unfolds he finds that they have a connection that had been long forgotten, but is now finding it's way back to the surface. This powerful connection that forms between them has Harbin doubting his ability to fall through with the task he's been hired to fulfill.One thing I love about this series is the clever way the author ties in previous books and characters in a way that puts small pieces of puzzles together which helps me to make sense of things that have already happened. You get glimpses of characters and scenes you've read in other books but get to experience them from the perspective of another character. She also always finds a way to introduce new characters that leaves us wanting to know more about them which for me works in keeping me anticipating further installments.This is a great series for the PR fan because you get a little bit of everything... witches, elves, vampires, shifters, demons all mixing with the human hunters. There are plenty of characters to keep you entertained along with a really engaging storyline and lots of steamy romance to make it all worthwhile. And my FAVORITE part of the series... the strong, kick your butt female characters! There are no female doormats in this series. These ladies can fight and they always manage to drive their potential mates a little cra cra which adds a little bit of amusement to the pairings in each book.Great PR series and one I highly recommend... :)

This is a great product for anyone with dry or frizzy hair.  I have extremely dry hair due to the medications I am taking and it's a constant uphill battle.  I love the shampoos that this company sells and have been immensely pleased with how well they restore moisture in my hair.  This product is a nice compliment to their shampoos.  After I towel dry and comb out my wet hair I pour a little of this into my palm, rub together and work it through my hair starting mid-way down the head through the tips of the hair.  I let it settle for a bit and then follow up with a blow dry...  LOVE it...  :)  It's not heavy at all, very light and easy to use and smells very nice!  I also use this again sometimes later in the day when my hair is getting a bit frizzy...  so yes, you can also use it on your hair when it's dry to tame the frizzies.I am really glad I found the company...  they really do make great products for anyone struggling with dry skin or hair.I received a coupon for a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest feedback.  Please let me know if you have any additional questions/concerns and I would be happy to help you out.

I have extremely dry skin due to the medications I am taking.  Regular lotion was not doing it anymore.  I was asked to review this product and thought...  why not??  I do need some help and I will try anything at this point.  This is a very light and gentle oil.  It has a nice smell that is not overwhelming.  I lather this oil into my skin every night about 10-15 minutes before bed to allow it to soak in.  I was worried it would get my sheets oily but nope...  my skin drinks it up!  By the next morning it's worked it's magic and my skin is so much softer and smoother and less flaky.  I have to use this every day because my skin is so dry but I would think someone with normal-dry skin probably would not need to use it as often.I love this product and plan to order a replacement bottle when it runs out.I received a coupon for a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest feedback.Please let me know if you have any questions/concerns and I would be happy to help you out.

This is a beautiful wine opener!  Nice alternative to stainless steel.  It comes beautifully packaged in a box that can also be used for easy storage of the wine opener when not needed.  This also comes with a foil cutter that stores nicely inside the box as well so it doesn't get lost.  Very easy to use if you do not have strength in your hands.Easy to use an operate, makes a good gift, does exactly what you want it to do...  not much else to say other than that really.  :)Yes, I would recommend.I received a coupon for a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest feedback.  Let me know if you have any questions and I would be happy to help you out.

This does exactly what you need it to do...  works like a mini strobe light.  It basically lights up anything white or light in color.  When I was testing it on my carpet I was very aware of how much lint is trapped in it's fibers.  Yes, definitely in need of a vacuuming...  :)  This is one of those handy little devices that is nice to have around when you have pets.  It works really well in locating those occasional pet stains.  I have two cats...  always something going on somewhere.Yes, I would recommend...I received a coupon for a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest feedback.  Please let me know if you have any questions and I would be happy to help you out.

This product is designed for someone who is bed ridden and to help reduce or prevent bed sores.  I am a cancer patient and even though I am not currently bed ridden, I am struggling with extreme discomfort at night due to spine and rib metastasis from the cancer.  After using this product on my regular bed I have to say that this has truly been an exceptional product to have to reduce stress and pressure along my spine and I have been sleeping so much better.  I have stage IV breast cancer so my care is long term and my symptoms and care will have me in bed occasionally for long periods of time.  This is definitely going to come in handy.Even though the picture shows this being used in a hospital bed, it also works really well on a regular bed and that's how mine is being used right now.  I don't have any trouble with slippage of the mattress because of the type of sheets I use.  It has long flaps on both ends of the mattress that you simply tuck in for extra security.  You will need to place something underneath this to keep it from slipping about on a plastic mattress which is what we usually find on hospital beds.  Any type of slip proof cloth or mat will work.The other thing I really love about this product is that it is very portable.  I took this with me when I went to visit my daughter to keep me comfortable on the hotel bed.  For my occasional stays in the hospital...  this is going with me!  I hate hospital beds and this will help make the stay more comfortable.It takes about 10-15 minutes for this to fully inflate.  The pump is very, very quiet and gentle.  The only noise it makes is when it's adjusting pressure and it sounds a bit like a ticking clock.  It is not loud and annoying but very subtle.  As the mattress is adjusting it produces a gentle vibration that is very relaxing and it helps me relax my tense muscles and ease the tension around my spine.  It is very stimulating and I can see how this would be very beneficial for someone who is in bed all of the time.I love this product and would definitely recommend.  I did receive a coupon for a free sample in exchange for my honest feedback.  If you have any questions please do not hesitate to ask.  I would be happy to help you out.

I love this shampoo and conditioner!  Very nice...  :)  Smells really good.  I am testing several shampoos and conditioners for this company and so far I am really loving just about all of their products.  I'm on a lot of medications that severely dry out my hair and skin.  These shampoos/conditioners are working extremely well for me in helping to restore moisture, bounce and softness to my hair.  I've been using three types for the past three weeks, The coconut oil, the argan oil and the keratin...  my favorites for every day use are the argan and coconut.  The keratin I am finding is good for using a couple of times of week as it seems to provide more moisture than the other two.  After several days it makes my hair feel flat.  BUT, I still love it because it gives my hair the additional boost of moisture it needs every few days.  So, I just switch back and forth.When I buy shampoo/conditioners over the counter I usually have to buy 2 bottles of conditioner to one bottle of shampoo.  With these I am able to use the same amount of conditioner to shampoo...  which is awesome!I also love the design of the bottles...  love the pumps...  makes it easy to use and store in the shower.I received a coupon for a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest feedback...  please let me know if you have any further questions and I'd be happy to help you out.

The keratin I am finding is good for using a couple of times of week as it seems to provide more moisture than the other two.  After several days it makes my hair feel flat.  BUT, I still love it because it gives my hair the additional boost of moisture it needs every few days.  So, I just switch back and forth.When I buy shampoo/conditioners over the counter I usually have to buy 2 bottles of conditioner to one bottle of shampoo.  With these I am able to use the same amount of conditioner to shampoo...  which is awesome!I also love the design of the bottles...  love the pumps...  makes it easy to use and store in the shower.I received a coupon for a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest feedback...  please let me know if you have any further questions and I'd be happy to help you out.

I am a pistachio fanatic!  I eat them just about every day.  I also normally kept two bowls out all of the time as well.  One for the nuts and the other one to dump the shells.  I was the perfect reviewer for this item because since it arrived in the mail I have used it every single day.  I love the two in one feature because it does make it easier to dispose of those little shells.  It's made of a durable plastic, easy to wipe out and clean and small enough for your lap.  Great for kids who love to eat anything that has seeds or shells that have to be disposed because it's light, and unbreakable.  Our entire family eats pistachios and I would happily purchase this bowl in a larger size to accommodate the household.  I keep this one in the kitchen on the counter and just re-fill it when it empties.  But, I have to re-fill it several times a day because everyone in my house is eating them.  :)I love this product and highly recommend it to the pistachio lover, cherry lover...  well, you get the idea...I received a coupon for a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest feedback.  If you have any further questions/concerns please feel free to ask...  I'd be happy to help you out!  I've added a pic for you as well.

This is a really great wig for such a low price. It came very well packaged so it was perfect when we took it out of the box. Shipping was fast and efficient. My daughter is really into costuming/cosplay and she has a big collection of wigs. Her opinion on this one is that it is a great wig as long as you are wanting to keep the style of the hair as pictured. She would not recommend trying to re-style because the fiber/material the wig is made of would make it difficult. But, she loves it as is and is very happy with the way it looks.  This is a wig that will stay in good shape with proper storage, cleaning and care.  When you are cleaning and combing it has to be done so gently.  Rough handling of this wig will ruin the style and it will be difficult to get it back to the original style if it gets tossed about wrecklessly.  Definitely a great purchase if you are looking for a fun wig for dressing up/costuming and parties.I received this wig as a free sample in exchange for my honest feedback.  Please feel free to ask me questions about this product if you have any further questions or concerns. I have posted a few pics for you...  yes, she chose blue!  :)

This is not a stand alone! You must read Volume One first...This second book concludes the story and what a fantastic conclusion!  I've been waiting on the edge of my seat for months to read this... but it was totally worth the wait!  That ending...  just beautiful...  could not have been happier with the way this author tied everything up and pulled all of the pieces of the puzzle together.  This duo of books is definitely one of my top favorite PR reads this year.  It's original, engaging, sexy, mysterious, suspenseful..  a little bit of everything I love in a story.Once again I find it impossible to review this book without revealing any spoilers. And, because it's part two I really don't want to spoil it for anyone who hasn't read part one so that makes it twice has hard. But in summary...The overall story revolves around Denieve who came into the Frost world to investigate the mysterious Dr. Braeden Frost and the deaths that surround him.  Her best friend, who was one of those mysterious deaths, brought her there and yes, she is a ghost.  Dr. Frost has a twin brother named Xavier and Denieve finds herself mysteriously attracted to both men and she is conflicted as to why. They are complete opposites in every way and the two of them just don't make sense.  This is where the author truly showed her talent.  The way she resolved this triangle of love is one of the most original storylines I've ever read.  Two men... two sides of the same coin... sharing one heart... one soul... but also completely divided and conflicted.  My heart was torn between both of them.  As book one ended I was totally team Xavier because he was such a delicious and sexy bad boy.  But when I learn the truth about who they both are, I was just as divided as Denieve...  and, I was in love with both of these mysterious men.  An impossible situation that the author so successfully pulled together in a way that will make EVERYONE happy.  :)  Just a beautiful and unique love story that had me all smiles at the end and maybe even shedding a little tear or two.I really can't recommend this series enough for the PR fan!

This is the first time I have ever used coconut oil and I have to say...  I am a fan!  My main purpose for this oil is for popping popcorn.  I love oil on my popcorn and decided I needed a healthier alternative.  This is perfect for that and it makes the popcorn taste really good.  Add a little sea salt to the popcorn and that makes it even better.  This is a very generous amount of coconut oil and smells really good when you open the lid.  I expect it to last a really long time.  It does come in a plastic container, but that doesn't really bother me to much.  I know some people prefer glass.  But, just pour it into a glass storage container and there you go...  problem solved.I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest feedback.  Please feel free to ask me any questions if you have any concerns or need additional feedback.

I'm not an athlete but I am a woman going through menopause and get hot flashes on a regular basis.  This product is great to have around when you need a quick cool down.  Especially at night.  The nice thing about this towel is that it isn't drippy when you wet it down.  It stays cool for a long time.  So, when you wake up in the middle of night with a hot flash you can wrap this around your neck and keep it there to help stay cool.  It's also very portable.  I have a friend who also used this same product as a cancer patient.  She had lost her hair and would wet this down and wrap it around her head when she had a fever or when she was hot in general.  It really worked well for her and it's not something I would have thought of so just thought I'd add that in for others.  Great product!

This is a beautiful set!  Perfect for gifting and very easy to use.  Comes elegantly displayed in a nice black box and I love the sleek stainless steel/black color.  This is a high quality set.  I've been using it for 3 weeks now and it makes opening wine a breeze.  I have an older mechanism that we've been using for over 10 years and this one is just as sturdy.  I do expect this to last long term like my old one.  Would definitely choose this as a gift item for someone who loves wine.

This glove does have some benefits but heat resistance is not one of them.  It is not insulated and when I used it to take my baking dish out of a 375 oven it only took seconds for me to begin to feel the heat coming through the glove.  A piece of the glove got snagged on the edge of one of the racks in the oven and that one snag spread quickly into a really big hole in one of the fingers.  The cloth just started flaking away from the tear.  So, also not a very durable glove.  I would not recommend using this glove for extreme heat...  especially for something that you will need to carry or hold for longer than a few seconds.  I just feel like it's not safe.  I will keep this next to my stove and use it for moving my stainless steel pots around because sometimes the handles and lids get really hot.I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest feedback.

This is a great starter set for measuring.  Durable and dishwasher safe...  easy to clean and use.  I have a pyrex measuring bowl similar to this one and it is equal in quality.  I also have another set of stainless steel measuring spoons and cups and they are also equal in quality to those.  Very sturdy cups and spoons that won't bend or warp.  Yes, I would recommend these...I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest feedback.  Please feel free to ask me any questions and I'd be happy to help you out.

This is a nice set.  We have one of those really nice egg grills that can be used as an outdoor oven and we use it to make pizzas.  It gets really hot so having a large spatula is a must.  This is our second set, we have one similar to this one in another brand.  They are both great except the handle on the spatula with this set tends to loosen and we have to tighten it up every now and then.  Our other set has really nice handles on it that will definitely last longer but we also did pay a lot more for them.  So, if you're looking for something affordable that will get the job done then yes, I would recommend this one.  If you hand wash and refrain from soaking the handles in water they should last a long while.I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest feedback.  Please feel free to ask me any questions if you have them and I will do my best to help you out.

I was first introduced to Tanya Holmes when I read Within Temptation. It was one of my top favorite books last year. So, yes, I was looking forward to something new from her and she did not disappoint! This book blew my mind... I LOVED it! Another one to add to my top favorites this year.This is a book that you must go into blind. Stay away from those overly descriptive reviews that reveal anything about the plot. The element of surprise is what made this book so good. This story is incredibly engaging with a refreshingly original storyline that left me panting for more by the end! I seriously need the second part of this book right now... I can't believe I have to wait! It's killing me...Dr. Frost is such an incredibly complex character. He is mysterious, sexy and intriguing. The forbidden relationship that develops between him and Denieve has me both on edge but at the same time trying to figure out how the heck things are going to work out. There is a surprise character that steps into the picture that has me completely conflicted. Love/hate, love/hate... two emotions that has these characters so completely divided... and I mean that literally! Just read the book... you'll see what I mean. :)Yes, this book ends on a cliffy but I absolutely don't care... it's such a well developed storyline and I can see why splitting it into two books is necessary. But, if you don't want to be left hanging the second part comes out in the Fall and you can read them back to back.If you love Ghost stories, Paranormal Romance and suspense then you can't go wrong diving into this book. It is all those wrapped up into one well written story that definitely had me glued to the pages.Do I recommend?? Of course I do...  :)

Tiberius was the star player in this book! He was an awesome guy with such a touching back story. I really loved his character a lot. He had a tough childhood with an MIA father but somehow he managed to defy the odds around him and find success. He was determined to be the type of man his father wasn't.Tingly had to grow on me a bit. I didn't like the way she treated Tiberius for a good portion of the book. Tingly is a runner on the track team. And, perhaps that was why she spent so much time "running away" from him. :) It was okay at first because she is a little gun shy when it comes to men now. But it got to the point where I felt like she was just being overly dramatic.Tingly needed a guy like Tiberius to come into her life. He was patient, caring and liked to take things slow and easy. He wanted something real and whether she believed it or not, she needed that too. She was always taking things fast and because of that, she was missing out on an important part of forming a true relationship, which is friendship. I liked the way Tiberius was able to help Tingly actually stop and take notice of the little things that matter between couples. I think that was my favorite part of the story.This is a type of New Adult romance I had never read before and I thought it was refreshingly different. And, I love that it was an interracial romance but the focus wasn't necessarily on race. It was more about their attraction to each other.Very well written, engaging, heartwarming... pretty good NA... it ticks all the boxes!

This is one of those series that starts off with a trickle and ends with a bang!  Each book in this series just got better and better as these four gifted sisters slowly evolve into the powerful beings they were destined to become.  Watching them finally coming together to fulfill their purpose by the end was everything I hoped it would be and more.  They had traveled a long journey together, each finding their destined mates but they always held strong together and unified as sisters.  This series is sexy, engaging and suspenseful with a cast of characters that not only entertain, but also has you rooting for their HEA.  If you love Paranormal Romance, you can't go wrong with this set.  It ticks all of the boxes that we've come to expect from good PNR.  This is one of my favorite series and one I would highly recommend!

This was my first go at a mnage themed book. Even though I am not a fan of mnage, I thought the author handled the subject matter in a way that made me re-think the idea of what mnage can mean for some people in very unique circumstances. I think what made this work for me was that the mnage was more of a healing process for this couple's marriage. Jake feels he is less of a man now that he is paralyzed. He misses his once very spontaneous sex life he enjoyed with his wife. He hates that she has suffered right along with him. He gets this crazy idea that he could feel whole again by bringing in a surrogate lover for his wife. He approaches his best friend Chad, self-proclaimed bachelor for life, to be said surrogate. Chad and Jessie were hesitant to comply, but finally agreed in the hopes they can somehow help Jake heal. The journey that they began started off with rules in place and emotions in check, right?? Well, not exactly... :) They learn fairly quickly that emotions cannot be controlled and things kind of spiral in a direction that none of them had planned.We've all heard the expression that two halves make a whole. Well, in this case three parts made a whole. They seemed to complete each other in a way that I thought was truly exceptional and for all of the right reasons.This story is mostly about the power of friendship and that sometimes there is room in your heart to love more than one person. It's also about sacrifice, taking chances, and going the distance for those you care about most.It was very engaging, and for someone who really isn't a fan of mnage, I thought that this particular story portrayed a unique situation in which mnage can sometimes help fill in the gaps between three people who were all broken in some way. They were stronger together.I really liked it and if you're curious about mnage then this is a great book to start with. Even though it does include some very steamy sex scenes, It is not written only for the sex!
