It's meant to make you stop and consider the possibility of both the consequences and beauty that can come as a result of such a relationship.Lots of room for discussion with a book like this... it had me on edge for the entire last half. I was hurting for all of them.Sexy... suspenseful... emotional... a pretty darn good read for a book I wasn't even sure I was going to like! Glad I took the chance and gave it a go.

I've been using these for several weeks now and I have to say I am impressed by their durability in the kitchen.  I wasn't sure about the silicone and when I opened the box I was sure they would melt in high temperatures or hold stain.  But, they are quite sturdy, easy to clean and the blue is very pretty!  I have a blue themed kitchen so they look nice in my utensil holder I keep next to the stove.  I used these with spaghetti sauces, chocolate and other staining type food products, and I have washed them in the dishwasher multiple times and they still look new.  I am satisfied that this is a good product for the price.If I notice any changes in wear and tear over the next few months I will stop by and update my review.  But, as of now, yes I would recommend this product.I received a free sample in exchange for my honest feedback.  Please feel free to ask me any questions if you are not sure if this is the right product for you.

This is a very useful gadget to have in the kitchen when you want to chop up something quickly and you only need a small amount.  It has two blades that are easily switched out by popping them in and out of the top.  The container that catches the pieces slides easily in and out of the device.  One blade chops the food into small strips and the other chops into small squares.  It does not mince...  so, if you're looking for a garlic mincer then this is not what you want.  The grater works well enough for quick grating...  it's small so don't expect it to handle large tasks!We found this very useful for stir frying and making homemade pizza.  Those times when you sometimes want the slightly chunkier pieces of garlic.This is dishwasher safe and fairly easy to clean.  The only problem I had was that the top part of the lid gets food debris caught in it so I had to use a scrubber that can get in between the rows to dig it out.  Not a big deal but just throwing that out there for knowledge sake.I like this product and it will be useful for those small chopping jobs when you just don't feel like pulling out the cutting board and knife!I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest feedback.  Please feel free to ask me any questions if you are unsure of this product and it's performance.  I'd be happy to help you decide if this is the product for you.

A few tears, a few giggles, a lot of sexual tension! I do love this series and I was happy to see Ryan open to finding happiness again. LOVE the kiddos... kids always make stories a little more interesting don't they?? :)My heart went out to Ryan as he struggles to take care of his three children on his own. But, he is a wonderful father and wants nothing more than to protect and safeguard his children. The death of his wife is surrounded by unfortunate circumstances that will always haunt him. I love how he always puts the children first, even putting his career on hold to find something that works around his now full time job as a single father.When Holly strolls into town to work on the movie being filmed, this kind of throws a kink in his plans. She wakes up longings and urges that has him struggling with feelings of guilt and worried about the consequences of bringing a new woman into his children's lives.Holly is very attracted to this rugged, sexy but simple living mountain man who sees her just as a regular person. Always being the center of attention as a successful actress doesn't always lead to trusting relationships. She sees something potentially real with Ryan for the first time in her life. What started out as a hello, leads to many nights of getting to know each other on his front porch steps. Except for one thing... Ryan is unaware of her fame. His need to protect his children just might become the one thing that keeps them apart.I loved the slow pace of this relationship. It made sense considering the emotional struggles of Ryan. It wouldn't be easy to open yourself up to a new relationship when the wounds of his loss were still so fresh. He had to make peace with his feelings of guilt.I loved the easy way the children accepted Holly. Sometimes we need to look at life through the eyes of a child before we can see what's right in front of us.Great installment to this series... great couple with great chemistry and of course we get to re-visit the Pine Harbour gang and get an update on how everyone is doing! Lots to look forward to in the future of Pine Harbour.This is a great series for fans of Small Town Romance who also like a little steam thrown in for good measure. Heartwarming stories that continue to win me over with each installment.You probably could read this as a stand alone but I would highly recommend starting with book one and going in order so that you know Ryan's back story and the History of his relationship with his wife.

This was a very quick and easy read. Lots of laugh out loud moments but also very heartfelt and sweet. Kate and Trevor were a really great couple with some amazing sexual chemistry. At times I forgot that these two were older and in their thirties. They were behaving like teenagers when it came to the sex. I guess you're never to old to be young! :)Kate is a widow just trying to find her way after the loss of her husband. My heart went out to Kate and how she struggled with his absence from her life. It's a hard thing to overcome, losing someone you connected with so well. She eventually writes a best selling novel which leads her to a talk show where she meets the very famous and sexy rock star... Trax aka Trevor.They have an instant attraction that was very entertaining and amusing. They were an unlikely match being so completely opposite in every way, but at the same time so very perfect for each other.Kate is a small town, easy living girl who lives in quiet Montana. Trevor is the big city world traveler rock musician and his world is very loud and large. Being with Trevor is a bit overwhelming and Kate struggles with her need to stay in her safe haven of Montana or take a risk at second chance love. Being in the public eye all of the time is something she will have to accept if she wants to be with this guy and she's not sure if she can handle the pressure.Trevor really is an AMAZING guy... he has a dirty past but he doesn't lie about it. He is always upfront, honest and he is ready for something real. He's at that point in life where it's time to move on from the fan girls who only want him for his fame and fortune. My favorite part of the book was when he went to great lengths to show up in small town Montana to see her. It showed a softer and very real version of him that was hard not to love.Sometimes fate brings people together, and that is how I looked at this couple. They had both traveled down difficult roads and had arrived at a sort of crossroads where it was time to take a new path. They each needed something that the other person was able provide so they could take a chance at happiness. So, they both took a risk and took the road less traveled.One of my favorite characters was definitely Kellan. He was her fashion consultant and a bit of a stinker... lol... the Fashionista/Matchmaker! He was definitely a very colorful character that provided some very entertaining comic relief.My only complaint about the story really is that I was a little put off by all of the constant sex talk. It got to be a little over the top. It seemed like every conversation they had led to that and it was a little irritating.I also did not like the way Kate just couldn't seem to find a way to communicate with Trevor. Her feeling uncomfortable with the idea of moving on was justified, but leaving him hanging in the air all of the time was not okay. I felt like she over-reacted badly in the end. She's thirty years old... she knew that was bound to happen. Shutting him out without talking to him was cruel. Thank goodness Trevor was a patient and determined man.Other than those two minor grievances, this was overall a great story with great characters and a very enjoyable read.Yes, I would definitely read something else by this author... really, really good for a debut novel.

This is a PR series that I've seen floating around for a while but just haven't found the time to start. So, when netgalley was offering copies of book one for review I thought... why not see what all of the fuss is about. :)I think what I liked most about the book is that it is a very unique storyline involving a new type of species I haven't read before anywhere else... The Psy. They reminded me of the Vulcan race in Star Trek. All logic and no emotion. The only difference is that they were not designed this way, they were taught to conform to this lifestyle through a movement called the Silence. Emotions and feelings are now considered "flaws" in this race and any sign of it means you will end up in rehabilitation. In other words, you are destined to become a vegetable because your mind will be stripped. It's a very cruel and confusing world that had me wondering why they went to such great lengths to eradicate emotions from their people. Sascha knows that she is flawed and has spent her entire life pouring all of her energy into masking them because for her rehabilitation is a fate worse than death.Sascha finds herself in the company of Lucas as business partners. An unusual partnership but a necessary one for him because they are desperate to find out who is killing changeling women and they are certain that the Psy are involved. He is hoping to gain entrance into the Psy-net through Sascha so they can gather information to help them find the killer.Meeting Lucas has sent Sascha spiraling into a world of feelings and emotions that she can no longer keep under control. Lucas introduces her to a world of passion and desire. She becomes a slave to the sensations she has always been denied. It also means certain death for her because this type of behavior is not tolerated in her world.There is a lot going on in this story between the Psy and their desire for control and power and the inner workings of all of the different changeling groups. So, not a book that you can breeze through quickly. You have to read it carefully so you are able to figure out this complicated Psy-net.My only complaint about this story is the direction things went when Lucas finally realizes that Sascha is his destined mate. He became a little bossy and overbearing for my liking and I was a little disappointed that this suddenly took precedence over finding the kidnapped changeling girl who they KNEW was being tortured. Not really the best time to be claiming your mate. Sascha was way too independent to cower to his demands so easily. So, I thought that was a little far fetched. I think I would have preferred a slower coming together of Sascha and Lucas and more time spent hunting for the kidnapped woman. It just took way too long for them to resolve the case. So, the last half of the book I found a bit frustrating. I lost a lot of love for Lucas at putting this young woman's life in danger and allowing her to be tortured longer than necessary because he was being all alpha male. I know, I know... he's a changeling and they are slaves to their instinct to protect their mate.. yada yada yada.. lol. It still bugged me...Having said that, I love the Psy World and yes, I'm definitely on board to continue with the series. Now I just have to find time to squeeze in 13 more installments because this series has been out for a while. Wish me luck! :)

"They say time heals all wounds. But does it close the gaps too? Maybe it can. Maybe in a year it turns an eight-year time gap into dust. Maybe it turns a girl who didn't know what she wanted into someone who became certain. Maybe it turns twenty-one stolen kisses into endless given ones."And that pretty much entails the struggles that Kennedy and Noah are having with this sweet, forbidden, beautifully written romance!  This is probably my favorite Lauren Blakely book to date! I loved this story so much. The author pegged the conflicted emotions of a 17 yr old young woman perfectly. What a conflicting age, anyone remember being seventeen?? :)This is the first time I've read anything outside of LB's erotica series. I will admit that I was worried that I wouldn't like it, but she has now proven to me that she is indeed a beautiful and talented story teller.Kennedy is a girl who has grown up surrounded by shame and lies because of a mother who is in denial of her sex addiction. She would use Kennedy as her scapegoat and it is now beginning to weigh heavily on her conscience. It has given her a warped sense of love and whether or not it is actually something people can truly have. In fact, Kennedy is obsessed with love. She looks for signs of it everywhere. Her collection of hearts was very symbolic of her hopes and dreams that love can be something tangible and real. This was my favorite part of the book. It became a sweet and romantic game between her and Noah. I loved it... :)Noah works for Kennedy's mother. They have a very close relationship. His closeness to the family is what sparked the seeds of interest between him and Kennedy. He never set out to fall in love with her. But, the heart wants what it wants! They were perfect for each other. Noah wasn't blind to the age gap, in fact, he was very conflicted about it, but she completed him in ways he never thought possible. Sometimes time is your enemy. And, these two just fell in love at the worst possible moment in both of their lives.Noah really was an outstanding guy. He never pushed Kennedy. He was always very patient and understanding but at the same time hopeful they could find a way to love each other openly and freely. My heart went out to both of them. I was rooting for them and hoping they could find a way to be together. But, at the same time I was thinking... "She's only seventeen!"... so, yes I was totally empathizing with Kennedy's father. What parent wouldn't be concerned about an 8 yr age gap when your daughter is only 17. But, love is love and it doesn't care about timing.Kennedy's relationship with her mother really got to me. Even though she hated what her mother was doing, she still loved her. But, she could no longer allow herself to be defined by her mother's actions. She had to make a very hard choice at the end and I was very proud of her for the decisions she made. Sometimes, you just have to save yourself.I'm not sure why this book spoke to me so much. Perhaps it's because I have 3 daughters of my own... or, maybe it stirred up a lot of familiar emotions. It's kind of hard to put into words. But, this book will definitely be going into my top favorite reads of the year so far. It's a book I plan to read again and again...

This is such a fun and clever series... lots of giggles... I really liked book one, but I liked this second installment even better than the first. Aphrodite cracks me up... Love Goddess aka Vampire killer!Aphrodite and Loki make a really fun couple as Gods trying to cope with living in modern society. Aphrodite is now a love columnist and Loki is working as a supernatural Private Investigator. Since Gods are no longer worshipped in modern times, they do not have the same powers as they once had. Loki's big plan is to solve crimes for those in need in exchange for loyalty so he can gain back some of his lost powers. Aphrodite, still pretty well known as the goddess of love, isn't as powerful as she used to be but still has more power than Loki. He hates that he needs her but what choice does he have?? They have a very lustful relationship that is also quite entertaining!This is very well written, definitely entertaining and has me looking forward to the next installment... can' wait to see what kind of trouble these two find next...

This is a beautiful digital scale!  5 stars for appearance....  looks really sharp in my bathroom.  :)My favorite feature of this scale are the three weight settings:  Pounds, Stones or Kilograms...  I've never had a scale before that calculated stones so that's a really nice feature. This has a power save feature as well...  it will automatically power off when not in use for longer battery life.  The scale will give you an error prompt of Lo when it's time to replace with 2xCR2032 batteries.  Does come with a warranty as well.This is made of tempered glass which makes it very attractive but also more delicate than a metal scale.  So, handle with care!  We've been using it for 2 weeks and it's holding up well so far.  If you were to drop it on hard tile I imagine it would crack.My only negative about this product is that I can't find a way to calibrate the scale.  I generally use a dumbbell to measure the accuracy of the weight.  On my old one, we have a way to adjust when it's a little off.  Can't do that with this one.  It's about .4 higher than it should be...  so, I just have to know to subtract .4 from the weight.  This might seem a little petty but some people really need an accurate weight if they are keeping up with their weight loss or gain.Overall, this is a great product and I would recommend it.I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest feedback.

My daughters and I are tea enthusiasts... we love trying out different types of teas.  If you aren't sure what you like then this sampler box is definitely a good place to start.  I actually found a new favorite:  Premium Caramel Black Tea!  Oh my goodness...  loved it!My girls loved all of the flowering teas because it's fun to watch the tea brew.  So, they brewed and I tasted...  :)I'm not going to list what's in the box because that's already in the description for you to peruse but these are great tasting teas...  well, depending on what you like of course.I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest feedback.

I collect tea pots...  I have them in all shapes and sizes.  There are some tea pots you buy for every day use and others you pull out for special occasions.  This would definitely fall into the special occasion only category because it is very delicate.  The lid does not lock in place so you do need to hold the lid when pouring so that it doesn't fall off and break.  The infuser that goes inside the pot is also glass so it is important to handle this pot carefully through the entire process of brewing the tea.It's a BEAUTIFUL tea pot...  I have another one almost exactly like it but it's very plain compared to this one.  I've attached a picture of the two of them together so you can see the difference in size and appearance.  This is a perfect pot for the flowering teas because you can actually see the tea brewing.  And, because this is such a pretty pot it's nice to use when you have a single guest over.  It measures out to around 2 cups of water....  so it will fill either one large mug of tea or two small.So, a lovely item to have...  but, not ideal for every day use.I did receive a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest feedback!If you're looking for something sturdy and long lasting for every day use, I would not recommend this pot.  I don't think it would last long

I had no idea what to expect when I decided to dive into this book... the title definitely makes you think... oh boy! But, what I got was something really different from other books I've read lately. Hailey, our heroine, is a little chubby and doesn't always feel comfortable in her own skin. She has a crazy wealthy family that makes her life difficult and she doesn't really fit in with their reckless lifestyle. Due to unfortunate events involving her self absorbed sister she finds herself under the watch of a bodyguard that she hates but is also undeniably attracted too. Utter misery right?? Or, not... I don't think she knows how she feels.Cole is a man that I can already tell is a bit damaged... he is drawn to the very sexy and curvy Hailey even though he knows she is off limits. Not just because she's the daughter of a client, but because she's a woman that he might not be able to walk away from and he doesn't want to see her get hurt. I get the feeling that he doesn't feel as if he's good enough for her.These two have gotten off to a shaky start together but I find myself really hoping they can find a way to sort out their differences!They have a an unpleasant relationship outside the bedroom, but when they do come together... we see a side of Cole that just makes me melt and want for more. I already love this guy...Anyway, this story took me by surprise and I really liked it... a lot...This is part one of a three part serial... can't wait for the next installment!

This is a novella... short & fast paced... it gives us a little romance, a little steam, a little action and a nice fulfilling HEA. This was a nice addition to the series but I'm not as big a fan of the shifters as I am of the Elves, Demons and Hunters. This short addition is focused solely on Cavanaugh and Eloise and their coming together finally after 5 long years of separation. Most of the book is them traveling back to his village and re-connecting with each other as they make the long journey home. The action comes in at the very end when Cavanaugh finally challenges the Alpha!I love this series immensely and I'm anxiously awaiting for the upcoming novels such as Taken by a Dragon and Bleu's story... yep... I need those like right now!

Felicity Heaton... you have made my day! I am so excited to head into the dragon shifter world now... :) Big surprise in this one for fans of the series! Nope, not gonna' tell... but I am giggly excited about it!Cait is one delectable hellcat and unfortunately she's lured the attention of an unwanted male. She happens upon Owen in a bar after a slim getaway and she hires him to help rid her of this pesky stalker. It doesn't take long for them to realize that their attraction to each other is definitely more than physical. It didn't seem like a match that would be able to work at first with Owen being human, but... he had a few surprises and so did she. They both got a little more than they bargained for in this relationship but by the end I don't think anyone was complaining.As with all of Felicity's books you get a story that is edgy, action packed, steamy and full of a little surprises. Add to that some very creative characters and there is always something to look forward to in future installments.This book definitely sets the stage for the future and it's always nice to see a guest appearance or two of some of our favorite characters in the series. Can we just make it a mandatory requirement that Bleu makes an appearance in all of the books?? Yep, I always like it when he shows up.The book I've been really, really waiting for is up next! Taken by a Dragon Can't wait...

This was hot, steamy and oh so delicious! Great start to this new erotica series by Scarlett Avery... :)I love the relationship that is slowly developing between these two. They seem to be a perfect match for each other and they have great, great chemistry together. Ciara certainly got more than what she bargained for with this casual encounter! The gorgeous, wealthy, dirty talking Nicolaj definitely won her over in the passion department. Now we'll have to see if he can win her heart and break down Ciara's emotional barriers. He has his work cut out for him if he wants to win her trust. I have a feeling that he isn't going to give up. I think she made an impact on him that he just can't walk away from. Looking forward to the chase... :)This is part one of a 5 part serial and I'm looking forward to part 2!

What an amazing and beautiful story... loved every word! This is one of those books that makes you stop and think about all of the little moments in your life that matter most. Moments that we usually take for granted until they are gone. I knew this was going to be an emotional read. Yes, I definitely shed a few tears. But, it was also surprisingly suspenseful. The dreams/visions Kate was having with her deceased husband had me on edge and quickly turning the pages. What did they mean??Kate lost her husband Patrick twelve years ago. In an attempt to finally move on with her life she decides to settle into a relationship with Dan with the nudging encouragement of her friends and family. She begins having very vivid dreams of an alternate life with her deceased husband Patrick... the life she was intended to have. The dreams are upsettingly painful and real. Kate found herself wanting to stay in this alternate world where everything was playing out as it should have. Or, at least that's what she thought. These dreams reveal situations and truths to her that would be impossible for her to know and forces her to take a closer look at the life she is presently living. Kate finds herself questioning everything about her present life and whether or not she is doing what would make her feel happy and fulfilled.I loved how the author so beautifully tied the dreams with reality. The progression of the suspense was perfect and had me guessing all the way to the end of the book. And, the way everything came full circle in the end was utter perfection!My favorite part of the story was the inclusion of the silver dollars. The way the silver dollars ended up being one of the biggest signs of all in the end made my heart happy. Don't think I'll ever look at a silver dollar again without thinking about this book. It was so touching...This is a book I would definitely recommend to anyone who likes to read stories that touch on the emotions and makes you look at life with a new set of eyes. My favorite lesson I learned from this book??Sometimes bumps in the road lead you to better places. :)

Erotica by Lauren Blakely always puts a big smile on my face. I've loved every book in this series but this one is definitely my absolute favorite!  This is a perfect choice for fans of friends to lovers storylines.  Nate and Casey are so amazing together... the chemistry between these two was extremely erotic and steamy!Casey is an Alpha Female business woman... she knows what she wants and goes after it but she has a little trouble in the romance department. She took a hit on her self confidence in the bedroom by an ex. Having decided she needed to learn to be more submissive and give up control, she turns to her best friend Nate for guidance and lessons.Nate, having been burned by love in the past is perfectly content with his playboy lifestyle. He's always been fiercely attracted to Casey but never crossed that line due their strong friendship. But, he simply can't turn down an opportunity to be with her, even if it is just temporary.Each time they come together, the emotions and connection that they feel for each other gets stronger and stronger. The author did such a beautiful job describing their intimate connections, feelings and emotions.  I could feel their passion, need and love for each other so strongly.  For me this was so much more than just erotica...  it was a beautiful love story as well.I really liked that Nate helped Casey to understand that she should never change who she is for anyone else. I loved his character immensely... a lover of animals, a juggler, a babysitter! But most of all... a man who knows how to love a woman with all his heart. He's my new favorite ideal man!There is one scene in the book that I have gone back and read several times because I loved it so much... I have to share it... it is the best kissing scene I've read in a while: (view spoiler)The kiss told her so much... that he was sorry for being late, that he'd missed her for the last several hours he'd been without her, and that this was the best part of his day. Hers too. This kiss was air, it was breath, and it was her heart on her sleeve. In the soft, slow sweep of his lips, in the hungry sighs they both made, in an instant, this kiss was everything. Her heel popped up. There it was. The final proof that no one had ever kissed her like he did, and no one probably ever would.**sigh** I heart you Lauren Blakely... :)))Do I recommend?? Of course I do...

The Chef Cuts four pack contains regular steak, cracked pepper chipotle steak, smoked turkey and honey bbq chicken.  I'm not the biggest fan of jerky around, but all four varieties were pretty tasty.  The jerky had a nice chew and was not leathery like jerky can be.  You know you were eating the cut of meat you chose and not some amalgamation of mystery meat.  The cracked pepper chipotle had a nice kick of heat and was the most interesting flavor.  The honey bbq chicken was the least successful as it was was more honey than bbq but it still was flavorful.  This is a pricey buy for what amounts to 10 ounces of jerky, but the quality is high and flavor is there.  You can buy the same weight of other brands that basically cost what you are paying per ounce, but you sometimes get what you pay for.

This sterling silver locket is a beautiful keepsake to give to that someone special in your life.  The flower design on the front adds a pretty splash of color that you normally don't see on heart shaped lockers.  The locket is sturdy and easy to open.  The one you love can keep a picture or some other momento that they cherish close to their hearts while wearing this affordable but very well crafted piece of jewelry.

Zak Designs makes all their products out of recycled materials so you can feel good about purchasing their products.  The seven piece salad serving set is durable, sharp looking with their classic confetti look and perfect for the warm months of the year as you can use them outside on your deck or patio without fear of breakage.

The Sunbeam stand mixer has been around for almost ninety years and it is a timeless classic.  The mixers comes with three different mixing paddles, the beaters, whiskers and the hooks.  The 12 speed dial is conveniently labeled with what each speed will accomplish.  Unlike the Kitchen Aid which has different attachments like meat grinders and ice cream churners, the Sunbeam just mixes and it does it incredibly well.  These machines are insanely durable and with proper care can last decades.

Super cute and cool looking case that nicely protects your iPhone and allows you to carry a couple of credit cards or ID's.  You really can only get two cards in the slots as if out any more you can't close the case.  There is a side slot where you can fold up a couple of bills of money, but again ant more than that and case won't close.  It comes with two styluses which are unnecessary these days, but you have if you want them.

This necklace and bracelet set from Amazon is a really great looking set of jewelry.  The necklace has a cut out of an old timey looking key with an inscription that reads here is the key to my heart and the bracelet has the key as a link.  It is a clever idea and is a perfect sentiment to give to someone you love in your life.  The pendant is a nice size although the chain might be too short for some.

Calvin Klein's Obsession has a strong musky smell.  The description describes mandarin as a top note, but I get more of the musk and sandalwood scent.  This makes it more wearable than a cologne with fruity overtones.
This charm is a must for any fan of Winnie The Pooh.  Although it can be put on a charm bracelet, the charm's size is much better suited for necklace wearing.

These Diamond Clean knockoffs work just as well as the ones from Sonic and the best part is the price.  For about a quarter the price you get brushes that work equally as well and give your teeth a fresh clean.  Even if they don't last quite as long as the originally, they last long enough that you will more than make up for that in the cost.

The Charles River rain coat is a very functional and stylish looking rain coat.  It has a cool looking reflective stripe that runs across the back and down the zipper that adds a level of protection for those darker rainy days.  The jacket has some heft to it so it is not flimsy.  The only negative is that color is not as pink as the picture shows.  The picture makes it look like bubble gum pink, but the color is darker and looks like there is some purple mixed in.

Dreft's wash in scents have a pleasant powder fresh smell.  They actual smell a lot better in the container than they do when you use them.  This is a decent product that does add a bit of a nice smell to your clothes but is not really worth purchasing at the Amazon list price.

This Stainmaster 5x8 carpet is a quality area rug with a pleasing color scheme that makes it easy to incorporate into most home designs.  The gold, yellow and brown pattern is subtle and won't overtake the space you put in.  The carpet material feels like it will be durable, but not in an area with heavy foot traffic.  It feels just a little too delicate to place right in a doorway, but I haven't had it long enough to form an exact opinion on that front.  It is Stainmaster, so it is made to be easy to clean and maintain.

Former Village Voice restaurant critic Robert Sietsema has seen food trends come and go through his decades of covering the food scene in New York City.  In his new book, New York in a Dozen Dishes, he distills the city down into those twelve dishes (plus one iconic NYC dessert) and shows how they've evolved from mainly ethnic kitchens into mainstream foods beloved by everyone from the blue collar outer borough types to the hipsters that proliferate the hot spots of the city.  Some choices are obvious.  It would be impossible and sac religious to not have pizza and pastrami as two of the dishes and Mr. Sietsema details the rise of these dishes from their Italian and Jewish neighborhoods to being two of the dominate staples of the NYC food scene that attract people from all over the world to come and try. Mothers are not so obvious like Masala Dosa and Cuy, but Mr. Sietsema shows why they are no less important the the city's culinary backbone than the more recognizable selections.  Each chapter in addition to giving the history of the food provides a dozen or so of the best places to get the dish in the city as well as a recipe for the dish.

What more can you say about Babyganics laundry detergent other than it does a good job cleaning your clothes.  It does have a nice scent which is a plus, but it didn't do any better or worse than most every other laundry detergent I've every used with regards to cleaning my clothes.  I put them in dirty and Babyganics got them clean.  It is highly concentrated so a little does go a long way and the ingredients list will make you feel safe for use on your baby's clothes.

These New Balance golf shoes look super sharp and fit nicely.  The "spikes" allow for good grip and balance during your swing.  The shoe feels like your wearing a sneaker, but has the look of a traditional golf shoe.  They are not the cheapest shoe on the market, but are reasonably priced as far as similar types of shoes on the market.

Nature Valley's Salted Caramel Peanut Crisp bars are a tasty treat that are a decent alternative to candy bars.  While high in sugar, they do contain oats, sunflower and pumpkins seeds which are better for you than most of the ingredients in your average candy bar. They will definitely satisfy your sweet tooth with the salted caramel bottom.  The bars are not exactly what you would call health food, but they are made almost entirely of all natural ingredients which can make you feel a little bit better by choosing them over the standard vending machine snack selections.

The Superior six piece towel is not exactly what I'd call luxurious, more like basic and plain, but they are well made towels that feel soft to the touch and dry well.  You get two each of face, hand and bath towels and the fact that they are almost 100% white will mean. That they will go with just about any bathroom design you have.

Head & Shoulders two in one shampoo plus conditioner is great for a guy who wants to condition their hair but doesn't want to take an extra step in the shower to do it.  After using it, my hair is much easier to comb after washing it and although it doesn't look thicker it does feel thicker to the touch.  Plus if your head is dry like many of ours are during these winter months, it helps fight the flakes.

The Lifeproof Fre case for the iPad mini is certainly a functional case.  It says it can go two meters deep under water and still protect your mini.  I haven't tested that aspect of its protection, but I'll take their word on it. What I can say is that it tightly secures around the mini and is clear on both sides of the case so if you want to put a skin on the mini, it will remain visible while in the case.  The case isn't too bulky and the touchscreen works perfectly underneath the protective cover.  The reason I'm giving this only three stars is that it is extremely pricey.  While you can take the cover in the water, the rain, snow, etc., I don't think most people have a great use of an iPad in those conditions.  So unless you need to use your mini in those conditions, you can find a cover that will provide similar protection against every day normal use for much less.

Ne-Yo's sixth studio album Non-Fiction is a disjointed affair.  There are some great songs but a few too many clunkers to make this album anything better than just okay. "Integrity" is a simply gorgeous track with an impassioned vocal that soars right out of your speakers.  "One More" could be a great song, but the constant repeating of the title underneath the singing sinks it.  "Who's Taking You Home" is a solid track and "Time Of Our Lives" has an absolutely pumping beat but is sunk by the horrendous Pitbull supplying his annoying "rap" to the track.  "Coming With You" a solid thumping beat and slick groove, "Making It Easy" has a simple drum beat that gives a stark backbone to the track and "Money Can't Buy" is decent track with a sweet vocal.  "She Knows" has a great beat, but seems a little too calculated.

Released almost four years to the day of their last release The King Is Dead, The Decemberists return with the glorious What A Terrible World, What A Beautiful World.  The album finds the band taking their folk rock sound into a 70's AM pop direction.  There are tons of great hooks and a lushness littered throughout the album.  "Calvary Captain" employs a Chicago style white r&b sound in the best possible sense.  The sultry tongue in cheek ode to cunnilingus "Philomena" simply soars with a gorgeous orchestration.  "Make You Better" starts off with a subtle guitar riff and then explodes into a powerful blast of piano pounding and soaring vocals.  "The Wrong Year" is propelled by a sweet accordion fill and a jangly guitar.  "Carolina Low" has the dark and somber folk rock sound the band is known for and it is deep and rich. "Anti-Summersong" has a country fair vibe with fiddles and a harmonica break and "Easy Come, Easy Go" has a wickedly cool reverb guitar that punctuates the track.  "Mistral" floats in with an airy keyboard and piercing guitar.  "12/17/12" is an acoustic guitar and harmonica track that sounds like it would have fit in nicely on Bruce Springsteen's Nebraska album.  The album closes out on a strong and uplifting note with the anthem like "A Beginning Song".

Wallflower is a covers album from Diana Krall.  Ms. Krall's voice is in fine form and she does a great job with the tracks.  The problem with the album is that too many of the tracks are more or less Ms. Krall singing piano ballads drenched with strings that don't stray too far from the originals.  Where she excels is when she steps away from the color-by-numbers arragements.  The best track is The Eagles' "I Can't Tell You Why" in which she turns it into a smokey, jazzy, samba flavored number.  The song's original singer and co-author Timothy B. Schmit adds a luscious backing vocal that sends the song over the top.  Another song that has a nice arrangement (although it is almost sunk by too many syrup strings) is her piano driven reading of Crowded House's 80's classic "Don't Dream It's Over".  Her duet with Michael Buble on Gilbert O'Sullivan's "Alone Again (Naturally)" could benefit from a better arrangement, but hearing their two voices playing off each other is a treat.  Her other duet with Bryan Adams on Randy Newman's "Feels Like Home" is interesting because their voices are so similar that Ms. Krall could easily be the female Bryan Adams.  It'd be great to hear her tackle anything off of Cuts Like A Knife or Reckless.

The Birthday Cupcake gift card tin is one of the coolest I've received from Amazon.  It is perfect to give to that special person for their birthday or any other occasion that you want to show someone you care.

Bill Kreutzmann has been part of one of the most famous and well-known rock groups and cultural icons The Grateful Dead for 50 years.  Despite that fact, he is virtually unrecognizable and unknown to anyone other than a Deadhead.  He was the original Dead drummer, but Mickey Hart is the name that probably first comes to mind when you think Dead percussion.  With all that Mr. Kreutzmann seems like an unlikely candidate for a book, but his upcoming book Deal is a pleasant treat.  Playing with the band has its perks and Mr. Kreutzmann takes you on the Dead's long strange trip from the Kesey acid tests, to the Haight Ashbury scene and the summer of love to Monteray to Woodstock to Eyrope to the Great Pyramids of Egypt and beyond.  Mr. Kreutzmann tells his story in a way that even though he is the main voice, it's like his he removed from it all.  There are tons of great antidotes like when he and Jerry Garcia are scuba diving in Hawaii in 1980 and while down about twenty feet under the water a woman approaches Mr. Garcia and motions him for an autograph.  Mr. Kreutzmann knows he was very fortunate to be part of such a phenomenon like the Dead and his laid back, hippie attitude permeates the book and makes it a fun and enjoyable read.  If you're not a fan of the Dead, then this book is probably not for you, but any Deadhead should out Deal on their must read list.

Birdman is a bizarre, challenging and ultimately rewarding film.  Director Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu is the real star of the movie.  He shot the film in essentially one long shot. This gives the film a claustrophobic feel like the walls of the theater where the majority of the film takes place are closing in around you.  All the awards and praise Michael Keaton's performance as a washed up former action film star trying to stage a comeback and become relevant again are more than justified and deserved.  Mr. Keaton bares his soul and the slow unhinging of his character is fascinatwing and engrossing.  Edward Norton is also excellent as a pompous, self-important stage actor brought in at the last minute to the play.  He makes the character completely unlikeable and that's the point.  Emma Stone is also superb as Mr. Keaton's daughter who provides a slap in the face to his stage dreams.  Birdman is dark, deep and profoundly weird.  You'll find yourself wondering what the heck just happened but you will walk away from the film knowing you just watched an expertly crafted piece of art.

The T.S. Shure Map of the World Magnetic Playboard & Puzzle is a really cool puzzle that is completely magnetic.  It is quite detailed with the capitals of all the countries shown as well as other major cities in certain countries.  There are fun illustrations of life in each country such as kangaroos in Australia, hockey player and a mountie in Canada and a space shuttle flying off from Florida.  There are boats and ships in the waters and marine life as well.  You can't beat this puzzle for it's sheer coolness as well as the education factor.

The Intermatic combo pack contains two automatic timers for lights, one for inside and one for outside.  The timers are slightly flimsy in their construction, but are sturdy enough to get by.  The biggest problem with the timers is how you set them.  Inside of having a digital display, it is done by rotating the dial to set the time of day (you basically can only set on the hour or half-hour since anything else is just a guess as there are no other marks).  Then you stick two clips, one into the time you want the lights to go on and another to have them shut off.  The timers do what they're supposed to do, but there are far simpler and more accurate timers on the market in the same price range that make setting the timers so much easier.

The T.S. Share wooden alphabet letter magnets are really nicely made and look really sharp.  They are a fun way to teach kids their ABC's or just use on your fridge to decorate.  All in all it is a can't miss product and reasonably priced as well.

(500) Days Of Summer is an angst filled "love" story that annoyingly flashes back and forward in no discernible order.  Tom (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) works as a greeting card writer in Los Angeles despite the fact that he has a degree in architecture which is his true passion. He believes in true love to his core and that there is a soulmate for everyone. One day a new worker at the company, Summer (Zooey Deschanel), catches his eye and he is completely smitten.  They start dating even though Summer is the exact opposite of Tom and hates putting labels on relationships and doesn't believe true love exists.  They eventually break up after watching The Graduate and Tom sinks into a deep depression.  Summer quite the company, but they see each other again at a wedding and they share a dance.  Summer invites Tom to a party where he thinks they will rekindle their romance, but it turns out to be an engagement party for Summer.  They then again meet at Tom's favorite park and Summer, who is now married, confesses that Tom was right about true love and that she didn't feel that spark with him.  The whole 180 degree turn Summer has and the jumping into a quick marriage doesn't ring true with the set up of her character.  It seems ridiculous a commitment-phobe like her would suddenly not only find rue love which she didn't think exists, but then just get married all of a sudden.  The movie ends on day 500 with Tom waiting in the reception area of an architecture firm and striking up a conversation with a fellow interviewee (Minka Kelly) who he then ends up asking out for coffee.  She at first says she has plans to meet someone afterwards, but then changes her mind and accepts.  Her name is ridiculously Autumn.  The film starts off by telling you it isn't a love story but a story about love.  It is an interesting concept, but you never really buy Tom and Summer as a couple since Summer always seems to have one foot out the door.  Mr. Gordon-Levitt saves the film with his nuanced performance and it has an excellent soundtrack.

The Happiness Is cartoons are all over the place on Facebook (where you can create your own with suggestions) and this is a fun collection of 500 cartoons.  There are multiple cartoons per page and most are fairly small in size, but the book is a great gift to give to someone you love in life.  There are plenty of cartoons hat you can find that you can relate to your own happiness.

The 1-gallon Keystone Ultrasonic Humidifier is a decent machine that does a good job of adding moisture to the dry air that is the result of the constant heat running in your house during the cold winter months.  The machine is a nice compact size and can easily be hidden away in the corner of a room.  It is pretty quiet and fairly unobtrusive.  The instructions are pretty lacking, but it wasn't too difficult to get the machine running.  This is a a good, middle-of-the-road humidifier that does what it is supposed without any bells or whistles.

Lyricology makes some great signs by taking lyrics from famous songs and creating a theme on the sign around them.  This sign for Billy Joel's "Just The Way You Are" nicely captures the mood of the song and s a great gift to give to the one you love.

Ryan White's Springsteen: Album By Album is a coffee table retrospective of Mr. Springsteen's recording career.  There are tons of great pictures, but not much in the way of new information.  Despite that, it is an entertaining look at the man's career.  I'm more partial to his older work, so I would quibble with the heavy slant on his work from the last decade, but there are plenty of other books that look at his prior work to satisfy the curious.

Wes Anderson's The Grand Budapest Hotel is another winner in his impressive directing cannon.  Like much of his previous work the film is a dark comedy.  Told in a double flashback from a writer (Tom Wilkinson) in 1985 who remembers how he learned the story of his book (same as the film's title) from the former lobby boy Zero now owner of the hotel in 1968 (F. Murray Abram as Zero, Jude Law as the writer) of his adventures with the former concierge (Ralph Fiennes) in 1932.  It is a caper involving murder, theft of artwork, escape from prison and the impending war.  The rest of the cast is made up of cameos from the usual Wes Anderson troupe including Bill Murray, Jason Schwartzman, Edward Norton, Owen Wilson, Adrien Brody as well as Harvey Keitel, Willem Dafoe, Jeff Goldblum and Tilda Swinton among others.  Mr. Fiennes basically carries the film on his shoulders appearing in the majority of the scenes.  He pompous, effite and absolutely brilliant as M. Gustave.  Newcomer Tony Revolori is not quite up to Mr. Fineness high standards, but he does a nice job in his first major role.  Mr. Anderson's films are definitely an acquired taste and if you don't like his previous work then this one will not likely change your opinion of his work.  But for devotees, The Grand Budapest Hotel vaults to the top of his best of list right beside Rushmore.

Sirens is a comedy series from executive producer Denis Leary.  Mr. Leary starred in the long running Rescue Me and like that show, Sirens also follows a branch of public service, EMT's.  Unlike Rescue Me, Sirens is a straight comedy and a raunchy one at that.  It revolves around three partners Johnny (Michael Mosley), Hank (Kevin Daniels) and Brian (Kevin Bigley).  Johnny is the leader of the group and is in a relationship with Theresa (Jessica McNamee), Hank is gay and loves to move from guy to guy and Brian is new to the team and is struggling to find his place.  While there is some on the job humor, 95% of the jokes revolve around sex.  While some of it is funny, it gets tired after watching several episodes in which they try and put a new spin on essentially the same gag.  The cast is extremely likable (with Mr. Daniels standing out for his role) and that Saves Sirens from being a complete bore.

Season Five of Modern Family brought the show its fifth consecutive Emmy win for Outstanding Comedy Series.  While the season does not deliver the consistent laughs of other seasons, it is still funnier than most shows on television.  The season revolves around the planning for and the wedding of Mitchell (Jesse Tyler Ferguson) and Cam (Eric Stonestreet). There is also a trip with the entire family to Australia.  While this is the main storyline, the real star of the season is Ty Burrell as Phil.  He constantly is saying things that make his look like a fool and the physical comedy he shows between getting smashed in the face again with a radio controlled airplane, stung by a jellyfish, having an allergic reaction to vegemite and getting punched in the face by a kangaroo will have you rolling on the floor in hysterics.  He won a second and well deserved Emmy for the season.  Another big change is that Manny (Rico Rodriguez) and Luke (Nolan Gould) start high school and both of their voices have changed.  Luke's change is much more drastic and some of the things he does aren't as cute in a growing teen as they were when he was younger.  Overall, there are some bunker episodes in the season, but the show still elicits major laughs.

Lacoste L!ve has a scent that falls more towards the floral side of colognes. It is bright and citrusy.  This is not a cologne you'd want to wear for everyday, going to work use.  This is more a spring/summery scent that you wear for a night out on the town or a party.

Alan Light starts off the book by explaining how he was a huge fan of Prince's back in his high school/college days in Ohio, but he doesn't turn Let's Go Crazy: Prince & the Making of Purple Rain into a fanboy account of the film and album.  He offers a measured eye while getting into the heart and soul of both the film and the album.  While he fleshes out the story by offering up some details about Prince's days growing up in Minneapolis and his career leading up to Purple Rain and his time after it, the bulk of the book examines what went into getting the film made and the music recorded.  He offers many insights from the cast and crew of the film as well as the Revolution, but since Prince is notoriously closed lipped to the media, he can only offer archival interviews he conducted with the man.  This does not take away one bit from the fine job Mr. Light does in crafted a story about an artist as he made the leap from arising talent into a mega star.

Fall Out Boy is trying to become Maroon 5 on "Centuries".  Lead singer Patrick Stump has a heavily altered voice a la Adam Levine on most of his vocal tracks.  The music is trying to evoke an anthem like quality but just falls flat on that front.

Ellie Goulding's "Love Me Like You Do" from Fifty Shades Of Grey is trying to be moody, dark and mysterious but her squeaky voice ruins any chance of evoking those settings.  The music does call to mind those themes, but Ms. gelding's voice sinks this song.

Max Brenner is a world renowned chocolatier and this book is truly a love story between him and chocolate.  Although it is a recipe book, it doubles as a coffee table book with its larger size and the abstract art that takes the place of the normal food pictures that are the norm in the majority of cookbooks.

This book is a must for any Jets fan.  Each chapter is dedicated to a year from the 80's with the highs of the AFC championship appearance in beginning of the decade to the debacle that the team became as the decade wore on.  All the keys players contribute and if you came of age during the decade then this will bring you on a roller coaster trip down memory lane.
Love & Toast's Coconut & Honey perfume smells almost exclusively like coconut but it smells great. This isn't a overly fruity suntan lotion smell, but a smooth coconut scent.

If you are a fan of the artist Shag and the color pink, then this is for you.  The drink recipes are all intended to look pink and each one is on a card similar to a flash card kids use for school.  Each card contains the recipe on one side and a Shag drawing on the other.  As noted by the title, many contain the Pink Panther.  This is mid century modern cool.
Super cool looking wrist purse.  It is perfect for an outing where you want to carry a wallet, phone and other small items.

Do not go by the picture for this pendant.  It is incredibly tiny and smaller than the size of watch battery.  The picture is extremely misleading as it makes it appear to be a normal size.  The sentiment on the pendant is great and it saves it from being one star, but unless you are giving it to strictly for that reason, there is no reason to buy this piece.

The Sterling Silver Swarovski Snowman pendant is a beautiful piece of jewelry.  The pendant is quite large and the red stones add a perfect amount of color that really help to make the pendant pop.  For any special person in your life that loves snowmen, you can't do much better than getting this pendant.

The OXO Good Grips Steel Wine Stopper and Pourer is a reasonably priced and sturdy pourer.  The lever is easy to move between open and closed and the stopper provides a tight seal.  It does claim to aerate the wine, but it doesn't work up to the standards of an actual aerator.  This product does the trick as a stopper and pourer and the construction is solid and should last a very long time.

The OXO Good Grips All-in-Reach Shower Shelf is a step-up from most shower caddies.  First off it is so much longer and deeper than the average caddy.  The best part of the shelf is the top hook which grips tightly around the shower and stays in place unlike most other caddies that tend to slide.  The shelf holds a ton of bottles and even has two holes at either end where you can turn shampoo and soft soap bottles upside when they are getting near the end which is another great feature.The shelf really isn't any more expensive than smaller shelves and when you consider all the space you get, it is probably cheaper inch-by-inch.

The Nine Lives of Christmas stars former Superman Brandon Routh as a playboy firefighter named Zachary who loathes commitment and Kimberly Sustand as a veterinarian student named Marilee who has sworn off love until her schooling is complete.  The story kicks into gear when a stray cat named Ambrose takes root in the house that Zachary is restoring to flip.  He at first wants no part of the cat, but they end up becoming attached.  He meets Marilee at a supermarket where she helps him pick out food for Ambrose.  Their paths cross again when it turns out that Marilee works at Zachary's self-absorbed model girlfriend's father's pet store and the girlfriend has her father fire Marilee because she feels she disrespected her.  Zachary finds out about this and tries to go to apologize to Marilee who is in the midst of getting evicted from her apartment due to her cat Queen as it is a no pets apartment.  Zachary invites Marilee to stay in his spare apartment and she reluctantly accepts.  Through a series of shared moments, the two build a bond, but Zachary is loathe to admit it to himself.  A misunderstanding at a Christmas party leads Marilee to move out setting up a reunion on Christmas day where Zachary professes his love atop a fire truck.  The film is mindless fun.  Although it is set during Christmastime, the film is really a straight rom-com with some brief holiday moments sprinkled in to create a seasonal setting.

The grey corduroy Mitchell & Ness Eagles jacket is a beautifully made jacket with great pops of kelly green on the grey jacket.  The lining is a quilted kelly green that helps keep you warm without being too bulky.

The Pilot episode of Parks & Recreation does not give a clear indication of what the show would become.  The show was created by The Office producer Greg Daniels.  The show is presented in the same mockumentary style as The Office and it is clear they are trying to make the Leslie Knope (Amy Poehler) character into the female Michael Scott (Steve Carrell) from the other show.  Leslie is the deputy director of the Parks & Rec department in Pawnee, Indiana.  She does have some of the characteristics like her complete love of the town of Pawnee and government work that she will show throughout the series, but she is presented as being somewhat of a dimwit and is mocked and ridiculed by her co-workers instead of being beloved.  Tom Haverford (Aziz Ansari) is not the complete baller he will become, but he does love the flash.  He also just mocks Leslie every chance he gets.  Parks & Rec director Ron Swanson (Nick Offerman) hates the government, but is more buttoned up and wears suits.  Ann Perkins (Rashida Jones) is the most consistent character in terms of how she evolve during the series, while her boyfriend Andy Dwyer (Chris Pratt) is not a lovable dolt, but more of a conniver taking advantage of Ann's caretaking will she is nursing him with two broken legs.  The basis of the first season's episodes (and into the second), the pit is introduced at the first of many town forums.  The town engineer Mark Brendanawicz (Paul Schneider) is the Jim character on the show, the calm voice of reason amid all the craziness.  He is too laid back and a little boring, but is kept around as Leslie still burns a torch for him after they had slept together five years before.  You have to stick with the show because it evolves into the funniest show on tv, but it is lucky it survived the first several episodes.

The ASUS X205TA-DH01 11.6-inch Laptop is an incredibly light and compact laptop.  The machine is really best served as a device to surf the web, listen to music or watch movies.  It offers a larger screen than your standard tablet, but is still much smaller than an average laptop so your not gaining much by moving from a tablet if you are looking to do any heavy work on it.  I found the speed of the machine to be acceptable.  It's not lightning fast, but it doesn't drag either.  You can't expect to get everything you want in a machine that comes in at $199.  It is a great alternative for those who just can't get into tablets, but also hate lugging their full size laptops around.

Oxo Good Grips Simple Mandoline is another excellent product from the Oxo company.  The mandoline is sturdy and well made and the kick stand helps make using it steady and secure.  There are three settings for thickness and you can also julienne as well.  Storage is made easy by being able to secure the protective guard on the base of the mandoline.  You can usually expect Oxo products to be excellent values and top quality and this mandoline is no expection.

Waters' "I Feel Everything" has a big, bombastic rock sound that is just the right amount of over the top.  It has big, chunky guitars and a soaring chorus.  The singer's voice is a little too pedestrian, but over all this is a fun, good rock song.

"Giving Up" by Haerts is an uptempo dancy pop song that kind of drags along on the same note in the same vein without much change until the end when some fingersnaps break the monotony.  It doesn't sound distinctive enough to be a hit.

Canadian duo Electric Youth's "Runaway" has an airy synth that floats throughout the song and it gives its balance.  The vocals are breathy in the electronic style, but the song has more of a pop sense.  Its a tad bit generic in the musical stylings, but it is still a likable track.

Foxygen's "Coulda Been My Love" has a breezy late 70's California pop sound.  The layered and echoed vocals glide over a Todd Rundgren inspired groove.  There is a plucky guitar and swirling keyboard that has an ethereal sound and is lush and gorgeous.

Nikki Yanofsky's "Necessary Evil" has a nice balance of sophistication and pop sensibilities.  Since Ms. Yanofsky is rooted in jazz, the song has a jazzy vibe, but balanced off with a pure pop sound and her vocal is powerful but controlled.  It derves to be a hit.

German duo Milky Chance's "Stolen Dance" is an acoustic based track that plods along at a coma inducing pace with a vocal that sounds like the singer has a taken some flu medication.  Boring, listless and and unispiring.
I guess I shouldn't be surprised, but even the XL version didn't fit my giant skull. I had high hopes, but it didn't work out.

I bought these as replacements in case the connectors ever broke off on my 5.8GHz video transmitters, or if I ever needed to replace an RP-SMA one. Turns out, I've had to do both things. These are a great replacement, and are easy to install. You can even uninstall them cleanly if you have a high temp iron and a solder sucker. The threaded section is a bit longer than necessary, but it doesn't really get in the way.

What can you really say about them? They're nice, tiny, and bright LEDs. They are direct replacements for the various Hubsan models, but the fact that they're pre-insulated and pre-tinned makes them great for other micro quadcopter projects. I'm going to add them to pretty much everything I fly now.

The Ominus isn't nearly as durable as the marketing makes it out to be, but at least the replacement frames are cheap and easy to find. Three times now I've broken off a rear motor pod right at the "wrist". Swapping the parts over is easy enough, but MAKE ABSOLUTELY SURE that you put the board in right side up. I'd recommend taking closeup pictures, or putting a dab of paint on it before dis-assembly to help make sure. If you put the board in upside down, it will do its best to flip over and fly upside down, and that won't go well for anyone.

I bought this kit to work on my tiny micro and mini quadcopters. It has all the bits as advertised, but they all seem to have a chrome-like coating that tends to start flaking off upon first use. I prefer the bits that are grayish and not coated, as they don't do that. Other than that it seems to be a good set. For whatever it's worth, mine is orange not yellow. Apparently there are a ton of copies of this kit out there, which makes it very hard to tell what you'll actually get.

I've been using these for a while on my ZMR250 with good results. I've got 2204 2300kv motors and Kiss ESCs (although I'm ditching those as they're too likely to randomly catch fire). With the relatively efficient Gemfan 5030 props I've been getting around 7 minutes of "spirited" flying. Not full throttle stuff, but pretty lively.I always try to take good care of my batteries, but every once in a while I run one down farther than is good for them. So far I've had absolutely no swelling issues like I get out of my NanoTech batteries. With that, and the very high C rating, these are well worth the extra money.

I recently bought a RotorX Raiju micro brushless hexacopter (no, I'm not speaking gibberish, I swear!). I have eight 3S 950mAh packs for it and charging them up individually would take all evening. With this, I just have to make sure that all 8 are at relatively the same charge level and off I go, filling them up at the charger's max current (IMAX B6AC), while each pack charges at only about .5 amps (or 0.5C, in my case). All 8 batteries finish up in about an hour and a half, vs 6 hours or more if I did them individually. And at 0.5C, you can be sure that the packs are not being damaged by being charged too quickly. A precaution I'd highly recommend is to make VERY sure that all your packs are within 0.1V of each other, and then plug this board into the charger (so the banana plug leads aren't exposed and able to short out), then plug all packs into this board and let them sit to self-equalize a while before starting the charge cycle. This will help smooth out any differences between the cells and make for a better and safer charge. And, of course, stay nearby while your packs are charging and keep an eye on them. Any sign of overheating or swelling, and be sure to stop the process, disconnect everything, and take it outside or somewhere safe until you can figure out what to do next.The board itself is of very good quality, and has a nice baseplate to help isolate everything. The only thing I've noticed is that the 3S indicator LED only works occasionally. It's not really a dealbreaker of any sort, since I already know that I'm charging 3S and not 2S, but it would be nicer if the light worked. It doesn't impact the function of the board in any way.
Exactly the quality you'd expect, with great soldering results. I have now moved on to the 1 pound spool, but plan on making my own "refill" for this tube so I can take it on the road.

This has helped greatly with connecting all my various HDMI gadgets to my aging AV receiver. My Onkyo only has 3 inputs, but I have way more HDMI goodies than that. I had been using another, much cheaper 3-way switch, but it had a lot of limitations. This switch seems to deliver, and deliver well. I was also able to program it into my Logitech Smart Hub remote, so I can easily switch from one device to another.My only wish is that it had an optional cabled IR sensor so I could mount this behind everything and out of sight. As it is, I have to leave it where it can see commands from the Smart Hub. It's not a huge huge deal, but it would be nice.

I've tried several of these type solutions before, with mixed results. I was very excited about this one at first but eventually found that it wasn't right for me. My main use of these is for music in the car, and I found that this one delivered audio that was just too quiet. I got good volume out of my iPhone, but it doesn't support AptX like my Galaxy S6. The audio from the S6 was just too quiet, no matter what I did to adjust volume or other music app settings. I had to crank the stereo to the max and it was still not as loud as I'd have liked. Oh well, back to the search!

I bought this to be used with various electronics on my quadcopter. You definitely don't want dew, mist, or water shorting out anything while you're in the air OR on the ground. Grass is very often at least slightly wet, even aside from its own normal water content. This coating helps ensure that everything stays nice and isolated from moisture. It dries mostly clear, but on some materials shows a slight blueish purple color. It's easy enough to scrape off if you need to rework something, and you can also apply a soldering iron and it melts right off.

I got this because with all the Lipo batteries I have, I really NEED one to be just a little safer. I read various reviews and settled on this one for value vs price. I kind of wish I got one of the slightly more expensive ones, honestly. The construction could use a little improvement, as the liner under the "loop" portion of the velcro section isn't folded over on itself before sewing. This means that the more you open and close the bag, the more wear this takes, and eventually the liner unravels and starts to let go of the velcro - leaving a frayed loose edge. The liner is some sort of fiberglass type fabric, so these frayed loose edges will constantly shed small bits of itself. Whenever I interact with this bag, these little microscopic bits of fiberglass get embedded in my hands and forearms. It's itchy and slightly painful, and they're too small to be seen and removed. I just have to wait for them to fall out, or get scraped off or whatever happens to them.In summary, it works for now, but I'm on the lookout for a better solution.

This is a great value compared to the "pen size" solder tubes of the same stuff. You get a ton more at a very good price. And if you really really want to, you can always make your own "refills" for the tubes. The solder itself is very good, and does the job well.

What can you really say? It's a screw. It's the right size. None of them have broken. Buying them in bulk on Amazon like this is much MUCH cheaper than buying piece by piece at the local hardware store, if you can even find them.
I don't need these often, but when I do, nothing else will quite fit. I wish the wires were a little thicker, but for most needs these are okay. Quality seems to be pretty good.

Great little buzzers to use with a Naze32 flight controller with either Baseflight or Cleanflight. Very very loud for the size. I still have to get within maybe 50 feet to hear it, but once I do it makes finding my downed quadcopter very easy.

I wasn't expecting it to be quite so....  floppy. The "flex fit" feature makes it so that the booms give no resistance to pressing on them, so you almost have to use 2 hands to press any buttons. Kind of eliminates the convenience factor. Sound quality for music is good, but I didn't wear it long enough to test on voice calls. Had to send it back for something more to my needs.

I bought this to hold a small LCD monitor for my FPV flight sessions (quadcopter with live streaming video). The tripod is small enough to pack up in my gear, but big enough to hold the screen and put it where I need it. Seems to be just as good quality as the "gorilla pods", but at half the price for the same size.

I had very specific needs, and while it looked from the pictures like it would be fine, it turned out that the top compartment was too small. The dividing wall between the two compartments is actually removable/relocatable, but it still did not work well for me. Other than that, it looked to be of good quality, especially for the price.

This is the first battery charger I've found that actually handles each cell independently. I've been looking for that feature for a long time and finally found it. It seems to charge fairly quickly, and I trust the NiteCore brand so I'm 99% sure it won't damage the cells or burn my house down ;)  I wish it plugged directly into the wall like my other chargers, but it's not too bad. I guess this gives more flexibility.
I ended up not needing this, but it seems to be of good quality. Public service announcement - if you have the Devo 8S it already has a USB port built-in.
Good quality for such a tiny little model. Got this as a gift for someone who is obsessed with B-29's and it was a huge hit.
These cables and connectors seem to be of good quality. They'll work just fine for anyone who is trying to make or repair their own lipo packs, or trying to make some sort of adapter cable.

I bought this cable and added banana plugs to it to make an iMAX B6AC compatible adapter cable for my Hubsan batteries. I got sick of charging them one at a time, and went looking for something to help speed things up. I found a 3x adapter like this, but even charging 3 at a time wasn't quite enough. I examined the wiring on the 3x adapter and figured out how to modify this one to work. All you have to do is add a red banana plug/wire to the pin where only 1 red wire connects to it, and a black banana plug/wire to the pin with only 1 black wire. All of the 5 pins in the center have 1 red and 1 black wire going to them, so the pins I'm talking about are on the far end of the connector from each other. The charger will see the pack connected to the negative-most end of the plug (with the black banana plug) as Cell 1, and the pack on the positive-most end as Cell 6. It's not terribly important, but I stuck little number stickers on each Hubsan connector so I could tell the difference. I of course used heat shrink to cover the bare wires, and then a larger piece of heat shrink to sort of fuse all the wires together to have a convenient place to pull when removing it from the charger.

This is a nice little addition to my quadcopter gear. I use this to make sure a surface is level before I set my quadcopters down to calibrate the accelerometers. A good flat surface is critical to getting a stable no-drift hover, and this helps immensely. When I'm in the field I'll set my hardcase down on the ground, check its level, and shim it up with whatever small bits of stick and stone happen to be around. I have also used this to find the one table surface in my house that's naturally level, and I now use that table every time I need to calibrate. Granted, the "pros" never use accelerometers to self-level and always fly in manual mode, but I'm not there yet. Sooner or later, though. Until then, this will make life a lot easier.

We recently upgraded our work phones from the iPhone 4 to the iPhone 6. I've been using Supcase cases on my Galaxy S4 for almost 2 years now (I say cases with an S because I bought them in at least 3 different color variants for the same phone). I'm happy to finally have a work phone that can also use a Supcase model. Fitment is very nice, and the construction seems to be very clean. The design is the standout feature as with most of their cases. The phone looks very sleek and modern with this case, and yes, they improve even on Apple's already sleek and modern design.The black outer ring seems to be either a new material from earlier cases, or it's the same material that is molded in another way. The end result is that it's a much more matte finish than my S4, and this gives noticeably better grip. The red ring inside that is a nice touch, and it's nice to see that they used a good deep red this time (One of the S4 cases I ordered was red with a black border, but it was kind of a pink-y orange-y red, and really wasn't what I was looking for. Yes, I'm overly picky about reds :D  There is a nice bezel on the front of the case, which helps protect the screen if you set the phone face-down. There's also a bit of a bezel on the back, which helps improve grip.Anyways, I'm glad I got this case, and look forward to using it for the next few years. My S4 looks a little outdated in its Supcase now, so I'm looking forward to seeing what they do for the upcoming S6 (Yep, just looked it up and it looks great :)  )

These bags are the perfect size for waterproofing "standard" size slab phones. I've used them with both my Galaxy S4 and iPhone 6, both with slim-fitting Supcase cases. The S4 has a bit of spare room at the top, but the iPhone is a very tight fit. The touchscreen reacts right through the bag, but the iPhone's fingerprint sensor does not. No great surprise there, but it's nice that the screens work.I can now keep the phones dry while riding bikes and such, no matter how much it rains (or no matter how much I get drenched in sweat). Now I just have to figure out what to do with the other 98 bags!Update:  I have now switched to the iPhone 6 for work and the Galaxy S6 as my personal phone. The iPhone fits fine with a Supcase case, but the S6 is just a little larger in every dimension and will not fit with a case installed. Fits fine without a case, though.

This is my first "real" coffee grinder. I had one years ago that was basically just a like a blender and would just chop everything up until you turned it off. No consistency in size or anything. The Hario takes care of that, and makes all the grounds come out roughly the same size. At first I thought the handle was way too long, but then I realized that you're intended to move both hands in counter-rotating circles. This speeds things up considerably, and the extra handle length ensures that you have all the torque you need.Grinding the morning coffee can get a little tedious and feels a little bit like torture (Why do I have to do all this work when I'm at my weakest - before coffee??!?!) but I'm slowly training myself to just sort of tune out until it's done.I use a Bonavita coffee maker with a #4 cone filter, and I've found that the stock grind settings work quite well. This thing seems very well made, and I'm sure it will help keep me caffeinated for a long time to come.

If you're just getting started flying quadcopters, you really need a crash kit like this. I almost ordered a lot of these parts individually, but then realized that I'd save a ton, AND get more stuff if I ordered it all in this one kit. Just be sure you know your way around a soldering iron if you need to change the frame or one of the motors (you need to remove and reattach all the motors if you need to change the frame).

My printer recently started leaving a grayish dusting of toner on my prints that gradually got worse and worse. Eventually the pages started getting harder and harder to read. I did a bit of googling and found that this is likely caused by old toner building up in the cartridge, not doing what it's supposed to, and ending up on printed pages.Installing this was very easy, and the gray printout issue was instantly resolved. This is a much more affordable option than the official Brother cartridge.

These don't appear to be original Hubsan parts, but they seem to do the job just as well.
