I really like this trimmer. Its very well made and sturdy. Charging to full is only one hour which is great because I never really plan ahead when i'm going to decide to trim. So waiting an hour for a full charge is great. It also has just under an hour of continuous use. I don't have a beard so i'm only using this to trim my hair and body.I found that the adjustable length dial is great and easy to use. I can adjust it for my sideburns and the back of my neck to get just the right length. I like to taper my hair in spots so this is great because there is no switching plastic clips for everything. Trimming body hair is the same you can adjust with no searching for the right size clips.This is one of the better made trimmers i've used over the years and most convenient that you don't have to change clips. No, you can't do everything with it because the adjustable clip only extends so far but for guys with real short hair this is great. For me, I still use a scissor to trim the top of my head but use the trimmer to do the back and sides.In the box you get the trimmer, 2 clips one for hair and one for beard, blade oil, blade brush and a pouch to hold everything in. You can since the blade to clean but the trimmer is not water proof so no using it in the shower.Definitely one of the better trimmers available and the quick charge is a big plus.

this is a great spotlight. It has a swivel lamp and solar panel so you can situate it just right to light and charge. It also has two light settings so if you don't want it super bright you can use the low setting. I have it lighting up a cold hardy palm tree that I got in the spring. I wanted to highlight this plant as its not really common where I live. It does a great job lighting the tree I only wish the ground spike was just a little longer so the light is more sturdy deeper in the ground. Its real easy to set up there's only two pieces and like i mentioned it can be tilted perfectly to adjust how you need. It does need direct light to keep it charged but believe it or not, i initially charged mine under a lamp all night because when I first received it we were having bad weather and didn't want to set it up in the wind and rain.Its a very inexpensive way to hi light and showcase something in your yard!*received this at a discount for my honest review

I"ve been using my old Brita pitcher for about 7+ years now. I finally got this new one and its a bit easier overall to filter water. You only have to rinse the filters now instead of soak them. The filling port is re designed a little smaller but still easy to fill and helps with keeping overflowing under better control. It also has a LED display to monitor the life of the filter. I did not see any way of replacing the battery for the LED so i think after it dies you either have to just deal with it or buy a whole new pitcher.The pitcher is a little wider than my old one but still has a great compact design. My older one was a slim 7 cup version so this is slightly larger in width being its 10 cups. The main lid doesn't quite fit tightly and the spout flap always pops off for some reason. Filled up to capacity this thing is on the heavy side so be careful or don't fill it up to the max.I use the water in my coffee machine, for drinking, baking and cooking, ice cubes etc. We have slightly hard water where i live so its important to make sure I have filtered water until the day I can afford a whole house filtering system.

This stuff really works. It says 3-5 sprays but for me that's too many and its too strong.. 2 is plenty but for some people 3-5 may be needed. I have another scent, they seem to have similar smells, must be a base ingredient in all of the scents. It should last a while its a good size bottle and if i'm only using 2 sprays i'll have it a while. I have the Juniper woods and the Heavy Dooty.The bottle style has changed and the one problem is that when spraying it leaks from the inside of the sprayer. It gets all over your fingers and being its strong, its not easy to get off your skin. They make a smaller version but if the sprayer is the same as this one, its not travel friendly because it leaks.It really does work and will continue using it. I also have it in the guest bathroom so there is no awkwardness.

Very well made heavy nozzles. I like the one that you can dial the spray pattern most. Its got a good feel to it when you twist it. its not one of those cheap plastic twist caps its nice hard rubber. Its got plenty of different patterns to choose from. I mostly use jet and shower and they work real well.The grip is rubber and the handle is metal. This is great because the plastic ones always seem to crack halfway thru the season. Also the screw tension is also metal not plastic as well.These will last quite a long time i'm sure. I do however bring my spray nozzles inside during the winter months. I do not leave them on the hoses even if the hose is detached from the spigot.Its a great set of sprayers, well made and sturdy. If you are an avid gardener and use them multiple times a day then these are probably for you. They will hold up to how you expect them.*got these at a discount for my honest review

I've seen posts and videos on this and wanted to try it. Well, following the directions and being very careful being its a delicate egg...FAIL....on the second spin the egg cracked open inside the gizmo and sprayed egg goo all over me and everything else near me. Oh well it was funny though and had a good laugh how it didn't work.*got this at a discount for my honest opinion.

Its a bit complicated in todays world to get this camera up and running...first is you are current with some of todays tech, you don't have a cd drive for the driver/program disc.... fortunately if you go to the Trendnet site they have everything you need there for both mac and windows. There is a brand new camera firmware update as of 9/4/15 but you need to have it wired to your network because if you try and update wirelessly it may not work anymore. There are also Q codes on the page so you can go right to the app stores for your smartphone. (http://www.trendnet.com/support/supportdetail.asp?prod=235_TV-IP862IC)Its a bit of a lengthy process to get the camera up and running from wires, to software to updates, configurations etc. I don't think this would work for someone who isn't real tech savvy. I am and found things to be a bit annoying. I have a D-Link also and it was  way faster and easier to setup. The big selling point with this camera is that it has the tilt and pan. This one camera can take the place of one or more depending on where you put it. I can now look into 3 areas where as to do so with a still camera i'd need probably 3 separate cameras.The resolution is 720p and looks pretty good during the day and well lit rooms. The night vision is acceptable but not great. It has two way audio, a spot for a micro SD card if you want to record right to the camera. Both web and phone app remote viewing and controlling of the camera. (the app is free). It has motion detection and can send video clips to your email to notify you.I really like the pan and tilt but its a big camera compared to others and its way to complicated for most people to setup. This is probably good for an office or business where you can move the camera to see around. Just not sure its for the average person because of the complicated setup process.

My PS4 came with a 500gb drive which at the time was fine but over the last few years the games are bigger and save more data and I had only 1.9 gb left on the drive. This hybrid drive doubles my capacity and should also run and load faster.Installation was super easy. All you need to do first is make sure you have the latest PS4 update on your system and then get a large enough usb drive to do a full backup of your system via the system restore/backup settings on the PS4 (need a 500gb drive). If you don't do this you cannot save settings, users and most of all, all the game updates, DLC, and the games themselves. If you don't do the full backup you will have to reinstall every game disc and then all the updates and DLC from the internet. you will also still need to save your saved game data but one by one which takes long. I recommend just do the full backup. This all in one backup will take 3-4 hours though so set it up and leave it.Once that's all done, power down, unplug and then slide the left side cover off. Once the cover is off there is one corner screw to remove and then the drive slides out. Its in a metal bracket and there are 4 small screws to remove. Just reverse all those directions to replace the drive. (https://support.us.playstation.com/articles/en_US/KC_Article/Upgrade-PS4-HDD/)Once that is done you need the PS4 boot files to restore the operating system to the new drive. (https://www.playstation.com/en-us/support/system-updates/ps4/) i recommend watching the youtube vids to show you this process because i had a slight problem that was ridiculous. You cannot use a large usb stick. I tried a 16 and it wouldn't work on the PS4. I needed to use an old 2gb stick and it worked no problem. Its not a complicated process but its precise and you need to be correct on settings etc so watch the vids. (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fkIyCXbiGZs)The drive is definitely faster not majorly but enough to notice. I've only had it (at the time of this review) for a few days but everything is fine and haven't had any issues. I still saved my old drive just in case of anything but I don't foresee it. From what i can tell you can get up to 600mb per second read/right on this drive which is pretty fast for a hybrid HDD. If it was a full SSD i think it would be even faster.For all owners of the original PS4's before the new 1 tb drives systems, this is a great drive made for Playstation and with a little time and patience, you can have a larger drive to keep you from running out of storage and bump up your drive speeds.

How fun this machine is...Its actually very easy to use and make your own rubber stamps. The kit only comes with 2 rubber stamps and at time of this review (Sept 17, 2015) There aren't any refills available until Nov 2015. The refill stamps are around $10-22 depending on what sizes and if you buy the refill with the wood bases. Inks will run around $12.00.After you install the software which looks similar to their Studio for the Cameo Cutter, select the stamp size and then all you have to do is add your graphic and text. Its pretty easy to figure all that out and make adjustments etc. There are a few free graphics that come with the Mint which download when you turn it on. Once you are done and your Mint is connected via the includes USB and AC plug, you click start and then feed in your stamp template. I mistakenly put the template in first and then hit start and it did not print.You can of course add your own graphics and images but know that it turns them into a dot matrix so photos will not have the best quality. You can choose a few filters to help make your image look better.Another hint is that when applying ink, try to only put it on the letters because anything that is not printed (which you can tell by the grey color on top of the black rubber) it will not soak into the stamp and you will have a smeared dripping mess. Put just a little on first and then when it soaks in add some more but don't saturate it. you can mix and match colors to your liking or just one etc. there are black, yellow, blue and red supplied in this kit.This is a fun and exciting way to customize rubber stamps for just about any occasion. the possibilities are only limited to your imagination. Crafters are going to love this big time.

Setup wasn't real easy, i'm a tech savvy guy and it took me 30 min to get it up and running not the 60 seconds its promoting. First you need a Nest account, that was quick and easy, then I tried to setup via smartphone and it couldn't connect to the cam. I then tried to setup via my computer and it couldn't find my wifi. Went back to the smartphone and finally got it to work.Once i got it up and running the video was nice and clear at 720p. It has an excellent wide view in nice vivid color (when its during the daytime). There is sound and you can also talk thru the cam via your mic on your phone or computer.It comes with a 10 foot USB cord and plug so you really need a plug where ever you will place the cam. I didn't like how hot the cam gets. I'm worried it could melt my blinds or something else. I have another cam (D-Link) and it does not get hot at all.Is it worth $200..i don't think so. While it has nice video and the talk/listen feature, smaller footprint, its just a cam. To record anything you have to get a plan that's either $100 or $300 per cam. So this makes it way too expensive overall. I can only do live viewing then.If you are looking for a high end cam with great video and sound in a simple design, then this might be good for you. If you want to record anything then you have additional costs.

These remind me of those real nice soft sheets from a 4-5 star hotel. And if you have never stayed in a high end hotel, when you get these sheets you will feel like you are!They feel cool on your skin and are breathable. The fitted sheet has deeper corners which is great because they won't bunch up in the middle and leave the long sides of the mattress exposed. The flat is wide and long enough too. The pillow cases fit great also and do not slide down during the night.They have nice satin stripes on the ends, they are wrinkle free and are great for allergy sufferers.For the price, you can't beat the quality of these sheets. I hope they will come in colors soon so I can buy more in the future.*got these at a discount for my honest review.

First, the box is bigger than expected which was great because i knew it was filled with lots of goodies! This is a mega kit...it comes with 5 figures and 2 clear ones (death star and republic symbol). Of course the game (PS4) and the base. The figures alone are collectable and fun to play with without the game too. You can buy other figures to add to all this and play for hours.The game play is so exciting and fun. The characters move smoothly and makes me feel like i'm watching the cartoon only better. Driving the vehicles around is also fun. This is the kind of game that has a long life because of the switchable characters. When my nephews come over they immediately want to play the game.The graphics are really great. I have the PS4 version and have really gotten into the Disney Infinity world. More on the Star Wars  stuff though because to use a lightsaber and drive the vehicles is like a lifetime dream come true being I grew up with the Star Wars movies.If your a collector, get this, if you are buying it as a gift for a fan get it.

Many reviewers complained that you didn't get the plants...ummm plants need light and water because they are living things. How could the kit have them included and be stored on shelves till someone buys one and then hope the plant is still alive? Of course the plants don't come with the kit, but if you fully read, you'll find there is a coupon code to get 2 free ones that they send within 5 days.I like this kit. It comes with lots of things to customize your air plant globe. The rocks were nice and the moss is also bright and interesting. I wasn't sure what the saw dust looking stuff was or the white chalky looking rocks were but after going to their web site i found out. I think that the kit should have instructions and also a list of what everything is that comes with this kit. I really didn't want to have to go online to see a video and figure out what the bags of stuff was.Its a mini kit and the fragile glass globes are small but for a desk or area where it doesn't need to be big these things will look great.P.S. when the plants finally arrives 7 days later...they sent only one large one not the two small ones. Their customer service is very difficult to get in touch with. You can only email them as there is no phone! so i took off one star

Very sturdy. I was surprised how heavy it was. You could use it as a hammer. Its well made and because of the heavy metal, it doesn't take much to squeeze the lemon. I like that it only has a few small holes on the very bottom, this way the juice isn't dripping from the sides. I have a plastic one from the dollar store and every time i used it i thought it would snap at the seam. This one is completely metal and the seam is nice and strong.Its a nice larger size so the lemons will fit and limes are a even easier. Its got a rubber handle which makes it comfortable to grip. The squeezer is dishwasher safe but i'd rather just hand wash it. It also comes with a lifetime warranty.Well worth it and works great.*received this at a discount for my honest review.

This particular model has a lot of bells and whistles in a smaller compact design. This is great for a student or someone who doesn't need a larger printer with more conveniences like a document feeder or double paper trays.The touch screen is  great and is more responsive than previous Epson models i've had. It also has Wireless, Wi-Fi Direct, Mobile Device Printing, Built-In Card Slots, Front USB Port. 2.7" Color LCD & Touch Panel. No faxing though in this model...but no problem because i couldn't tell you when the last time I faxed something.5 ink tanks so you only need to change the one that is empty and for me its usually the main black ink. One of the big pluses for me is the cd/dvd on disc printing feature. I make lots of backups and movies and love that i can make a great printed disc.The wifi printing has become a standard on most printers these days but Epson seems to be the easiest to configure in my opinion especially that I use a mac. iPhone, iPad no problem, android too.Printing is fast, scanning is fast, options for borderless which is another standard these days because most people print photos more.Price is a little high on it though and at the time of this review, the new 410 inks aren't available on Amazon or even the Epson website....huh?
junk, the metal cutter part isn't smooth and gouges chunks out of your skin

What a great set of cutting boards. Even the smallest size has plenty of room to do a great job. I like that one side is completely smooth and the other has a well around it to catch any juice from things you are cutting. These boards have cut out handles which make it great as well. They aren't overly heavy but heavy enough that the board doesn't move around while cutting.The only thing I needed to do was oil the boards before use to protect them from the start.*received this at a discount for my honest review

Easy to use and fits in your hand comfortably. The blade is very sharp but the one thing is that at its fullest extension, its just a bit short for some boxes. Because of  it being short i found myself having to cut the same spots multiple times. Other than that its a great cutter.

I wanted to try out this pillow as i seem to get new ones every 6 months or so. I have a feeling this one will last quite a long time. Mine didn't come in a carrying case as some reviewers mentioned. It came rolled up in a thin plastic wrapper. It does have a washable zipper cover though.After fluffing it up for a few minutes (which is very important), and repositioning the foam pieces inside, it had a much better shape. I also let my pillow sit in the open air in the garage for 2 days to air out the foam rubber smell. Some complained that it was real smelly but mine wasn't after airing it out. Give it a chance it will go away.Its a nice big queen size pillow and fits in the same pillow case size just fine. It does squish a little but conforms to your face and neck well. I don't use it as my main pillow but as a side pillow and for when i lay on my stomach.It is however expensive but, this will last longer than regular pillows and also hold up longer. Its hypoallergenic and dust mite resistant as well. If you are considering buying it, go for it just remember to fluff and air out and you'll enjoy it.*received this pillow in exchange for my honest review.

these are really great. they are silicone so they squeeze easy. you can also use the built in suction cup to keep them on the shower wall. you get 4 so you can put shampoo, conditioner and 2 other liquids including ketchup, mustard etc so its not just for bath products. They also have a seal in the cap so they don't leak/drip when the cap is open. They will leak if the liquid is very thin or they get squeezed but this seal helps. These comply with the TSA regulations both in oz and the clear bag. These happen to be 3 oz which is under the 3.4 limits.The only thing i can say negative is that the plastic zipper is a little tough to open because its small. Other than that these are great and well made.*i received these at a discount for my honest review.

*********UPDATE*********Seller contacted me and made good on the faulty scale. They sent me a new one that right out of the box worked as it was supposed to. They were more than happy to do the right thing!!! The scale works as good as it looks now. So if you are not sure about getting one...go for it and if there is anything wrong i'm sure the seller will be more than helpful.ORIGINAL REVIEW>>>>>>Cool looking scale, wish it worked. First problem was that when i stepped on it i would get dashes on the LCD, no numbers. Then a day later stepping on it showed i was 316 lbs (when i'm only 165). Then it started reading all different numbers almost like a countdown. Then another time it would start at 80lbs and go up to 300 and fluctuate down to 285. Today and i uploaded a video..it starts at 0.0 but then gives me the dashes again.This thing is so crazy, obviously its defective but it sure did give me a few laughs.

I've been using more aromatherapy the last few years to help get a handle on my anxiety attacks. I'm a big fan of Lavender, especially for a sleep aid.  I dilute this with a dry spray oil and lightly mist my pillow every night. Its calming and relaxing. I also (using the included dropper) a few drops in my daily shower which makes the aroma fill the bathroom.I've read that its also great for bug bites and minor skin irritations, acne and to also repel insects. I've made a spray with distilled water, witch hazel and a few drops of lavender to help keep my face hydrated and acne free.I also use a few drops in my ultrasonic diffuser. I just add the usual water and then a few drops of the lavender oil and it fills the house with its great scent. Since this is 100% its very strong so you will dilute it most every time. This kind of lavender is slightly different scent wise. For me, i get the lavender with a slight pine scent at the end. Being there are around 39 varieties of this plant, many will have slightly different scents.You get a real large bottle and a nice eye dropper. This oil will last me a long time!*received this item at a discount for my honest review

Compression pants are great for the gym. For me, they keep everything in place. My usual size is a 32 waist and using the size chart listed I needed the large which was a 31. They will fit snug but they are supposed to, that's how these work. Although they were a little tight, they were stretchy enough and i didn't feel like i was being squished.They are breathable and absorb a little sweat which is nice also. They are very well made, i checked out the stitching inside. They also wash well, no issues so far. Great pair of pants overall.

Because of its smaller size, I wasn't too sure how the sound would be. But much to my surprise its pretty good.The size reminded me of a chocolate bar (but real thick). It was super easy pairing it to my iPhone. With a full charge you'll get about 5 hours of music. it has the capability of being a speakerphone too so you can get calls thru it. Its super lightweight also.There are 3 buttons on top to control your music. Play/pause/phone call pick up/hang up and the next/previous track which also doubles for volume (just hold the button longer). One of the sides has the power button which has a light up status LED. It also has the micro USB in to recharge as well as the mic for calls and a headphone jack.The sound is actually good. Being that there are 2 active and 2 passive speakers (4 total) so you'll get the highs and the lows from bass too. Now of course for its size it won't have the best sound and at higher levels its all distorted so this isn't a boom box. This is more for travel or smaller rooms where you don't need to pump up the volume. This is great for dorm room, hotel room, kids bedroom, beach etc.Its not water resistant and dirt will get inside the screen so be careful where you put/bring it. Its outer shell is completely made from anodized aluminum (like cookware)  so its got a tough exterior.Overall its a lightweight smaller speaker that has good sound. Its not a mini boombox but decent enough to do a good job for most. Price is right too.

Why didn't i get one of these sooner? What a simple painless way to take a temperature. No more putting something under my tongue for 5 minutes. This infrared thermometer dies it in 2 seconds.Its real easy to use and there's nothing to setup. Just point and click. Some of the things that are great about this is that its backlit so you can see your reading in the dark. Its easy to hold and the buttons are easy to push. There are 2 modes one for body and the other for an object (probably a baby bottle). There's a speaker so you can hear the tones. You can also use this to test water temp and other things for your infant/children.The device comes with starter batteries and a nice pouch to store it in. The instructions were easy to follow too. I'll keep this in my nightstand so when i don't feel right i can quick take my temp.*received this at a discount for my honest review

I purchased this to help hydrate my face this summer. I wanted the lavender version because of its antibacterial properties. The mist is very refreshing and smells great. This is real good after a day in the sun. It comes in a glass spray bottle, and has a fine mist sprayer.Being its 100% natural is also a plus and Its also alcohol free! I also have the non scented version/plain but the lavender really does make a huge difference in my opinion.

First impression is that they are a well made pair of jeans. you can see that the sticking bot inside and outside is perfect. They have a nice smooth soft feel to them again both inside and outside. The color is a nice blue also.The waist size was slightly small I got the 32x32 but would probably try the 33's. I can wear them but they are just a bit tight. so no desserts when wearing them...lol. The style of these jeans have a looser leg and seat too. Since they are carpenter jeans they are designed for working where you square or kneel a lot.Overall they are comfortable and a real nicely made pair of jeans. They don't necessarily need to be for work so the casual wearer will benefit too.

What a great and easy way to add some flair to your landscaping. I just got a really nice palm tree that is about 3 feet high. I wanted to use this solar led light to highlight the plant at night. It is a great and easy way to do so. There's no wiring necessary and don't have to worry about plugging it in etc. The solar light had a dusk to dawn sensor in it so it goes on when it needs to. There's an on off button as well and it even has a blinking function. The light can get fairly bright and with full sun can last almost the whole night.Everything is waterproof so this can also be used in a pond/fountain or something like that where the light is submerged. My only wish is that i would have liked if it came with 2 strikes/posts because i would like the light to be off the ground. Although it is weighted (light led) I have a mulched area where the light goes and i'd like it to be just above all the mulch rather then partially buried.*I received this item for a discount for my honest review

The first week it would spray a big put of spray even on the lowest setting. Its very strong an d overpowering. Now that i've had it for a few short weeks the sprayer for some reason sprays 5-8 puffs during each interval. so now rather than one big overpowering spray I get 6. Puff.....puff....puff...puff....puff...puff... I don't know what to do other than shut it off. I also bought 2 refills but if this thing is defective what a waste of money. I'll try contacting air wick and see what they say.

These are great. they are the right size and now i can change the filter once a month to optimize my water and machine. Although there were no instructions, I learned that soaking the filters in water for a bit helps get any residue or loose carbon out. This is the best way to keep your water from turning grey from the loose carbon.Great price and the filters work great too. Glad to have purchased these.

this has a very masculine smell. For me i get the tobacco and citrus immediately. After you are towel dry, i had a citronella scent left over above all the other scents. I'm sure it will be different on everybody.  It also lathers up ok (better than others i've used). I use one of those net puff scrubbers and it sudsed up fine. But, the bottle is a little on the small side so its not going to last as long as other brands that have a higher lather.The bottle says its free of parabens, DEA and phthalates. And says for hair and body. I personally will only use it for my body. I have other products for my hair and only trust them as they are specifically for hair only.I have and try many shower gels, this one definitely has a unique fragrance and its quite nice. The big problem is that its way too expensive for everyday use. I don't think i'll buy a new bottle either because i can get around 4-5 larger Dove Men's Care (which lathers more and you use less) for the price of one of the Provence.I'm not knocking the Provence, its good, I enjoy using it and the scent with how the scent notes change. But its pricey so this will be more of a special treat for me if i get more in the future.

I own the macbook stand from this company and its fantastic. I jumped at the chance to get the iMac stand too. The stand ads 2 inches which is for me, just the right amount. In the past i was using text books to raise it up a bit. But now i get this great stand with a drawer. The drawer is fantastic and is as long as the base so you can fit pens and a few other things to keep your desk less cluttered with stuff.The aluminum seems to be the same as the iMac so it matches exactly. I also like the nice rubber top and bottom so the iMac doesn't slip. there is also a vent on the top as well as the front and back. the back is more of a port to feed your charging cable thru as the pic on the box shows an iPhone in the drawer.Another plus is that having the iMac raised 2 inches really does help with putting other needs right under the computer. Now you'll have more space for other things you couldn't have there before. Like a speaker or other type of dvd drive etc.

Don't struggle with the old style, this was such a breeze to use. I am so happy i bought it. The old style was such a pain to use and i'd sweat after taking 10 minutes to get the 100 ft cord all wound up. This reel took me 2 minutes and I didn't break a sweat.Just feed one end into the inside thru the hole, wind and your done! Has a thin profile so it stores on a shelf or anyplace easily. Buy it, you'll be glad you did!

What an amazing kit. There are 5 tools in the kit along with a nice sturdy case. There are 3 double ended loop extractors and 2spoon extractors. Unfortunately, there are no instructions/guide as to what each tool and the tip does and what to use it on. Yes, i know its for blackheads but there are all different shapes and sizes.I've been experimenting with them to see which ones did the best job. I found that the loop style ones were real easy and all you needed to do was basically swipe or comp the areas and it got a bunch of gunk. I found the loops to also leave the least amount of redness and irritation when done better than the spoon styles where it leaves circle red marks from the pressure.There are plenty of videos online to see how to use the tools.I really like them and also they are easy to clean using hot water and a little soap.

strong stuff....i get poison ivy in the spring time and before the rest of the brush gets too wild i like to spray this stuff on the ivy. it kills it overnight and keeps it gone all season. Just make sure you try and get the whole plant/shoot etc this way it kills it fully so it don't come back.I also use it on tough weeds and other weed trees that pop up now and again. I find it works best on a nice sunny day. Don't spray it when its going to rain, you want this stuff to penetrate and soak in well even though it says it only needs 2 hours to be rain proof.The best part is that its pre mixed and ready to use. No concentrate to figure out how much water is needed and no handling it, no mess.

I really like this brush. I have an old bulky braun that the battery is starting to go on. This Remington is like half the thickness which is much easier to hold. Plus, its lighter than I thought which is another great thing.It has a great LED light letting you know on/off, charging/charged. It also has LED's to let you know which cleaning mode you are in (there are 3, clean, sensitive, massage). It also has the usual built in 2 minute timer and will pulse every minute letting you know.It comes with a nice slim travel case as well as an extra brush head (along with color bands) as well as the charging base. I did find that the charging base would tilt over slightly when the brush was in place. It seemed to be too light in the back and it knocked over easily.Another observation was that it does take around 16 hours to charge fully. You can do a quick 1 hour charge and get 2 days use but 16 hours is a bit long in this day and age.It does a great job cleaning. There is so much sonic stuff going on to help loosen plaque and anything else. Its just the right size and gets into hard to reach areas with no problems. I sure hope this brush lasts as long as my still working but bulky Braun has.

I suffer from bad panic and anxiety..while i do need the occasional xanax to chill me out...there are side effects. I wanted to give these a try to see if they can help also. I've used them a few times and have had some results. They are good for the more minor episodes but not for the real difficult situations. At least that's what i've found in my experiences using the Nerve tonic.They taste nice, pop one or two under your tongue and they melt quick. You do feel a little calmer but again its not for serious episodes or situations. I'll be using this in when I can get away with not taking the xanax so i'm not feeling side effects from it.

I like this brand better than the clear life. I got better results with it whereas the other made me sneeze it all out. I only mist once in each nostril and its enough to last me the whole day. there's no scent and no burning sensation. Sometimes taking pills isn't enough and you need a little boost...i recommend that you give this a try.

The Ammex X3 Xtreme Blue Nitrate Gloves are very durable.  They are definitely more durable and have a better fit than most gloves I have used in the past.  Another plus is that they are power free.  The textured tips are a huge help with gripping.  Great product!

The Ammex APFN Blue Nitrate Gloves are very durable.  They seem to be more durable and have a better fit than most gloves I have tried.  Being latex sensitive, these gloves are perfect.  I also like that they are power free!

Hyland's Chamomilla Chamomile 30X Tablets are a great product!  They provide excellent relief of teething and colic discomfort as well if not better than OTC and prescription products!  It's a good feeling to be able to sooth your baby's pain without all the dangers and side effects of other products!  It does have a different taste to it but other than that it is great!

This Universal Classic Case by Belkin for Samsung 10 inch Galaxy Tablets is very nice looking and very well made. My daughter really liked this case because it has many different angles to view your tablet and a very nice angle to type on your tablet. It has a cutout for the tablet camera, protects your screen while you are on-the-go, and most importantly you have access to all your ports which some cases do not offer. This is a very nice case for the price and I would buy it again.

I first need to tell you why I trust and why schools, government offices, hospitals, industries such as technology, manufacturing, scientific and so forth use Kimberly Clark.  I once worked for Kimberly-Clark in QC department. I have friends and family that also have various positions in the company. I know from experience that Kimberly - Clark has the best Quality Control dept on every product that leaves the warehouses. The company practically has taken a lead in the USA and international with the best, safest, quality made products ranging from paper towels to sterile packaged items used by most of the top medical centers. The value of having the best made products always available is the idealism behind this well ran company. I live near of The CDC, which is one of Kimberly Clark's most important customer."Kimberly-Clark 02021 Scott Hard Roll Towel" is 100 percent recycled and rolled tight to allow the 400' length that fits well in many 8" roll dispensers. The 02021 is a bit heavier than other brands. I believe 12 rolls weighs 25lbs. You can compare to other brands but Georgia - Pacific was the biggest competitor that makes a similar paper towel.If Kimberly Clark's products, even plain paper towel rolls are good enough for such agencies and can compete in price, I recommend it for your business, agency, schools and even residential dwellings.

This makes for a wonderful indoor adventure for my older child's two young cats. Because her of living in a cat unfriendly area, the felines seldom get to venture outdoors. This "IRIS USA CL-072 Cat Tree, 5-Tier" is similar to having a tree to climb inside her home. It is the second type of item that she has used. This IRIS replaces a smaller and cheaper similar product that was tossed away within a year. Made many of real wood which has been processed to a non chemical form of MDF - a type of particle board that is covered with cat friendly type carpet that supposedly hasn't been treated with chemicals.

These Ringside Tech Bag Gloves by Ringside are very secure boxing gloves that fit comfortably and do the job well. It fits well because of the d-ring in the hook and a wrist closure that will keep it secure on your wrist. It offers IMF technology, 2 inch single layer of foam that many boxing gloves do not have. The fit is very secure and did not shift at all which is rare for boxing gloves. Overall these were great gloves with a comfortable, tight seal to them with a lot of protection.

In my many years of owning Invicta watches, I feel that they are underrated and have gotten a bad reputation because of the early days of poorly made products by Invicta. Today and since the last 6-7 years many quality control issues are in place. I love the Invicta Quartz watch. The last automatic I owned was not that great. This 21556 is a beautiful and decently made timepiece. I like everything about this watch except the size, the case is too large. I am not referring to the linked band. I have removed links to fit my wrist but it looks ridiculous because of the 50mm case on me. I am not small at 6' tall and weigh around 180 lbs. I do have normal to somewhat slender wrist and the case is ill fitting and doesn't provide a nice look.I accepted this watch thinking it has a 40mm case because I own a couple of 40 mm watches that fit well and look nice. I also believe that Invicta is a great watch for the money. I am still wearing an Invicta model 8926 since purchased on Amazon in 2008.

We have found the Boneco P500 highly helpful with improving our room air quality. We have it in our living room which is about 300 square feet, it helps my family with reducing dust and allergies. It is very quiet and we do not notice any airflow sounds as it quietly purifies and cleans the air. Although this is not a whole house air purifier, it works well for rooms around 250 square feet or less.Built and designed by Boneco of Switzerland the P500 won the 2015 Red Dot award for product design. It is sleek, quiet, and has a European appearance. The remote control is very helpful and easy to use. The smart digital display tells you the fan speed and air quality inside the room. It is placed in the room near the sofa where we sit and we noticed very little air movement or sound. It looks and performs beautifully.There is a prefilter screen to help having to replace the main filter. You have three choices for the main filter to choose from: baby, smog, and allergy. However, it comes standard with the allergy (A501) filter. I have not tested the other two choices of filters, which can be bought at Costco. It runs on regular 110-120 volt residential electric outlets.I realize that 500 dollars is a lot of money but this product is well worth it for our family's use. We are considering purchasing at least one more for the bedroom to help eliminate dust allergies as we sleep. My family loves this P500 Air Purifier by Boneco because after two weeks of usage, we have noticed less allergic reactions to dust, making us feel better and without having to take as many allergy medications.If you live in an area like we do and have year round seasonal allergies, I highly recommend this product. I will update you as soon as I try the smog filter, to see how it performs.
Perfect fit for 2nd bench row seating on my 2014 GMC Yukon XL SLT. For front mats use model 440661 to match the same vehicle.

I am a huge fan of these bags. I love packing them full and then watching them shrink down in size! I love creative endeavors. I was excited to try out this "Moldable Plastic".  I enjoy not only making items, but repairing and recycling vintage items. This plastic can give good results, however the time and effort it takes to get those "good" results is not something I enjoyed or that I would continue to pursue. The main drawback of this product is the SHORT time you have to work with it after you finally have it melted and mixed sufficiently to work with.Second, It takes a long time for the beads to melt at 150+ degrees. Using 150 degree water, by the time the beads  are turning clear, the water has cooled down and the melted plastic is starting to harden. The water needs to be warmer than 150 degrees to get the plastic warm enough to be pliable for any length of time. Then you run the risk of it getting to hot to comfortably handle.The color pellets come in 5 shades. The red and yellow are obvious, but the green, purple and black are so close in their look to each other that it would be helpful if they were marked. Mixing and blending the color beads takes time and I found I had to remelt my "glob" several times to get the color even.I did managed to repair a hole in an antique Salesman's Sample Wood Burning Stove. I discovered that I could take a cigarette lighter and re-melt the applied plastic to smooth it and form it after being applied to the stove. I was also finally able to create a "brown color" that matched the color of the stove I was repairing and used clear for part of the repair that was silver. What I thought would be a 30 minute project tuned into 3 hours. I like the concept of ReMoldables and feel it is a product with potential. I am hoping some changes can be made to the formula to extend the narrow time frame there is to use Remoldables, before it starts to harden. I received this Moldable Plastic for a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I saw this tape right after seeing some pretty cute tape crafts on pinterest, coincidence? Pizazzle!Then I used some to label the storage boxes in my basement.  It made the boring boxes of computer supplies and Christmas decorations look nice.  I don't mean Martha Stewart nice, but it was a lovely improvement.The tape rolls aren't very big and I think I will look for nicer colors next time.  These are just too disco for me. Not the best toys or treats.This toy features one of the worst cat play designs I've ever seen, it wobbles if pushed.  Whoever designed it hasn't spent much time around cats or they'd know that cats are chasers more than nibblers.  The hunt down and pounce on their prey, there's just no reason for pouncing on a heavy, plastic dreidel'ish thingy.Even after showing her that the more it moved the more cat treats would spill out.  Also, about those cat treats, my kitty didn't care for them.  Our cat likes treats so much that she comes running just from the sound of a plastic container crinkling.  She slid across the floor like Ty Cobb when I was sprinkling a few dried cranberries on my oatmeal  from a very crinkly package.  So, she is extremely interested in kitty treats, but not these ones.  She left several behind and couldn't be induced to eat them.By every measure, this is not a good purchase.

This is the best book of the year.  My reason for labeling it such is because my kid, danced with excitement, grabbed it from me and dashed to his bedroom to read it.How many books make kids dance with joy?Best of all, he asked me to read it too.  This is the seventh Captain Underpants I've read.  When my kid first discovered them, we'd bring them home and then spend a couple of nights taking turns reading the pages.  I don't know when he started to read them without me, but it was kinda sad.  I loved propping pillows against his headboard, our heads leaning into the book as we both tried to outdo each other by making sillier and sillier voices.So this was a wonderful return, at least partially, to those younger days.The captain, George and Harold are even more ridiculous than I remembered them.  Like the other stories, small things turn into big problems and George and Harold handle things with their usual sense of the ridiculous.  Like all the other books, they are prankster slackers and spend a good deal of time trying to get out of school or make it more interesting (their idea of interesting is definitely on the unapproved list).  This time around, a teacher has turned evil and the entire world is in jeopardy.So if you want to get some valuable kid time, buy this book and curl up for a giggly good time.

This is a timely book as it is a very hot summer and I've not wanted to use my oven or stovetop for anything.the recipes fall into two categories for me;1.  Real cooking, you assemble ingredients that wouldn't be good alone or uncooked and make a meal of them.2.  You assemble various leftovers to remake them, ie, leftover roast chicken, leftover pulled pork.Luckily, there are an ample supply of the first kind to keep me reading because, to be honest, I don't need any help making refried beans topped with cheese.Most of the directions require just three steps;Step one; get your ingredients.Step two put them in a mug.Step three, put the mug in a microwave.Why did that just remind me of SNL's Dick in a box skit?Anyways, I like the thought of using my microwave for more than just reheating my coffee and tea.Here's a sampling of some of the recipes I am most interested in trying out;Apricot poached in Earl Grey Tea with GranolaWarm Peanut Noodles with Scallions (I usually have all these ingredients on hand, so, bonus!)Shrimp with Garlic, Lemon and Parsley (Shrimp IN A MICROWAVE!)Coconut Rice with Chickpeas and Garam MasalaThai Curried Pumpkin BisqueBanana Caramel PieApple Caramel CakeCherry Brown BettyWarm S'mores Dip with berriesNutella Cake (do you need more reasons to have Nutella in the house?)A lot of the recipes have ingredients I usually keep in the pantry so that makes these recipes ones I could see myself trying soon.

This is a very very short cable.  My hubby told me that some people want super short cables for their devices.  He said it's a style thing, not something that him or I understand.  But if that is a feature you especailly want, then this cord is for you.It looks armored, so I am hopeful that our cat wont be able to chew through it, something that keeps happening, sigh.  It has a good seal when you use it to recharge your device.  The only downside is that it isn't very bendy.  It' is in a sorta permanant crook shape.All in all a great product.

Lovely kitchen towels.  They aren't colors I'd usually pick out for my kitchen, honestly anywhere in my house, I'm not a fan of brown or tan since I grew up in a desert area, I need greens, blues, pinks even orange and yellow are preferred.  But they are a high quality, the recessed diamond pattern is a classic that always uplevels a room, in my opinion and they are the perfect size to cover a loaf of proofing bread or to cover up a plate of warm tortillas.The care instruction on the label says to tumble dry low.  Tumble Dry LOW?  How the heckola will anything ever dry that way?  I put them in with some yoga pants and shirts for thirty minutes and they came out ready to use and looking great.Just in case you care, I would, I'm picky this way.  Some cheap products have a front side and a back side, the back side has a faded look and is very obviously the side that wasn't printed or meant to face outwards.  Nice fabrics don't have this.  I'm sure there is a technical textile term for this, something to do with weft and weave, anyways, what I'm saying is this is a high quality fabric and both sides of the towel are pretty.Also, they are absorbent, I bought some pretty printed towels a few years ago (they had peppers on them) and I think they were polyester and they would not absorb water.  It was like trying to use a plastic bag to dry a newly washed plate, it didn't do anything but move the water around!  So irritating.Great, classy towels.

I love zombie books and yet I find so few that I really like.This book combines three things I really love about zombie stories;1.  Interesting, flawed characters to root for2.  Zombies showing up to muck up everything3.  fast paced action mixed with strong world building and character development.As an added bonus Fredsti has added a few twists to the zombie genre, well, at least they are new to me, first off being the covert government group working to contain the outbreak and past outbreaks around the globe.  Sort of a zombie fighting Medicine sans Frontier, but with a different foreign name and a past that would rival the Knights Templar for secrecy.Into this maelstrom of guts and biting enters the main character, Ashley Parker, she's  30 something, divorced college student.  She has an attitude and isn't afraid of confrontation.  She's back at school after suffering through an especially harsh strain of the flu, or so she thinks.  What's especially great about Ashley is she is a strong friend and speaks up for herself, this is no shrinking violet afraid to hold a gun.  She throws herself whole heartedly to her new life as a zombie slayer.Usually with a book like this the character would do something dumb and sentimental to save her boyfriend or wouldn't believe that the zombies she encounters are killers who are too far gone to be saved.  It is definitely one of the strengths of the novel.Also is the fast pace of the story.  From infection to attack to training, it all moved along at a cracking pace.  It was a book that I started to worriedly check the bottom corner of my kindle to find out how much of the story was left.  I was loving the book so much that I didn't want it to end.  When I got to the 80% point, I had to get online to find out if there was a follow up book yet.Now that is a book I can recommend one that has me searching out the next book by the author.Read this if you like The Mark Tufo series, World War Z, Apocalypse Z and the Newsflesh series.  If you are looking for action, thoughtful and smart people trying to deal with the outbreak in the fastest and cleanest way, then this is the book for you.  If you don't want a lot of angst and hopelessness, again, this book pays off.  But if you like that in your stories, or a bit of philosophical rambling then this book just wont fit you.Also, and I can't even believe I have to say this, but this book has flesh eating, zero brained zombies.  They don't drive cars, use guns or do anything at all to suggest that they have brain cells firing.  These are mindless, brain eating corpses and they don't move very fast, not running full out swarms of  bull*&^! zombies like I saw in the World War Z movie.But as anyone who read the tortoise and the hare, the steady, shambling  pace of hungry zombies can quickly overtake a human running full out because humans have to stop to rest occasionally, zoms never do.Also, the characters call the dead biters zombies from the beginning, there are too many times that I get tossed right out of a zombie book because apparently none of the characters have ever heard of a zombie before.In every way this book was super fun and interesting and I can't wait to read book 2

I should have stopped when I was ahead.  I tried combos vanilla filling pretzels and in a glut of foodieness I determined that my life would be better with all the sweet flavored combos so I bought these, for an exorbitant price, I might add.They are, in a word, vile.They smell like a cross between vanilla candles and powdered non dairy coffee creamer. In fact the stuff inside of the combos tastes like someone decided to mix salted caramel coffee creamer powder with a glob of melted candle.Even after I spittooned the loathsome treat, my tongue felt coated in fakey sweetness, sorta waxy with caramel creme.  Shudder.Also, I found out a couple of weeks after buying two packets of these pretzels that they sell them for much less at the mini mart!I took these to a meeting and people were split about half and half, half thought they were a delightful salty sweet sensation and the other half swore at me profusely while rinsing their mouths out with day old coffee.So, give it a go, will you be a yay or nay person?

I'm starting to think that sunglasses should come in sizes other than child and adult, because these glasses were tight on the sides of my head.  I really really wanted to use them, especially indoors because i get migraines from the bright flickery lights at malls and department stores, but they are too pinchy for me.I gave them to my son and I think he is going to use them for some sorta cosplay he's planning this year.Other than the size they were lightweight, really light, perhaps a little delicate so be careful with them.  The lenses were the perfect amount of shading and the glasses look exactly as they do online.

This is a really big and powerful fan.I just had to let you know so that no one buys this for a stuffy bedroom or a hot kitchen.  It might blow the pillows from your bed or the food off your plates if you use it in the kitchen or bedroom.Right after we got this fan, our washing machine started to leak, leak is such a small word for the huge pool of water that ended up in our basement.  After pulling up the pad and the carpet the linoleum underneath looked a little bit wavy and the basement smelled like mildew.  So we opened the two tiny windows (ours is a partially submerged basement, not sure what the technical term is, I'm from california and most people don't have basements there) and set up this portable wind tunnel.  We left if running for four days to dry out the basement and it worked like a charm.  No more dampness and very little smell after cleaning with a solution of water, tea tree oil and bleach.I'd like to use this near my treadmill, but I'm trying to figure out the best way to place it so that it doesn't blast anything that doesn't need blasting, like houseplants or the printer.  I like a lot of airflow when I'm working out.  Our house has air conditioners but in the summer the living room is pretty warm and so I can't use my treadmill past noon or I sweat like an ice cube in the desert.As for assembly, I set my 15 year old to the task and he only needed a tiny bit of help, mostly to hold it together, it's pretty big, while putting some force into it.The controls are great, so you can regulate the level of blow-y-ness.  A great big fan for larger rooms.

The shirt is a softer cotton than we were expecting and the purple is a bit darker than it appears online, a little closer to aubergine than to royal purple but other than these two changes, both of which are wonderful, this shirt is perfect.  My son squealed with delight when he opened the package for his birthday.We all play Hearthstone and my son is especially a fan.  The cards on the front are ones that he especially likes.  I've washed the shirt once and the color and the images stood up to the washing.  But with the soft cotton fabric I wont chance drying this one, I put it on a hanger to air dry.  Not a problem, I do this with most shirts, they last longer this way.Great shirt for the Hearthstone fan.

I haven't used powder in years.  I have terribly dry, sometimes reddish irritated skin and a dry powder seems like the exact opposite of what i need to put on my face.But, I like to give new things a try and the spf 29 really lured me in.My first impression was that the powder would be too dark for my pale freckle prone skin.  The dark powder that was ground was a match for the suntan colored knee highs my sweet grandma Florence used to wear, but I was hopeful that the ivory powder mixed with it would magically blend in with my skin.It went one better, the color not only blended it seemed to even out some of the pinky freckly bits of my face.My skin is sensitive, so the first time I used it was right before a shower, I wanted to make sure it didn't have fragrance in it, it doesn't and that it wouldn't make me itchy, it didn't.The next time was for a real day on the go, I wore it to the bowling alley for a day with the kiddos, my friend and I sipped sodas while our kids bowled and ate fries and chicken strips.  The bowling alley we go to is old, their only form of air conditioning is ceiling fans and so the uncomfortably warm, fried food scented air became positively sweltering as the afternoon moved on.  For the first part of the day the powder was light and comfortable, but once I started to sweat it felt a bit itchy.So  don't think I'll wear this to hot places.  But since I live in the Pacific Northwest, this means this should be good for most of the year.As others have noted, the powder comes with a micro foliation tool, in other words a makeup brush.The product says it minimizes aging, I didn't notice that effect, just light skin evening coverage.  All in all a nice product at a not so nice price.

My hand hesitated over the number of stars, since when you click on five out of five stars, the words, 'I loved it,' pop up and love has no part in the complex mix of emotions I feel about this novel.First off I should say that it took me almost three months to finish this book, not because it was slow or badly written, it's because I had a creeped out sensation that grew as the story progressed.  From the callous guards and the terrifying specter of what existed outside the walls versus what was locked into the building, well, it was a bit much for me to take in.I decided early on not to read this at bedtime, the story lingers and my dreams were disturbing, full of stressful situations and hidden monsters.  But trying to find the right time to read became a fruitless search as each time or situation turned out to have it's downsides; reading on the bus meant I was too distracted to get off at my stop, while cuddled up to my hubby on the couch wasn't right, I needed more solitude to read.When it comes down to it, this is a book about survivors.  About the crushing weight of despair of people who have watched the world destroyed and are left with only terrible options.  The fact that these options take shape in one little monstrous girl is what makes this book so horrifying.  That good people would be driven to such terrible acts to save humanity was a terrifying thing to read about.  I sympathized, but was sickened at the same time.So I finished the book and I haven't recc'd it to anyone yet.  Not sure when I will or what I'd say to them about the book.

Oily, gritty and weirdly bitter.About a year ago my husband went on a neutral food diet, the philosophy of the diet was that the meal replacement shakes would have zero flavor,  therefore, your hunger trigger would be sated by the calories and fat, but that because of the lack of flavor, you wouldn't feel a craving for more.The shakes were made of canola oil, unflavored whey powder, corn flour and a few other bland healthy things and then were combined into a shake that tasted like nothing but gritty, flour-y water.  My husband didn't seem to mind it and he offered me a taste, assuring me that it wasn't too awful, but it made me vomit, right there, in my kitchen.  I puked up the vile shake-like concoction (barely made it to my trash can) and vowed never to trust my husband, taste-wise when he says, 'it's not too awful.'These cookie butters tasted like the abysmal shake my hubby made plus they were bitter and really oily.  Also, they didn't smell good.  Really, you can't discount your sense of smell when it comes to food.In every possible way these cookie butters are a failure; they don't smell good, they don't taste good and they do not look good upon opening, as they all had little pools of grease on top.

Great quality tee.  We'd started buying most of our tee's from WeLoveFine, since they always have true to size and high quality gear, but I have no complaints with this shirt.  I've already washed it a few times and since he was at a very stinky-perfumey place, I had to add a teensy amount of bleach to the wash water once and it came out looking the same.I bought it for my husband for his 40th birthday and he loved it.  This shirt is perfect and reminds me of all the old guys at the VFW hall, 'cept this is for Star Trek.  I think he's going to wear it to comic con this year.Perfection.

Great air filter, the pollen sensor aspect is especially amazing.  I wish it had something for molds, we've had such back and forth weather lately that I'm sure the air is filled with molds that never get burned off by cold or heat.This air filter is a little quieter than our other filters.  There is less lit up buttons, which I think is better, the one we had in our room was lit up like a christmas tree and sometimes it seemed a bit over the top.  The filters are pretty standard and cost about the same.I really have noticed a difference after putting this in our living room.  I have a lot of allergies in the summer and spring, not just sneezing, runny nose and itchy eyes, but something really icky, itchy.  Sometimes I have to get up in the middle of the night for a dose of benadryl, or if I'm worried bout waking up in the morning, I have to slather on some hydrocortisone cream.  But everyone has hives knows that you have to be careful about overuse of hydrocortisone cream.Anyways, my itchy hives have been milder this year.  I can't tell you how wonderful that is, the crazed itchyness would keep me awake at night, sometimes it woke my husband up too (all of my shifting around in bed and itching) so gross.Great product for anyone worried about indoor air quality.

Now here is the Charlaine Harris that I fell in love with back in the days when people had aol accounts and Tom and Nicole were still a couple.Unlike the first book in this series, the mystery takes up real space in this story.  Like all the Harris books I've loved before, things start out pretty mundane, Manfred meets with a client in Dallas to do a personal reading. Everything would be very normal, well, normal for a psychic who gives advice to paying customers, until his client dies and he's implicated in the death.This is where all the worldbuilding from the first book comes into play.  Personally, I really hated, HATED the first book in the series.  The characters were boring like an iceberg lettuce salad, especially considering how many dangerous and powerful paranormal creatures live in the tiny skidmark sized town.  But, I digress, all the boringness makes it so the reader doesn't have to mess with it in this story and it is so much better this way.Manfred isn't quite the adorable sexy imp that flirted up a storm with Sookie in the Southern Vampire series, but in this second book he is a bit more interesting and I like that he is really working again, not just telling the reader about his emails and website updates.Plus, this is a team up novel, something I've always liked about Charlaine Harris her characters ask for help and bring others into the mystery.  It bothers me when people try to solve everything themselves, it doesn't ring true, humans are sociable creatures we crave the company of others and it's only natural to share something as big as a client dying.I wouldn't have naturally thought of pairing Manfred with Olivia, but their opposite natures reminds me a bit of when Sookie had to ask Eric for help.  So much fun to read.All in all an enjoyable afternoon read.

This is a review for the black, ladder back chair with a vinyl padded seat, not the wooden seat.Just wanted to make clear which chair I am reviewing.Okay, here goes, this chair is okay and almost perfect.Here's what I like about it;1.Very sturdy design and a bit heavier than I was expecting.  My last chair was wood, it had cross beams near the bottom and I liked to rest my feet on them.  So would anyone under seven feet tall, which made it so disappointing when the cross beam broke and compromised the chair leg (there was a smallish crack in it and the chair seemed wobbly).  With metal frame and overall great construction of this chair, I can rest my legs with peace of mind, no broken chairs for me!!!2.  Looks exactly like the photo.  All black and the exact dimensions that were listed here.Here's what I didn't like;1.  Missing hardware.  there was spots for six screws to secure the seat to the base and yet only two screws were included.  Sure, it seemed sturdy, but why not have all six points locked down?2.  this is not a seat for lounging.  In fact, the butt space is a on the small side, even my skinny teen found the seat to be a bit wee.  I will still use it and be glad to have it, but it feels a bit like you will slide right off if you don't sit up straights.For the price, this is a pretty good chair.

his reads less like a novel and more like a series of blog posts.  I think if it were set up that way, the strange time jumps and the unrealistic way the main character reacts to the increasingly scary encounters with the supernatural wouldn't seems so, well, dull and not at all creepy.I really, really wanted to like this story. I love ghost stories.  I'm a huge fan of Supernatural, Poltergeist, etc.  I even checked out the youtube series this book is based on, The Haunting of Sunshine Girl and was delighted to find out there are some crazy fans of the series, but it just isn't good storytelling here.A few more thoughts I had about the book;1.  She doesn't seem worried about starting at a new school with no friends.  Very robotic and unsympathetic character.  Even the most outgoing person would be a little worried, they'd think carefully about their first day outfit, they might have walked by the school early and checked out the school website, to get more of a feel for the school.  I might be projecting my feelings here, but I can't imagine others being that different about something like this.2.  She gets along great with her mother, in fact, she says she's her best friend.  Would a best friend make you stay in a house with a dangerous ghost?  Or, more likely, not be concerned for your mental health if you think the house is haunted?.3.  The cute boy and insta friendship/lurve.  Ughh, it is just not cute, romantic or fun.  In fact, it just came off as an add on, more strangely unreal storytelling.

Sweet baby Cthulu, these are tasty.I saw these at Walmart and kinda laughed, I mean the whole concept of a vanilla stuffed, crunchy, salted pretzel seemed silly.  Ridiculous even.  So I bought a bag to take to a friends house as sort of a joke, like 'here's some ridiculous pretzel thingies.  I dare you to eat one!'  Well, we all, (okay, not my husband) loved them.In fact my friend said they reminded her of the girls in the dorm, how they'd buy a carton of frosting and then dip pretzels into it.  Which, honestly, did not sound good at all, premade frosting + pretzel sticks =  ick!  But now I'm wondering.I've always been a pretzel fan.  I like peanut butter pretzels, whole wheat honey pretzels, sourdough pretzels, soft pretzels (I even learned to make them at home), pretzel crust pizza.  Pretzel strawberry salad (it sounds awful but is always the first thing to disappear at potlucks).  But really had me doubting is the Combo label.I absolutely hate combos.  The cheddar flavored ones are horrid.  But the pizza filled ones are simply appalling.  My roommate in college loved them.  Girl probably got half of her daily calories from pizza combos and yoohoo (one of the world's worst beverages, imho.  On a sidenote, have you noticed that the only time you see people drinking yoohoo its in a movie?).  They are one of a very few ready-to-eat snack foods that I completely reject.  But I have also noticed that people who like pizza combos also tend to really like processed cheese in a can.So back to these combos that I freaking adore.  I was expecting the vanilla filling to be kinda dry and crumbly, like the peanut butter filling in a peanut butter filled pretzel.  But the filling is actually a little softer, closer to the filling inside of an orea.  Also, the pretzels had mostly intact salt crystals which added a ton of extra crunch.  The combo of salty pretzel and sweet filling was phenomenal.They have the exact same dimension of regular combos (bite sized) and come in smallish bags (my friend and I finished off a 6 oz bag in a little under an hour) and I think that is definitely a good thing because one bag was listed as six servings, each serving was 130 calories.  I am going to have to do several hours on my treadmill to work that off, sigh.I just found out that these Sweet & Salty combos are not limited to vanilla frosting flavor, there is also a salted caramel creme flavor and I haven't been able to find them anywhere except here on Amazon.These combos bring my total of tasty new food finds to one this month.I think everybody should try these so that the Mars Company doesn't pull this product before I've grown tired of them.

This is the first automated kitchen thermometer I've used.  I had an old fashioned meat thermometer, but over time, it became less and less accurate.First off, if you are like me, immensely lazy, this thermometer is just more work to use.  The old style therm is just a rinse and stick it into some meat kind of deal.  Here you have some set up.  I was busy getting a pot roast ready for the oven, so I got my husband to set it up.  He said it was pretty straightforward and easy.The only downside was that I thought it was something you could set up at the house and then leave.  I was out of green onions and garlic so I thought we'd have time to walk to the local grocery store, pick them up and get home before the roast was done.Not so fast!  The range on the stick therm devices isn't much farther than my backyard.  I was pretty disappointed by this.But, the potroast I made was perfect and it was mostly because I cooked it to the exact level of doneness that we like.

I loved book one of the Chronos File so so much that I was pretty sure I'd love book two as well.  But, there was a tiny wisp of doubt that without the mystery of time travel, of the Cyrists, of Kiernan and all the things that had changed time into the bizarro world that Kate had to try and save/fix.  In other words, I was worried that Time's Edge might fall into that most terrible of things, a second book slump.I'm delighted to say that I like this book even more than book one.  I had to go back and read book one, I mostly skimmed through a bit, I was in a hurry to get onto this book.  The ending of book one was a little melancholy in my opinion.  If you haven't read it yet, you should read it BEFORE reading the rest of my review.Alrighty, let's get started!First off are Kiernan and Trey.  Because of what Kate had to do to save herself and at least try to salvage some of the timeline, namely her mother and father, Trey was lost.  He just does not remember her at all because they didn't meet yet.  But Trey is such an awesome guy that it seems like, with some work, the two of them could be a couple again.To be honest, I love Trey, he's a nice boy, very helpful and handsome.  In other words, the stereotypical YA Fantasy novel boyfriend.  He pretty much always agrees with Kate, he's always gentlemanly, caring, thoughtful and non threatening.  He's also not terribly interesting, he doesn't challenge her and I never really thought, that on Kate's part at least, that she ever had to worry that he was crazy in love with her.  I like at least a little uncertainty in my book romances and for Kate/Trey there is none at all.So even a tease that Kate might not end up with Trey was enough to keep me flipping pages long into the night.  Once you can wrap your head about multiple timelines, multiple lives lived by Kate, well, it certainly kept me interested.This book, even more than book one shows how easily every little change can have huge effects.  Kate is a careful person and she more than most people knows that she is walking a fine line between destroying or saving the world.  The ethics of tampering with the timeline is a central theme but so is her relationships with everyone around her.  Relationships that subtly change each time she changes something.I got the feeling in this book, even more than in the first that time travel should never have been attempted, the temptation to meddle and the possibility for disaster are too great for most anyone to resist.Now my thoughts on the villains of this book; Pru and Saul.  Neither is a mustache twirling monster, yet they are so evil in their intentions that it was like watching a tiger rampaging through a village snapping up children to eat, it was hard to see how the people around them couldn't figure out what they were.Still, the search for the chronos keys and Kate's race to stay ahead of the Cyrists was completely engrossing.

Pretty nice mouse.  I'm not a super gamer, in fact, I only play a few games; Spore and Mortal Kombat.  Anyways, since I only play for an hour or two a week, I only notice a few differences, that it requires just a whisper of movement to use and that you have to be careful not to brush against all the extra buttons.My son is the super gamer, he likes Team Fortress, Portal, Spore, Five Nights at Freddies, Goat Simulator, etc.  He says this mouse is a super upgrade from the cheapie mouse he used before.He says his game play has been chiller and he 'own's' the world.  Honestly, I don't really get it, for me the mouse seems almost the same but for all the different buttons.

The way this bike attaches makes it difficult or (in my case) impossible to attach to a bike with handbrakes, if you have a manual - peddle backwards brakes bike, this would be perfect.The next time I take my bike in for repair or a tune up, I will bring this basket in with me to see if the guys at the shop can figure a way to work my brake lines away from where this basket attaches to the steering column and handles, but so far, it wont work.Also, the bottom connection is hard to make, one side was infinitesimally smaller than the other side, the top part, where you slide the basket in works perfectly.  Also, if you are like me and wanted to use this basket for shopping, where you would take the basket into a store, buy what you want to buy and use the basket instead of the proffered bag, then proceed out to your bike you will discover a really irritating problem.You will need to remove the contents of the basket before replacing the empty basket onto your bike.  The reason for this is because the items in your basket will obscure the tiny holes that you have to line up with the gear to fasten the basket to the bike.  Then you could re-add the items to your basket before heading back home or wherever it is you wish to go.I think this bike would be good for those old timey bikes, the kind with the wide, leather touring seats.  Also, it would be good for people who will be using it to hold a sweater or a few wildflowers they picked on their tour of the countryside.

Something about this story seemed a bit familiar.  All weekend I couldn't get the feeling that I'd read this book before.  I chatted with my husband, but he said it was highly likely and he'd read lots of sci fi with similar scenario.Finally, I revisited my bookshelf and aha!  I found three books with super identicle storylines.The first book is The Warrior Heir by Cinda Chima Williams, about a boy who finds out he is part of a giant game where people with powers compete for dominance.The second book is The Maze Runner by James Dashner.  The third is The Decoy Princess and the fourth is The Game by Monica Hughes, it turns out, I've read a lot of these stories, because I thought up two others later that night when I was making dinner.But the problem is that I didn't really care for the writing style or the characters in this book.I forced myself to keep reading, I know how easily bored I can get with a book,  I've often given up on a story after just a few paragraphs only to come back to it later and then love it to pieces (Hunger Games, The 5th Wave.But, Endgame just never really sparked for me.  The premise of the story wasn't very believable and since the characters all seemed one dimensional and forgettable, I was left with a big ole book of blah.I gave up reading after chapter four.  Maybe someday I'll be bored enough to try again, but I doubt it.

This product is missing an important part - the hand grips, without it, it is practically unusable!I know what you're thinking, but Jennifer, the picture clearly shows it doesn't have handles.  Yes, but since I've never used a product like this, the picture I was most focused on is the one with the woman exercising with it, she's on the front of the packaging, stretching her arm up with a clearly visible grip.Total fail.

This is one of my favorites and the first time that I've used an entire tube of lip color, usually I have to throw them away because they've become too old and it isn't a good idea to keep old cosmetics.I don't wear makeup everyday, but lipstick or gloss are my thing, I have full, pale lips with an icky lavender color to them, so whenever I feel especially in need of a color perkup, I reach for lipgloss.  But some glosses are just too greasy and some lipsticks are too hard and chalky for my often dry lips, this is somewhere in between.I even get compliments on it, something that never happens with other lip colors.
