Best of all, if you put on a light coat it just looks like a healthy I-just-went-for-a-brisk-walk glow.I can't attest to its staying power, I usually forget I'm wearing it and go about my day doing all sorts of lip color wearing activities; eating, sneezing, making rude fart noises, drinking coffee, but I haven't noticed that it disappears any faster than my regular clinique color; Shy (that's the name of the color, simply awful, right?).One of the perks of buying Clinique lipsticks (the only ones I buy) is that they are fragrance free. So if you have a problem with perfumes, I think you'd like this lipstick.  I love it.

Not as square and sturdy as I'd hoped.  They are however, exactly the color you see on your screen, a pretty blue like you see on a hazy winter evening.  The strange thing about the baskets was the scent.I was a little worried that they'd smell a bit musty or mildewed, but instead they smell like freshly picked lavender.  Not the noxious lavender candles you can buy at a certain mall candle store and not the lavender essential oil which I find so sharp and offensive, they smell like the real deal, floral with a hint of hay (I live not far from a Lavender farm, in the spring, when the flowers are first blooming, the smell spreads to everything, our clothes, our food, it's nice.  I usually don't like the smell of flowers.)The baskets have a tendency to lean inwards a bit and I'd be loath to use them in a damp place- like the bathroom.  But I'm using the largest basket to hold gloves and the two smaller baskets are holding small desk items.The texture and color are unique and I like them a little more than I thought I would. I'm not usually a natural weave, earthy products kind of decorator (when it comes to cleaning and toiletries, I am though), but I'm surprised at what a nice contrast they make to the glossy glass and hard wood that I usually lean to when it comes to storage items.

A fast winter read.While this was a quick and mostly satisfying read, I had a few problems with the resolution, the bad guys, the good guys and the entire set up for this book.  But somehow, even with these marks against it, I finished the book in two days and generally was entertained.For the good;1.  The heroine, Britt.  She's determined, thinks ahead and is vulnerable in ways that were believable.  In the beginning of the book her reactions to the events that happened once she and her best friend were stranded on the highway were real and honest.  As the story went on I thought she seemed a little too stoic.  But this was a minor quibble.2.  Britt's inner thoughts, I found so much to relate with here, in spite of the fact that I am not a teenager, not heartbroken about a  boy and have never desired a mountain backpacking vacation.  The way she talks about her relationship with her ex, Calvin and even more revealing, her friendship with Korbie.  I've experienced the girl competition with a friend and I'm afraid my reaction was the same, shock, that there was a competition and disappointment, that my friend thought of me in that way.3.  The mountains.  There was a certain amount of desperation because of the scenery. When you plop a modern person into the mountains with no handy space heaters, bathtubs of hot water and refrigerators full of food, it can feel like the end of the world.  The setting of the story took on a life of its own as it forced the characters to act, harshly and quickly to the threats of death that were approaching with each chill breeze.Now for the bad;1.  Why drag along your shopping obsessed, I can't go outside without my makeup friend to a hiking trip?  Of all the vacations to avoid, reluctant vacationers is high on my list.2.  The Killer's motivations, they didn't make sense, he was jealous!?Spoilers!!!!Don't read past this point if you don't want spoilers!I warned ya.3.  Leaving Korbie behind was too neat a solution.4.  The shootout at the end and the way Mason was able to slip away, evading a massive manhunt when just hours before he needed Britt's help to get off the mountain, not to mention the fact that he was injured and bleeding, come on!  Too easy an ending.A pretty mixed bag, I didn't even realize how much some things bugged me until I typed up this review, but, anyways, this was an okay book.

The Lynburn Legacy series is one that I'd seen at the bookstore and it was even recc'd to me on Amazon a few times, but it took me several months and too many book duds before I gave this series a try.  Boy am I glad I did, because it so much better than I thought it would be for two super cool reasons;First, the main character, Kami Glass, is sassy.  She's a smartass, wisecracking fount of asides and questionable wisdom.  I freaking love her.  There isn't enough sass in YA fiction and reading the first book in this series, Unspoken, illuminated this terrible void.  There is an abundance of angst, naivete, melancholy, straightlaced prudery and needless rebelliousness but pert and cheeky girls, not so much. Every situation Kami encounters she faces with a witty rejoinder and brave effort.Second thing I love the most is the intriguing worldbuilding.  On the surface, Sorry-in-the-Vale is a normal, boring English village.  But in reality otherworldly events have shaped the village and its people in surprising ways, Not the least of which is Kami and her imaginary friend (secret voice in her head that turns out to be a real boy, sorry for the spoiler, but Untold is the second book in the series and the voice-in-the-head mystery is revealed in book one).  The worldbuilding is doled out in small amounts, so you don't have to wade through chapters of explanations about what the world is like and why.The strangeness of Sorry-in the-Vale (Best name ever, am I right?) explodes when the plots of book one come to a head, leaving me breathlessly waiting for book two, hallelujah, Ms. Brennan is a fast writer.  Hearts are broken, evildoers revealed and Kami is left alone as the one person she thought would always be on her side has left her.Right off book two jumps into the battle with Scarecrows that reminded me a bit of a Doctor Who episode; The Family of Blood.  Anyways, the story goes on from here with Kami doing her best to protect the people she cares about.More secrets are revealed and the battle for the Vale isn't just on the horizon its starting.  Now that the Lynburns and magic have returned, the reader realizes that the village was never what they thought it was and that magic was always meant to be there.I can't help but comment on Kami and Jared, the main pairing for the book.  There is definitely some romance but I'm not sure if there will be a happily ever after for this couple, either way, I love the book and the series.

Not sure how to rate this.  I would say 5 stars on the hoodie but 1 star on the condition of the one I received.I have two of these  in gray and brown in size L and XL and both have been a little huge since I first purchased them.  Since I have lost a good deal of weight I chose to order the small in black.  It was sold and shipped by Amazon.When it arrived the package had been taped up haphazardly with packing tape and I could see it was folded down the middle and wadded up in the bag.  Not a good sign.  When I opened the plastic bag I could see it was not black but gray.  That would have been okay.  The tags had been removed and were laying in the bag. I slipped it on and while it fit with a short sleeve shirt underneath I knew it was too small to wear a sweater. I immediately got it ready to put back in the bag  When I was folding it up to send back  I really became disillusioned.  It had white matter on it that appeared like hardened sugar from a glazed donut. It also had pet hair and lint on it.  Obviously it had been worn and was not in new condition.I do intend to reorder as this is a very unusual occurance with anything from Amazon.  I do realize it had a reduced price but if it indicates it is a new item it should be in new condition.

I am so very pleasd twith this bracelet.  The stones are all flawless and vibrant in color.  The silver charms add a little "something" to it special.  I have a 6 1/2" wrist and this fits perfectly with some dangle room.  It is great to pair with the other jasper bracelet and the color connection bracelet.  Not to mention the green color connections and turquoise!  Very versatile little gem here.

I recently purchased this ring and the matching enhancer.  They are so much more lovely in person.  The bronze around the lucious pink stone really sets it off.  The filverwork is beautiful.  It has a large presence but feels great on the finger and is smooth as silk on the back.

I purchased these beads to make a necklace for a sleeping beauty enhancer pendant.  I was going to try to make it out of sleeping beauty beads but they are out of sight in price.  Decided to try these instead.  They are a perfect match to my pendant and look very believeable when matched together.  I have used Howlite beads before and found they hold up very well and the dye does not come off.

It took 11 days for these earrings to arrive which was within the timeframe offered at checkout.  They were definitely worth the weight.First let me say they are not the dark color shown on your screen.  I did not expect them to be.  Carnelian is a orange red and not so dark.  Mine came in exactly as I expected.  The stones are evenly matched in color, quality, and size.  The silverwork is flawless with unique post design.  They have a substantial post but I did need to replace the back to a larger disk back to hold the earring post in the correct position.  The post is at the bottom of the top section and they wanted to fall forward.  Once a larger back was in place the earrings were worn all day without moving.  They are light in weight but heavy in prescence.I have ordered from Novica before and each time I find what I receive to be well worth waiting for!

For some time I have noticed this ring and thought it was a little plain but when on sale at 40%  off decided to give it a try.  I had just purchased another item from Carolyn Pollack in smoky quartz and needed a ring to match in silver.I was so very pleased when I opened the velvet type bag and saw this ring.  It is a real beauty.  It is all silver with zero oxidation.  There is intricate silverwork under the setting and down the shank of the ring.  The stone is rounded and not faceted.  I have a 8 carat smoky quartz in gold and this stone is much larger than that one.  I do wish the carat weight had been mentioned in the description.  Please take a moment to look at the views which show this ring at different angles to see its real beauty.  If I had done that sooner I would have tried this ring sooner.  The main view does not depict this rings true beauty.
These clasps work very well when string bead strands.  I have found this brand holds up well and the plating stays put.

I have several KitchenAid peelers which I use daily.  Since I collect Fiestaware in a variety of colors for my kitchen I thought this would be a nice addition.I received the sunflower and it does match my sunflower Fiesta dishes.  It also appears very well made.  However, it is much heavier and bulkier than the KitchenAid peeler.  FYI the KitchenAid weighs in at 2.3 ounces while the Fiesta weighs in at 6.1 ounces.  Due to this weight I feel it very awkward to handle when peeling.  It is also 1 1/4 inches longer than the KitchenAid and this makes it more difficult to use as well.  However, the blades on both are the same length.This is one of those items I should have returned but didn't.  If all of my other peelers are dirty then I will pull this out and use it in a pinch.

This is quite beautiful with lots of intricate details.  It is fun just to stare at and find all those details.  It features a large enhancer bail which should accomodate up to 8mm beads or pearls.  The bronze outline as well as the brass around the stone accentuate all the highs and lows of the silverwork details.  I have the brass colored cord necklace already which it suits very well.  Unfortunately as sometimes happens with natural gemstones my stone has a large black spot at the center of the lovely rhodonite stone.  Looks as if someone took a Sharpie and colored a spot.  I will be returning this but am unsure I will reorder due to the size of the pendant.  It is almost 2 1/2 inches long and 1 1/2 inches wide and weighs in at 30 grams.  I am afraid it might be overwhelming for my stature.  If you can pull off a pendant this size, then this one is a true beauty.

This is definitely a statement enhancer if ever there was one.  The silverwork is so beautiful with lots of swirls and a heart shape on the large enhancer bail.  This easily fits over a bead necklace or strand of pearls 8mm.  The bronze around the rose quartz is genius as it enhances the large glossy pink stone.  The stone in my pendant (and matching ring) is much pinker than this online photo indicates.  This pendant is equally well suited for satin or leather necklace.

This is a lovely bracelet with nice evenly matched cubed red jasper stones.  Looks very nice paired with the color connections red jasper, carnelian, and red bamboo coral bracelet by Relios.  The charm makes a jingling noise when wearing and is brass with flower design on one side and curly cue pattern on the other.  I have a 6 1/2" wrist and this fits nicely with hanging room.

I first purchased the matching Pietersite earrings and loved them so much that I purchased the matching ring.  The stones in both items were just beautiful. Rich glossy dark brown with flecks of gold.  I had never seen Pietersite before but was quite impressed with their quality.  After admiring the necklace and enhancer for a few months I finally decided to purchase.First let me say that Relios, Southwest Spirit, Carolyn Pollack and American West are all under the same company umbrella.  Anything you purchase is of impeccable quality.  They have wonderful customer service and guarantee their jewelry for life.  This necklace was no exception.  The stones are large without any flaws, the silver beads are of a substantial size and offset the brown stones beautifully, the clasp is unique and will accept any of the medium and large enhancers, the enhancer is lovely and of substantial size.  My only problem was the stone in the enhancer  has a great deal of gray matrix in only the top half of the stone.  While the bottom half is the rich dark brown with gold flecks like my ring and earrings. No one else might ever notice but I can tell it even at a distance.  The other beads in the necklace also have a great deal of the grey matrix which is fine but I wanted the enhancer to match my ring and earrings more closely.  This is just one of those things that happen when you are dealing with natural stones.  If my ring had the same matrix I would not mind.I have ordered another necklace and enhancer in hopes that I will find a more suitable stone.Update.  Unfortunately the second necklace had even  more pronounced grey matrix both in the enhancer and the beads.  While it is just lovely with beautiful stones, it doesn't come close to matching my dark brown earrings and ring.  This happens in dealing with natural stones.  I think for now I will have to pass on this lovely necklace.  If I could receive one colored like the photo I would be very happy.

I had previously purcahsed the red mult igemstone 36" necklace from Relios and loved it so much that I purchased the matching bracelet and Fiery Tones Enhancer which are just stunning together.  I thought necklace would add even more options and I was correct. The enhancer is especially beautiful on this as are many others.  You can even add the bracelet to this necklace and have a 26" necklace.  All of it together is a real WOW!  The stones are varying shades of red with carnelian, jasper, and red bamboo.  Red bamboo is really bright red while the carnelian is an orangy red and the jasper a deep burgundy.  The stones are well matched and flawless.  The clasp is well designed and works effortlessly.  As always, you can depend on Relios, Southwest Spirit and Carolyn Pollack jewelry to be of the best workmanship.

This is a stunning three strand necklace by Relios jewelry.  The stones are varying shades of turquoise beaded tightly and capped with shiny silver caps with toggle clasp.  The quality is wonderful.I will be returning the "18" inch necklace as the one I received measured 20 1/4" and is simply too long for my intended purpose.  I don't know if I was sent the incorrect size as the actual bead section masures 18".  The packaging doesn't indicate any size.

When Carolyn Pollack does whimsy I am always delighted.  I had the enhancer as well as the matching bracelet.  Purchased these to match and they are a real delight.  These birds appear to be ready for flight!  Such nice detail and light as air!  Love that the dangles make a whispering sound when you move.  Love them!  Great buy!

I am particularly fond of this necklace.  I love the Relios 36" necklaces as they can be doubled for even more presence.  The red stones of carnelian, jasper and red bamboo provide varying shades of red which matches many outfits and various enhancers.  The stones in mine are flawless and smooth as silk.  The only thing I would say could be improved is the small o ring.  It would be easier to faster if just a bit larger.If you already have this necklace I would like to suggest the Fiery Tones Enhancer available from Relios.  It is a perfect match and looks beautiful on this strand of beads.

My wrist is 6 3/4" and I purchased both the 7" and 8" of this bracelet to see which fit best.  I knew with charms added it would take up some of the space.  I was correct and found I needed to have the 8" size when charms are added.The bracelet is slightly oxidized and is adjustable.  I love the oversized lobster claw clasp which allows me to put it on and off without assistance.  It is a real workhorse for me.  I have ten charms on it which are about 1" in size.  It holds them without my worrying about breaking and losing the whole shebang.I have had this bracelet for almost two years and wear it frequently.  It looks like new and is one of my favorite bracelets.

I had ordered this bracelet in the green version for a friend and was so impressed I purchased the red for myself.  I have other matching red pieces from Relios and thought this would compliment them.  I was exactly correct.  It matches the "color collection" perfectly as well as the multigemstone 18" toggle necklace.  Just a tip...it can be attached to the 18" and makes a longer necklace.The sterling cap is ribbed and there are intricate designs on the remainder of the clasp.  It opens and closes securely.  Keep in mind that you can add the enhancer charms for even more versatility.  The stones are varying shades of red from the orangy red of carnelian to the bright red of the red bamboo.  This matches a variety of colors and is great for fall and winter yet looks great with the nautical summer look.My wrist is 6 3/4" but with the large stones the 8" fits me perfectly with just a little dangle room.

I have admired this piece for some time now.  I have a matching ring, the red jasper, carnelian, and red bamboo necklace and bracelet in the "color connections" collection as well as the 36" red beaded necklace.  While I love those pieces when you add this piece it is a really stunning ensemble.  My favorite is to wear it with the 36" necklace doubled.This features a large red carnelian flower or cross design with carved lines accentuated by 8 amber cabachons with a large mother of pearl diamond shaped cabachon surrounded by sterling beads in the center.  It has a oversized enhancer bail with beading as well.  The back is silky smooth.  While it is named a "cross" design to me it appears more flower like.  What a fiery statement this makes.  With the color scheme it is perfect for fall and winter.  Red carnelian lends itself to be more rust in color and looks beautiful with the amber stones.So glad I was able to purchase this piece.

I had ordered the pietersite earrings from Relios and liked them so much that I decided to try the ring.  I am glad that I did.While I am not a "western" sort of gal I was concerned about this design.  However, it was unfounded.  This ring is appropriate no matter what your style.  The rope detail allows this to match up with other Relios designs with ease.  The ring is a knuckle to knuckle style with a large glossy pietersite stone.  If you have never seen pietersite of this quality it is definitely worth a look.  My stone had lots of flakes of golden in it and it is just stunning.  There are open spaces beside the stone and this gives your finger some air and adds to the deminsion of the ring.  It is extremely comfortable and very eye catching.  I am seriously considering the matching enhancer and necklace.

This shoe is very well made and the criss cross design adds some character to the shoe.  This fit as expected but my foot is on the narrower side of Medium and it fits me snugly.  Usually I add a pedag or vionic insert to all my shoes and did so with this shoe as there is very little arch support.  I have had this shoe a few months with weekly wear and they are holding up nicely.

I ordered this dress in a size Large and X-Large based on the reviews I read before ordering.  At the time I was in size 10 clothing.  Both dresses were too large.  The dress appeared well made.  The print of the fabric is rather large but in beautiful colors.  However, my main reason for not ordering in a smaller size was the weight of the dress and the extreme flare of the skirt.  I felt weighted down wearing it.

This was a very well made dress out of wonderful fabric.  However, in my opinion the online photo is misleading.  The black and white print appears much larger in person.  However, the main reason I returned the dress was that the skirt was extremely flared.  Appeared as if you needed a crinoline slip!

I liked this pendant when I saw it online and was not disappointed by its appearance when it arrived.  It is of substantial size with nice silverwork detail.  It features purple quartzite, malachite and sponge coral stones.I have so many items that this enhancer will match and was eager to try it on my beaded necklaces.Unfortunately it has a very small enhancer bail and would not fit on a single bead necklace I own.  I even have one of the Relios toggle closure necklaces for which I have now found out this was designed but it would not fit on it either.  Reluctantly I returned this enhancer.  I have noticed that it does say it has a "small" bail which I did not see prior to ordering.

I have been eyeing these earrings for several months as I thought they were particularly lovely.  These are some of the largest in the Relios collection and I decided they were going to be something I would wear often and worth the investment.When they arrived I was pleased with the silverwork and the size.  However, I found the stones disappointing.  The lapis were beautiful evenly matched stones, the turquoise on one earring had some darker matrix while the other earring the turquoise was without matrix at all.  Then there is the amethyst in which I was most unhappy with.  The amethyst stones on both earrings was very pale lavender.  Not nearly the rich color I was expecting.  With the lapis and turquoise stones being such rich colors the amethyst appeared even paler.  Somehow the amethyst appeared not to go well at all.Regardless of the stones I would have returned this earring as it was just too heavy for my ears and drooped forward even though these have a substantial back.

Purchased this ring to replace a malachite ring that didn't fit any longer.  It is part of a matching ensemble of enhancer, malachite bead strand, earrings and bracelet.  Those pieces are a beautiful dark rich green.  They have no light green at all.  I knew I as taking a chance finding a ring with the exact shading but was hopeful.When I opened the box I was disappointed by the stone.  It has a design that looks like half of a knot hole with lots of very light green that almost appears white.  While the stone is a very substantial size and is smooth as silk it doesn't come close to matching my other malachite pieces.  The silverwork is beautiful and the ring is very well made.  Also, I am between a 5 and 6 in ring size now and was surprised that this size 6 is so tight I cannot get it all the way on my finger.

Was unsure how to rate this shoe.  It is a very well made shoe although it lacks any arch support.  The leopard design is very cute with mixtures of grey, black, taupe and chocolate brown in the print.  It would match lots of outfits and would be appropriate most any season.  The elastic band is done in black.Normally I wear Clarks and Vionic shoes and wear a 9.5M.  SInce I have not worn a pair of Bass shoes in quite a while I decided to order both the 9.5M and 10M in an effort to find a good fit.  Tried the 9.5M on first and was surprised that it was too short and rubbed my toes and noticed that it was a bit wide and gaped open on the sides of the arch area.  Then tired on the 10M.  It too was too short and rubbed my toes and the width was huge.  Neither shoe fit properly and am returning both.

I couldn't agree more with the previous reviewer.  Both about the ring and the company.  I would like to add the American West line to the Relios, Southwest Spirit and Carolyn Pollack.  I buy from all and feel confident about the quality, craftsmanship, and customer service.This is one of the enhancer pendants and it will readily fit over a variety of chains and beads.  I am not a "green" person usually but found this shade of green looks great with summer colors of fushia, yellow, aqua, etc.  but looks equally at home with brown and mustard yellow as well as black.It is well made and finished beautifully.  Note the size is not one of the large ones usually available but really stands on its own.

I originally ordered a diferent variscite ring from Relios.  When I was sent the wrong size I decided to order this one instead.  I am so delighted that I did.  While the other ring is beautiful, I would have to say I prefer this one over it.  The stones are about the same size and are both beautiful in color and both have very nice silverwork.  The other ring does feature a bit thicker sterling.  This one is more lacy in appearance but solid in person.  I also purchased the matching enhancer from the Carolyn Pollack website and together they are really beautiful.  Also, this size 6 is a perfect fit.  Love it!

I ordered this dress in a size 10 and size 12.  Both fit similarly but the 12 seemed to be the best fit and that is the one I kept.The dress is very nicely manufactured with smooth seams and quality fabric. You cannot see through this fabric and could easily wear without a camisole or slip.  The jacket is a heavier weight and would go nicely with other clothing if you have something that would match.  The color is a beautiful navy just as the online photo indicates. I ordered this for an afternoon wedding and it was perfectly appropriate.I had this a few weeks prior to the wedding and had tried it on when it arrived.  I should have double checked as I didn't realize the way the bodice is cut.  It is very low near the arm holes and I did not have a single bra that the top of the bra did not show!  I ended up have to pin the dress to my bra and had to leave the jacket on the entire time!  I would definitely suggest checking that aspect of the dress upon its arrival.

This was my first purchase of Cobb Hill brand shoes.  The had a look about them that reminded me of Clarks shoes and when I saw this one so deeply discounted I siezed the opportunity to try out the brand.I ordered my usual size of 9.5M in the blue/teal color.  I was not disappointed when it arrived.  If I had not known better I would have thought it a Clarks shoe.  The quality of the leather and the styling and attention to detail were not overlooked by Cobb Hill.  The color really is very teal and will look good for fall.  I liked the tread and the heel design as well.As far as the sizing...I found it to be spot on with Clarks as well except that the right shoe seemed a bit wider than the left.  Not usual for me when purchasing shoes.  The right shoe seemed to slip a bit when walking as well.  I have ordered another Cobb Hill similar style in the narrow width to see if it works better for me.  If so I may return these for the narrower width since I don't plan on wearing them until fall.  Will update when the new ones arrive.

I had been looking for a nice pair of brown shoes to wear with a maxi skirt, leggings and dress pants.  Saw this at a phenomenal price and took a chance.My usual Clarks size is 9.5M (I am on the narrow side of M) and these fit perfectly!  They were as if made for my foot.  The elastic goring allows for easy on and off. While they have a "shootie" appearance I think they would go well with most any apparel.  The photo does not do justice to the strips of leather across the front of the shoe.  One is suede, one is smooth leather and one strip is snake print.  The inside of the shoe is very plush and sued as well with good support.  Having had knee replacement I can no longer wear high heels and found this shoe height to be ideal for everyday wear.I loved this shoe so much that I immediately ordered the black suede option even though it was $16 more!  I hope I am as delighted with it.

I have very mixed opinions of this shoe and have not decided if I will keep it or return.  I have been searching for quite some time for a nice grey leather shoe to wear with grey dress pants.First, sizing, I usually wear a 9.5M in Clarks shoes and found this one fit perfectly in width and length.  I found it a bit snug to try to put it on without unbuckling and if someone had a high arch they might have to unbuckle every time putting it on.  I would have had room to wear only a thin sock.Secondly, support.  There is virtually no arch support in this shoe. That is not an issue for me since I always have to put an orthotic arch support in all my shoes.Thirdly, structure.  It is a very well made shoe that looks very high end. However there is no cushioning around the ankle area and it feels rough to the skin. I believe wearing them for any period of time would cause blisters.Fourth, looks.  While it is "menswear" inspired it has a femine appearance as well.  The photo does not adequately depict the cutout design on the toe area.  Those circle cutouts are filled in with glossy black!  It really takes away from the appearance of the shoe in my opinion.  Almost as if something has been spilled on the toe of the shoe.I have tried this shoe on several times and just can't warm up to it.  However, the color is just what I was looking for minus the glossy black fillins on the toe.Ultimately I decided to return.

I ordered this shoe in my usual size 9.5M in Clarks in the tan leopard print.  I have worn Clarks for years and it is rare that a pair does not fit properly if I order my usual size.  In the case of this shoe, it didn't come close to fitting properly.  The length seemed fine but it gapped open on each side in the arch area.  It just looked awful.  When I tried to take a few steps it was like wearing flip flops. I am printing out the return label as I write this review.On the other hand the shoe is very well made and looks like an expensive driving moccasin.  Lots of designer details make this a very pricey in appearance shoe.

My three stars are for the color.  I have not yet tried the product and will be returning this trio.  The color "So Chic" appears to be a pretty purple shade both on Amazon and on Treat's website.  However, the bottle I received is VERY dark purple and is close to black in color.
This is a very well made charm and is very cute on my bracelet.  Pleased with the quality but wish both sides had been enameled.

Ordered this with great expectation for heat therapy.  Sorely disappointed.  First it is very heavy and cumbersome weighing in at 2.5 pounds.  Secondly, you are only supposed to heat each side in the microwave 30-45 seconds and then wait one minute before using. That does not give it much warmth and it quickly dissapates.

I checked with the local watch shop and they did not have a navy 24mm replacement band for my Guess watch.  So I took to Amazon to try and locate one.  This was the only one in the 24mm size in navy and I quickly purchased.  It arrived quickly and in good condition (or so I thought).My husband had no trouble removing the old band and getting this one ready.  He first put on the section that is longer with the holes.  It was a little difficult and a very tight fit.  The other section took him almost an hour to put on and required him to cut a part of the band off where it attaches to the watch.  The back of the band lining ends were not cut from the portion that the pins slip through and this made this side of the band quite a bit thicker than the other side.  He actually had to put this side in a vice and smash it together to get it to be thin enough to siip on my watch.Yes I would have returned had I known it was going to take this much time and be this aggrevating.  Bottom line is the band was not properly made but we didn't know that until well into trying to put it on the watch.
I like having these on auto delivery. I keep one on hand and know when the next one arrives it is time to change.  These have always worked flawlessly.
Ordered this for my husband's 2014 Harley Road King.  He installed it quickly and without difficulty.  It looks superb on his bike and adds some extra chrome in an otherwise black area of the bike.

These have definitely become a staple in our home.  We have two cats and two litter boxes with tile floors.  We use the blue crystal litter.  I wanted something disposable to help keep the litter from tracking all over the tile floors.  Decided to try these puppy pads and they are wonderful.  The litter sticks to the cotton like top like a charm.  We are on our second box.  We change them every few days.  This is such an economical purchase that will last about a year for us.

I had watched this item for a while and was interested in purchasing for my two cats.  They love to follow things like my Roomba around and thought this might interest them.It arrived well packaged and in good condition.  You must have a screw driver to put the batteries inside. The one I received had a white and dark brown hamster and the ball was not pink as pictured but rather a clear blue color.  Naturally my cats could have cared less about the coloring.The ball is easy to open but you do have to match up the hole to close it securely.  It rolls around really good on hardwoods and tile but is sluggish to almost stopping on carpeting.  The hamster does not make noise as the zhu zhu pets do.  You do hear the wheels rolling.Others had mentioned using it without the ball.  The hamster only goes around and round in small circle if you use it without the ball.My cats are interested in this and it keeps them occupied for a few minutes but they quickly lose interest and walk away.  Keep in mind you have to take it out of the ball everytime you want to turn it on or off.  I am not sure how much use the plastic knotches and holes will hold up.  However it is an inexpensive cat toy.

My daughter purchased one of these first and recommended it to me.  I wanted to try microwave potato chips and needed a mandoline slicer.  The price on this one has varied from $16 to $22 over the past couple of weeks and I was able to purchase at the lower price.This comes from Norpro which is a reputable company I have purchased from before.  There are a variety of blades but I have only used the regular blade which is very sharp and makes quick work of slicing potatoes.  It also comes with a juicer attachment.  It does unfold and stands securely.I will say that I do not like the mechanism and the guard that holds the item to slice.  It is very unstable and your vegetable (or fruit, cheese, etc) must attach to the four prongs inset in the guard. Most of the potatoes I have used did not fit properly as they were either too large or too small. For me, very few items have fit securely and I find myself using my hand instead.  You have to be exceedlingly careful to to slice your fingers!For use once in a while this is fine as long as I am careful.  For everyday use I would definitely purchase something in a higher price range with  more safety features.

These sheets are just great!  They come folded in fourths and the box contains 22 sheets.  I have used each sheet multiple times when preparing microwave potato chips with no breakdown.  This is such a great alternative to the large bulky rolls of parchment paper that never cut right and cause such waste.  I am so glad that I found these online as I have not been able to find them locally.

Doing whole30 most of us have been fans of the Larabar since it doesn't contain any ingredients that are not approved.  The carrot cake flavor is my favorite.  I find it not too oily but still moist.  To me these bars are very satisfying but are very rich tasting.

Hands down this is my favorite knife of all time.  I orginally found this knife at a discount store and was intrigued as the packaging indicated it was perfect for slicing tomatoes.  Even though I balked at the $12 price tag I decided to try it.  I was amazed to find out how much these knives retail for and have since purchased one everytime I find one less than $20.It is the perfect size and weight for everyday slicing of veggies and fruits.  It will slice a tomato paper thin as well as onions and anything else you put in its path.  My husband has since found a set of these in a larger more rigid size that are great as well.  Henckels knives are certainly worth every penny.  I recently purchased one and sent to my daughter who wanted a good knife.

This is one of my favorite kitchen gadgets.  Having arthritis in my fingers makes opening jars painful sometimes.  Then sometimes there are just jars no one with reasonable strength can open!  This is a lifesaver for me.  No more frustration at trying to start a recipe only to find you cannot open a key ingredient.  One note:  this will not open jars with less than 1" diameter (think soy sauce bottle) but there is one available from Kuhn Rikon that will fit some of those smaller size bottles if that is what you need. It is called a multi function jar opener.  FYI these are all available in a variety of colors.

My daughters and I are all on the whole 30 program and thus chop, slice, and dice a variety of veggies and fruits daily. One daughter complained that she didn't have enough knives.  So, for her birthday I selected this set as part of her present.  They were a huge hit.  She loved the cheerful colors as well as the selection and the fact that they had covers for each of the blades.  My other daughter wants a set too.  I think I might have to get one for myself as well.  Where else can you get fabulous knives with covers at a price under $30?

I have two of these can openers in my kitchen so that I always have one clean.  I have also purchased two for each of my daughter's.  They work seamlessly and clean up easily in the dishwasher or by hand washing.  The can top comes off smoothly and you can lift the lid off with the side teeth.  I have had mine for a number of years and it still is sharp and has  no issues.  I have arthritis in my fingers and I find this much easier than any other can opener.  I tossed my electric one in favor of this one.

I use a variety of colors of Fiesta Ware in my kitchen and found these coordinate beautifully with those dishes and cookware.  I like that you can seperate them if needed and that they are clearly marked with their individual measurements.

Well, this was a disappointment. I was sent a sample for an independent review, and I trusted the size chart. Big mistake! I asked for my usual size Medium but Meaneor must have changed suppliers because this top is easily two sizes too small for me. The top part (shoulders) is only a little tight, but the sleeves are really narrow and there is no space at all for my hips. So when they say slim fit, that is code for cut straight. If your hips flare out, as mine do, this top was not made for us! To add to the size issue, the cuffs and bottom edge of the jacket are made of the same material, instead of the more traditional elasticated ribbed knit, so there is no stretch at all and I could hardly get my hand inside the cuff.It's a shame because the top is really pretty, and it deserves the 4 stars I've given it. I like the zip detail, the studs and the hood. The fabric seems of good quality and is a lot heavier and (I think) warmer than I anticipated. The colour (I have the Lake Blue) is also lovely. It's just that the cut will only suit a certain type of figure and is not forgiving or adjustable. And if anyone at Meaneor is listening, it would be an idea to include a hip measurement for this style of garment, just to give us a hint, because according to the size chart, this jacket should have fit me. To help you decide, I've just measured the inside of the hip hem for a size Medium and it's 34 inches or 86 cm.

My review relates to the Inateck hard drive enclosure - Model FE3001.  I received a sample to allow me to test and review this brilliant new hard drive enclosure.These cases essentially turn any 3.5 (and also 2.5 in this case) internal SATA hard drive into a portable external drive, and are invaluable to retrieve data in case of computer failure.  What is different about this model is the aluminium alloy skin, which makes the enclosure a bit heavier than the usual plastic, but takes full advantage of the metal's heat dissipating properties.  As a state-of-the-art product, there is UASP support, providing top blazing speeds of up to 6GBps.  In practice, operating speed will depend on your set-up and attached device, but the specs are certainly impressive.  It also comes with a fast USB 3.0 interface, retro-compatible to older standards.My old pc has now been superseded by a brand new tower, so this caddy arrived at a perfect time, saving me the chore of wiping the old drive clean before safe disposal.  Instead, I have acquired a really useful removable hard drive for backup storage.The caddy is a solidly-built aluminium alloy case with a USB 3.0 Micro B port, power input and two small LED lights (blue for activity and green to confirm power). Also in the box are a very capable-looking USB cable (1 metre long), a 12V adapter for direct connection to a wall outlet, a small screwdriver, screws and foam pads to stabilize the drive, and a very clear manual in English and German. Installation is really simple: open the shell, place your hard drive inside, aligning the connectors, secure laterally with the screws (the same way as when mounting a hard drive inside a tower), slide the whole thing closed and secure the side with two screws.You then plug the adapter into a convenient outlet, connect the FE3001 to your computer via the supplied USB cable and turn it on. USB 3.0 protocol is backward compatible with older USB standards. Everything about this caddy is geared towards flexibility and compatibility.In action, this drive case delivers impressive speeds for both read and write operations, and as I would have expected, it performs much better with my new tower than my year-old laptop (both running Win 8.1). I have tested other Inateck products and, without exception, they are reliable and well engineered. This top quality piece of kit will be in constant use now as a backup removable drive.

Very happy with these leggings which, for a change, are actually long enough for my legs.  I'm 5'8 (1.73 m), not exceptionally tall but, somehow, I have trouble finding leggings that cover the ankles.  I received a sample pair for an independent evaluation, and when I tried them on, was very pleased to see that a size S/M is just about perfect for me.  The other available size is L/XL and might have been just as good but I went with my waist size and they fit me like a second skin (my usual dress size is US 8).  They don't quite reach my waistline but I find them really comfortable to wear, all day, with a long sweater or loose top.  They look good with just about anything.I got them in Black and they are a nice thickness, not exactly thermal like fleece, but warmer than some others I have.  Actually quite dressy and they have a nice bit of stretch, the knees don't get baggy after I've been sitting for a while.  Easy to wash, I used a cool setting and they did not shrink at all.  Despite the low price, finishing and stitching are very good.  If they had them in dark blue, I would certainly buy two or three pairs.

Since I started using one of these acrylic organizers last year, I have become sort of addicted.  When Kurtzy extended an invitation to try out their version of these products, I was curious to see how it would compare.Their range includes a number of acrylic organizer in different shapes and sizes so there is a great choice depending on what you want to store.  However, it's difficult to decide what gets the star treatment:  cosmetics, make-up, creams, jewellery, sewing notions?  I have lots of small objects that benefit greatly from being organized in a see-through display that looks this pretty, so this is my third one.It is a small chest with four drawers, two wide (22 x 12 cm approx.) and two half size, side by side.  The soft mesh fabric keeps your stuff from sliding about but can be removed if you don't need it, or you can use your own fabric liners, lace or even paper.  Originally I envisaged using this to store small electronic components such as short USB charging cables, plug converters, mp3s, Bluetooth transmitters, and the like but, having filled it with jewellery to take my photos, I think I've changed my mind.  See, that's the problem.  These units are too versatile, and too decorative!The materials used are of  very good quality:  the clear acrylic plastic is solid and quite thick; the drawers slide smoothly and retract fully into the box, giving good protection from dust; the moulded handles of the same clear plastic are easy to grasp; there's nothing cheap about it.  The chest sits squarely on a table or vanity and I found that one of my old make-up organizers fits perfectly over the top, making it into a 2-tier little cabinet.  I was hoping to find one with slots large enough for bottles of essential oils.  That would be terrific, as I have more than 40 sliding about in a large box.  Maybe the one for nail polish bottles would work?

This set of writing instruments was sent to me for evaluation, and I was really looking forward to trying them out because I am somewhat of a pen aficionado.  However, what could have been a really good quality product falls short on several levels, as I will explain.  The box is quite nice, bi-coloured and pretty enough to give as a gift.  Inside, however, the presentation drops a little in quality:  the two pens are loosely held by a ribbon, and three extra ink cartridges are floating about in the box (there was one more inside the pen).  It looks like a last-minute addition, rather than a well thought-out package.Both pens are chunky and smooth, made of brushed stainless steel and they look identical.  I like thick pens and prefer them to overly-skinny ones that are difficult to hold, however, these pens are fairly heavy and, once the cap is in place, they don't feel terribly well balanced.  To make matters worse, the cap does not lock very well and sometimes falls off while I'm writing.The ballpoint writes beautifully and has a smooth point that simply glides over the page.  The medium-fine point is exactly what I like best and, as one expects from good pens, it brings out my best penmanship.  The fountain pen, however, the one I was really interested in, for some reason refuses to work.  I have owned dozens of fountain pens, from my school days on, and have done everything I can think of to clean and prime this pen, but to no avail: the ink simply does not flow into the nib.I'm sure it's a fluke, because others seem to have a different experience, but I have to review the item I was sent, and this fountain pen is defective.  It might be that the ink is partly at fault and that brings me to the last reason this set loses points.  There is no indication, either in the packaging, or online of the type of refill that would be suitable.  So, once the current ballpoint cartridge is finished, I have no idea what to buy to replace it.  As for the fountain pen, I have wasted three cartridges trying it coax it into writing, and don't know what refills I should get.So, with regret, I can only award three stars, mostly because the ballpoint pen is really lovely.  At the current price of $20 (including shipping), these should be a decent buy, but I would prefer to spend a little more and have two working pens, rather than just one.

Last year I got a similar organizer for some of my smaller make-up items and it has literally changed the way I do things in that department.  No more searching through make-up bags, or messy drawers.  So, when offered the chance to try out this two-tier organizer for review purposes, I was delighted to accept.There are two pieces: the base unit consists of two shallow drawers lined with a soft, plastic mesh material to stop things sliding about; the top tray is divided asymmetrically in several small compartments:  four small slots (ideal for lipsticks, lip glosses and tubes of mascara), a curved open section (where I keep lip balms), two more slots at the back with higher sides (for make-up brushes, for example) and an open section for larger items, like nail polish, jars or perfume bottles.  As you can see, this variety of compartments offers a lot of flexibility to hold small items and all the bits and pieces that get lost in larger containers.  The drawers are small (18 x 10 cm) and hold a couple of compacts each; they would also be ideal for bracelets, necklaces, hair clips.  We all have our small treasures that are difficult to store and these perfectly see-through organizers become quite addictive.  Also useful for sewing and craft supplies, jewellery, ribbons.  Once you have one, you will find lots of uses for it.This is a good quality item:  the clear acrylic plastic is thick and solid;  the drawers slide surprisingly easily.  The only thing that could be better is that the top unit only barely sits over the drawer unit, and could be dislodged by a careless movement.  It would be nice if the top could be made to slot in a little more securely. Apart from that small criticism, I find this holder incredibly useful and really pretty to look at, regardless of what you fill it with.

This beautiful, magically-folding-away guitar stand was sent to me for an independent test and evaluation, and my husband was very happy to receive it as he was one stand short of requirements.  He wrote the following review based on a test period of two weeks, including taking the stand along to a friend's place several times.The stand is extremely light, being made of aluminium.  Once folded and stored safely inside the pretty travel bag, you can carry it by the strings over the tip of your little finger.  There are three metallic finishes:  red, dark blue and silver.  I asked for the blue one, it's a gunpowder shade, very elegant.The most impressive thing about this stand (apart from its feather weight) is how easily it folds in and out.  And I mean, really smoothly.  The feet extend both front and back, the legs pull up to the perfect spot to rest your instrument on, and the rubber treads adjust to the various shapes of whatever instrument you place on them, and lock it into place with a couple of rotating little rubber wings.  It holds my large acoustics as solidly and securely as the thinner but heavier electric guitar.When I first placed a guitar over the backrest, I thought it might be a little dodgy, with the stand being so light, but it's actually very stable and functions perfectly well as a permanent holder, but with the added convenience of portability and adjustability.  Clever design, top quality manufacture and covered by a Lifetime Guarantee. I think it's great!

Sent to me for an independent test and evaluation, this guitar capo truly is deluxe.  Since my husband plays guitar and I don't, this review was prepared by him.The first thing that impressed me about this capo is the weight.  It's not a negative, in fact, I love the authoritative air of this small but solid-looking accessory.  I selected the colour Bronze and that in itself is a luxury.  Other choices are Black, Gold, Silver and Coffee.  I think Bronze looks fantastic on my guitars, it really looks classy.My old capo works on a ratchet principle and I'm never quite sure that the grip I've forced is going to be maintained.  This capo locks on by means of a strong spring and I find that really confidence-giving.  The inner surfaces are lined with a grippy silicone, smooth on top where it contacts the strings, and ribbed below to better hug the neck of the guitar, very gentle on the finish.  Incidentally, this capo is suitable for other stringed instruments as well (ukelele, bass, banjo and mandolin). I looked at the differences between the Deluxe and the Standard in a pack of two and, although I was tempted by the jazzy colours (especially the blue), I decided that I could not pass up the combination of zinc alloy body and steel spring.In use, the capo is brilliant and I'm enjoying it so much that I might be tempted to use it much more often.  Until now, capos have not been all that important to me but when you get one that works like this one, it makes you want to use it all the time.The presentation is first class:  nice box and a beautiful little protective pouch with drawstrings, nicely made to hold the capo safe and snug in transit.  Really top quality capo, and covered by a Lifetime Guarantee.  I can't see how anyone would not love it.

When I accepted this brilliant piece of kit for testing, I did not realize just how versatile it is.  Packaging is neat and unfussy.  In the small box, as well as the device itself, are a very short 3.5 mm audio cable (about 4 inches long), a good-quality USB cable with a micro connector for charging the internal battery, and a very clear manual in English and German.The idea is to create Bluetooth connectivity with equipment that is not so equipped; all you need is a 3.5 mm audio port (the place where you would plug in your earphones).  There are many similar gadgets around, however, where this tiny device really shines is that it has a dual mode: it is both a Transmitter and a Receiver.The booklet explains very extensively how to use in each mode, but basically TX is Transmitter mode and RX is Receiver mode and there is a simple slider on the side to switch from one to the other.  As per instructions, I plugged it in for an initial charge which took maybe two hours (using a USB wall charger).In use, I found it to be very dependable and very easy to pair in both modes.  Battery life and range are as advertised.  For my purposes, a once-weekly charge is all that is required. The sound is surprisingly loud and very clear, and it can be regulated from the source. Sound quality will depend on the source but I was surprised by the complexity and layering that emerged.I'm really impressed with this excellent, invaluable device.  With it I can listen through headphones to my vinyl records, or play music from my pc (which does not have Bluetooth) while I exercise, without disturbing anyone else around me, or take the sound with me on the terrace.  A very successful solution to integrate your old favourite equipment with newer technology.  The quality is well up to the standards I have come to expect from Avantek.  In my experience, all their  products have been faultless: reliable, easy to use, and well built.

I was sent a sample of these briefs for my husband's expert evaluation.  His favourite style is short-boxer or briefs, so this model appealed to him.  Since he dislikes restrictive, overtight garments, his main considerations are cut and comfort, and that depends a lot on the fabric.  Here the combination of 95% smooth cotton and 5% Spandex makes for a breathable garment with enough stretch to fit closely and move with the body without being restrictive.  The wide waistband is elastic and very comfortable.  The closed pouch at the front is well executed and gives light support without compression.  The briefs in person are just like in the photos, they do not extend down the thigh and remind me of a well-cut racing swimsuit.There is a wide selection of colours and I chose the Blue which is a bright, saturated shade very faithful to what I see on my monitor (see my photos).  The white and black contrasting accents look sharp.  With a waist measurement of 32 inches, or 82 cm, we were in between sizes, so I chose to go up one and asked for a Large.  The briefs fit perfectly, which makes me think that they may run a little small.After an appropriate testing period, my husband finds them very comfortable, and well made.  The quality of manufacture is comparable to DIM and similar brands he has tried and, so far, they have come through the wash without losing any of their elasticity or colour.

A silicone mould with 12 really detailed flower shapes, of a size best suited for small muffins, finger food, gelatine desserts and similar little mouthfuls.  It works particularly well for sticky recipes such as cheese muffins that are normally very difficult to extricate without breaking.I received a review sample for evaluation, and at first it seemed strange to put something like this (i.e. not metal or glass) in the oven.  I already had experience of baking with silicone mats, but somehow the mould seemed more risky, more prone to melting.  Anyway I shouldn't have worried, it worked beautifully.  These moulds can handle extremes of temperatures, from -40C to 230C, that's -39.99F to 446F - quite a wide range!  I really like that it allows me to bake without the use of butter to line the mould and without struggling to turn out the little cakes.Also very good for ice cubes, but best suited for long drinks, iced tea and summer punch because the ice cubes it makes are double-sized.  I measured the capacity and it takes 300 ml (10 fl. oz.) of liquid to fill the 12 flowers to the top.The only thing that needs attention is that the silicone is very soft and you need to put a tray underneath when the mould is full of water or whatever mixture you fill it with, on its way to the freezer or the oven.  However, the results are certainly worth that small extra step.  It's also extremely easy to clean and you can boil it to disinfect it.

This beautiful set has gift written all over it. But the lucky recipient could just as well be yourself. It is certainly the sort of thing I would pick for myself, when looking to start painting with acrylics. It's also a great way to refresh you old supplies, as in my case. I used to paint a very long time ago and now that I want to do some more, I find that my old brushes are in poor shape and my old paints are dried up and useless. This comprehensive set was sent to me for review and it could not have come at a better time.The set includes a proper-sized wooden palette, which I think is so much nicer than a disposable plastic dish, not least because it is shaped to be held in your hand. Whether you paint out of doors or inside a room, having your paints close to you is definitely an advantage, especially if you use an easel. There is also a very fine assortment of twelve tubes of acrylic paints (12 ml), gorgeous, saturated colours that are easy to mix and a pleasure to handle. And to give you plenty of artistic choices with the application, twelve acrylic-appropriate brushes are provided of two different types: six each with nylon and bristle heads. The brushes are also of very fine quality, with smooth and very long wooden handles and tight ferrules that keep the brushes from shedding.Acrylics are also the most versatile medium, they can be used to mimic watercolours or oils or something in between. They also lend themselves to the most inventive uses because you can use them to paint over wood, canvas, fabric, ceramic and many other supports, as well as the more traditional paper pads. One of my first projects was to decorate an old flower vase. I liked the shape but hated the gaudy design. Now it holds my favourite roses and it gives me pleasure to look at it.

I have never really mastered watercolours, even though I started painting with them early on.  In school we had those tin boxes with small pans of colours and my dabs of tinted water never stayed within the lines.  My efforts were horrible, even I could see that.  Later on I discovered oils and everything changed.  You could go over your mistakes, many times if necessary.  Once I painted a nice bowl of fruit on top of a failed Bay of Naples.  Same with acrylics, thick pigments you could mix and the ability to overlap.  I had nothing more to do with watercolours.When I was offered a box of these watercolour paints to review, my first thought was:  how come they're in tubes?  I discovered that it is because they are quality paints.  What I was using was scholastic grade.  Proper watercolours come in tubes.These watercolour paints are a lot more liquid than either oils or acrylics but they can be mixed!  A whole new horizon has opened up and I am now joyfully experimenting with them.  On the other hand, they are supposed to be the easiest of paints for children to play with, you can even fingerpaint with them (this brand makes non toxic paints, so no worries there), but I still consider them the most challenging of mediums, and I'm really looking forward to conquering this new technique, while having more fun than I thought possible.There are 24 premixed beautiful colours in the box.  So you can tackle almost anything while you get the hang of mixing your own hues.  Perfect for encouraging latent artistic tendencies in novice painters.  The tubes are small (12 ml) but there are so many that they should see you through the initial stages until you figure out which ones you use the most.Like acrylics, these paints are water-based so they dry fast, and cleaning up is easy and painless with just soap and water.  What defines quality with watercolours is, apparently, their ability to resist fading in time.  It's too early for me to comment on that, but the lifetime guarantee, which the maker extends on all purchases, gives me a certain confidence.  If you or your kids are exploring their creative potential, you might consider this purchase as a good way to start.

I love this cheeky, neon-hued little bikini, wonderful for catching the best tan.  Although the top has the triangle-shaped cups, the foam inserts make it into almost a push-up, certainly an enhancing effect.  The bottom is really small, Brazilian cut (which means that half your bum will be visible) but also low in front.  Not for the shrinking violets, but if you've got some moxie, you'll enjoy showing it off!When this was proposed to me for review, I was hoping that the colours might be more subdued than in the photos (after all I had chosen the Blue option), but in real life the predominant hues are shocking pink, lime green and yellow.  It sounds adventurous, and it is.  It's quite striking, the print is like an explosion of tropical flowers and foliage, and I'm starting to like it more and more.  It looks really great with a golden tan, of course, but you will soon get one if you wear this!The fabric is lovely, a beautifully elastic blend of 80% polyamide and 20% spandex, and fully lined; good quality and well finished.  The style is my favourite because with string ties above and below, it will adjust to fit you perfectly and the two triangles are free to slide along the tie, so you can position them as you wish.  The frilly bits are fun and very feminine, and enhance an already pretty design.Compared to other bikinis by the same brand, this one seems to me to run small, so go for one size larger than normal.  I usually take a US size 8 but I ordered the Small (instead of the Medium) because I wanted a really tiny bikini for private sunbathing.  Even so, it fits smaller than I expected, especially the bottom.  The current price of around $40 is quite reasonable for such an item.  So, if you like the look of this bikini, you should not be disappointed, in fact you might be surprised at the quality.  It's tiny, bright and happy and very comfortable to wear.

This small but atmospheric solar-powered LED light fixture is quite different from many others I have reviewed.  I received this unit for testing in early autumn, and it was great to see that it charged fully with only 6 hours of sunshine (the instructions say at least 8 hours are needed).  I'm sure the subsequent days topped up the charge but the lamp was operational the very first night and lasted until early morning.Physically it is quite a small unit (about 5 inches across and 2  inches in depth) and very lightweight with 3 LED bulbs.  It is designed to clip onto an average gutter and comes with an appropriately-shaped metal clip, a thumb screw with wingnut, a small screw and, in my package, a long mounting screw as well.  The instructions are made clearer by diagrams and are easy to follow.These are the features that make this lamp different from others I have come across:1. There is an On/Off switch that needs to be set to On for charging and operation2. The special bracket, designed for gutters, gives a useful alternative mounting option to the usual wall attachment3. The light is very blue and more of a glow than ambient illumination4. It is activated by darkness, not motion; the light stays on until daylight or the On/Off switch turns it off5. It runs off a rechargeable AA battery (already in place) which may need replacement after 8-12 months of continuous useThe cone of light is fairly narrow and concentrated, it is intensely blue and looks wonderful at night.  This lamp is sold singly but also in multiples, up to 5 in a pack.  I think it looks prettiest when there are several, for example, around a terrace or along a fence line.  The main consideration, as usual with solar units, is to select a sunny location.

Moroccan Argan Oil seems to be the ingredient of choice for hair products but it comes in as many types as there are brands selling it.  This Moroccan Treatment is a heavy dude with the amazing ability to sink into my hair without making it heavy.  Since I was contacted to evaluate this product for review purposes, both my husband and I have given this hair serum a thorough testing, using it exclusively for the past month.I really like what it does for my hair, I love the immediate shine it gives, and the softness that comes a few minutes later.  Naturally, if I put on a lot, my hair looks greasy and becomes heavy, but I only do that when I use it as a hair mask to be washed away after an hour or so.  Actually that sort of intensive treatment is becoming less necessary.  After a couple of masks to undo the damage of a summer of daily swims and a lot of sun, now I tend to just add three pumps to my mid-length hair, either dry or damp after a shampoo.  It has really made a huge difference to my coloured hair (bleached by the sun), but it seems to work equally well for my husband.  The scent is lovely but not overly feminine, so men can use it, too.  One of the best hair treatments I've tried so far.

Hyaluronic Acid has become the obligatory active ingredient in any anti-ageing formulation deserving of its name, however, the variations are limitless.  In this version, sent to me for evaluation and review, the pure ingredient comes in the form of an almost odourless, fairly liquid, clear gel that is easily absorbed by my skin.  But, more importantly, this serum instantly and visibly tightens my skin (you could call it a face lift effect) and causes the cream or lotion that I apply on top to be swallowed up in a way I have seldom seen.  I know from experience how much moisturizer my face can drink up with, or without, a serum.  This product makes my skin twice as thirsty!  I could not believe it the first time, I thought my face must be particularly dry.  But now I see that it is a feature of this product, as I regularly need to follow up with twice as much as normal of my chosen skin care.  The result is a visibly more nourished face and neck and a noticeable smoothing of the lines and wrinkles around eyes and mouth.The bottle is dark and stylish, elongated to accommodate a sizeable glass dropper.  While this allows precise dispensing, it is difficult to get the last of the gel out of the bottle.  Also the dark, opaque finish makes it impossible to see how much product is left, so I have no idea when I need to buy the next bottle.  Anyway, that is my only minor criticism of an otherwise excellent product.  The bottle contains 30 ml (or a little over 1 ounce) of serum, which is pretty standard for this class of skin care.  At the current (heavily discounted) price of less than $17, this is great value for money.With age, my skin has become fragile and ultra sensitive to harsh ingredients.  This serum has not caused any irritation, redness or other adverse reaction, even applied to the tender skin around the eyes.  In fact, my face feels refreshed and toned after I apply it, and more than ready to absorb the product that follows.  I think it bears repeating that a serum is a carrier, it facilitates absorption of whatever you choose to put on your skin afterwards.  A seriously proactive serum like this one should not be applied by itself.  Depending on your age and the state of your skin, you can choose the potency of the moisturizer that follows.  In my case, I often layer two products and I find that this serum easily allows both to sink in where they have a chance to do some good.  Top quality serum which gives immediately visible results and more durable ones over time.

I have looked into a lot of lip plumping products because, along with many other undesirable changes the ageing process has brought, thinning lips is one that I can't help noticing every time I catch a glimpse of yours truly in a mirror.  I tried a few products, usually in the shape of a tinted lip gloss, but results have been disappointing and usually very temporary.  Others seem to burn and actually damage the fragile skin of the lips, so I have given them a wide berth.  When I was offered a sample of Lips to review, I accepted with a certain interest and, as usual when I am testing, I discontinued all other similar products to properly assess any effect.The container is very sleek (in Simon & Tom's signature style) with the product in a small tub at the bottom and a nice little brush that slides and locks into the stem which grows out of the lid.  A great way to cut down on contamination.  To ensure that the brush is always easy to extract, I put a tiny dab of vaseline at the point of contact on the stem. The creamy gel looks pale apricot in the jar, but is actually colourless on the lips.  It is wonderfully silky and soothing but not gummy or sticky like some lip balms.  The first day, I noticed the tiniest tingling (which I attributed to the Cinnamon Essential Oil) but after that I have felt only a fresh, soothing sensation.  If you are not into lipstick, it is tempting to use this throughout the day in lieu of a lip gloss, but the directions warn against it.  The packaging is a bit vague but the Amazon product page clearly says to apply it to clean lips only twice a day, morning and evening in my case.After regular use for almost two months (yes, there is still some left!), I have to say that it has improved my lips in a subtle but visible way.  The greatest change happened in the first three weeks, and now we seem to be in maintenance mode.  It didn't change my mouth shape in any way, but it has restored the volume that used to be there in my forties.  For me that's already a big deal.  I've just had a new passport photo taken and it's curious to see that, although my face shows more wrinkles, my mouth actually looks younger than it did in the old photo from five years ago!  I will continue to use Lips and will buy it again once my sample is finished because I like what it does for me.

When I read that Mike Scott was going to publish his autobiography, I was intrigued.  As well as being one of my favourite musicians, his refusal to play the media game has made him a figure of mystery and unexplained contradictions.  Also, rock star memoirs tend to be a very mixed bunch, but it's not often that we get the straight goods from the pen of the concerned individual and, as in this case, from someone who seems born to write.This book is a fascinating read.  The style is charming:  introspective, intense, lyrical, humorous, self-deprecating but with a kind of proud integrity.  The structure is intriguing:  each chapter begins with a flash-back in the present tense.  Imagine flipping through a photo album, looking at a snapshot (or perhaps a short video-clip) of a particular occasion and then reading about the circumstances surrounding it.  This is not a continuous narrative and each episode is deliberately selected but I felt Mike did not shy away from prickly subjects, such as the logistics of taking a band on the road, the difficult decisions he had to make involving contracts, other band members, managers, booking agents, musical choices.  It's amazing to see how much influence some of these support players have on the success of a musical release.I really enjoyed the glimpse we are given into the passion which drives the music, often to the obliteration of everything else.  It was fascinating to read the story behind some of the songs:  the lengthy evolution of  The Whole of the Moon from a look at the sky for inspiration and a couple of lines on the back of an envelope to a charismatic, unforgettable musical creation;  or the tensions building to boiling-point and erupting in the first draft of Fisherman's Blues; or how personal turmoil produced the most exquisite compositions about love and its dramatic demise.  The Spiddal sessions and the months in Galway read like a true otherworldly adventure then the book becomes a page-turner.  An unexpected bonus:  as I progressed through the book, I listened again to the songs mentioned and found that the knowledge gleaned from the stories added so much to my enjoyment of the music and helped me appreciate its deeper layers.During the promotional drive, Mike Scott gave numerous readings and interviews, and emphasised that this book was all about the musical journey that started with him at a very early age and continues to shape his destiny to this day.  I was, therefore, surprised by the personal nature of the narrative and the honesty with which Mike bares his soul in recounting salient points in his life, even when this candour doesn't flatter his image.  I think he actually relished the chance to shed some light on his personal spiritual journey and to dispel the misconceptions that inevitably arose.  However, there are limits to the disclosure.  Mike Scott is clearly a private person and respectful of the people in his life, so it's not surprising that there is none of the usual gossip about kiss-and-tell groupie romps.  His two wives, naturally, make an appearance but are not discussed in tabloid-style detail.  Tucked in the middle are a few (too few!) black-and-white photos and at the end, a quirky appendix.For me the disappointing aspect is that the book ends around 2000, leaving a substantial portion of his story untold.  While this could point to a possible sequel, Scott himself has been non-committal, saying only that these missing years are still too raw to become book material.  Perhaps he wanted to wait and see if there was something sensational to write about after  moving back to New York in late 2012.  After all, he has said in interviews that the current Waterboys are hungry for recognition, so perhaps with a fire still burning in his belly and his creativity apparently in full flood, his mature self will manage that most elusive of musical miracles, the come-back with new material.  Already his Appointment with Mr Yeats has been remarkably well received by critics and public alike.  The Waterboys in their new incarnation could well be the breath of fresh air that the currently dismal music scene so badly needs.Meanwhile it will be interesting to see what kind of havoc this fun-loving, but formidably-focussed master of his trade can wreak with the wind back in his sails.  Because one thing is clear:  for Scott the music always came first and his perception of what his Muse required to manifest herself has shaped his life and philosophy.  If you enjoy a fascinating real-life story, exquisite prose, original turns of phrase and vivid pictorial descriptions, as well as an insight into the mind of one of the most gifted and unorthodox musicians of our times, this book will not disappoint.

When I read that Mike Scott was going to publish his autobiography, I was intrigued.  As well as being one of my favourite musicians, his refusal to play the media game has made him a figure of mystery and unexplained contradictions.  Also, rock star memoirs tend to be a very mixed bunch, but it's not often that we get the straight goods from the pen of the concerned individual and, as in this case, from someone who seems born to write.This book is a fascinating read.  The style is charming:  introspective, intense, lyrical, humorous, self-deprecating but with a kind of proud integrity.  The structure is intriguing:  each chapter begins with a flash-back in the present tense.  Imagine flipping through a photo album, looking at a snapshot (or perhaps a short video-clip) of a particular occasion and then reading about the circumstances surrounding it.  This is not a continuous narrative and each episode is deliberately selected but I felt Mike did not shy away from prickly subjects, such as the logistics of taking a band on the road, the difficult decisions he had to make involving contracts, other band members, managers, booking agents, musical choices.  It's amazing to see how much influence some of these support players have on the success of a musical release.I really enjoyed the glimpse we are given into the passion which drives the music, often to the obliteration of everything else. The Spiddal sessions and the months in Galway read like a true otherworldly adventure then the book becomes a page-turner. After all, he has said in interviews that the current Waterboys are hungry for recognition, so perhaps with a fire still burning in his belly and his creativity apparently in full flood, his mature self will manage that most elusive of musical miracles, the come-back with new material.  Already his Appointment with Mr Yeats has been remarkably well received by critics and public alike.  The Waterboys in their new incarnation could well be the breath of fresh air that the currently dismal music scene so badly needs.Meanwhile it will be interesting to see what kind of havoc this fun-loving, but formidably-focussed master of his trade can wreak with the wind back in his sails.
