I had debated a Nook or different tablet, but this with the FreeTime subscription has them all beat.I actually get to use my iPad now. :)

My boys, aged 10 and 8, needed to bake something by themselves for Cub Scouts.  We found this online and they wanted to try it.  Oiled the pan and dusted with cocoa powder (although next time I think I'll try just Pam as the cocoa powder made the cake look weird in the places where it adhered and did not adhere).  We followed the recipe for the chocolate cake on the box, and then used the Marshmallow Fluff recipe for whoopie pie filling.  It was so incredibly yummy and looked great.Next time we made it we used brownie mix and coffee ice cream as the filling.  Also divine.This pan is great!

I've never read anything by this author, and I liked her style of writing. It was a very easy read.  (I read it while getting my car's oil changed.)  I've been involved with energy work for over 20 years, since my days as a massage therapist.  While I encountered info about "the dark side" briefly when I was involved with some pentecostal Christians--it's never been a focus of what I've read.  So in that regard, this was interesting.  I appreciate that the author isn't a total fear monger, but gives a lot of good information on where people sometime get trapped, and how our own actions can sometime make us more vulnerable.I think her story of how she became an energy healer is very interesting.  I found her style of writing and the actual content--very good and I plan to pick up her other books.What I think was a miss for me was that there was not a lot of practical info on what to do if one encounters dark energy or the like.  She does mention some resources on her website, like that of a clearing bath (1 pound of sea salt and 1 pound of baking soda in a bath for 20 minutes), which I appreciate it--but I'm not sure why she couldn't put that info in the actual book.  She also mentions that some of these things are covered in seminars she gives.  Once again, great--but I'd like to see more in the book itself.  Same thing when she mentions meditation.  She's dismissive of how T.M. has become so expensive (which I agree with), and mentions her own meditation program which is similar and uses a mantra, but then doesn't go beyond that.  You need to go purchase her meditation program.  I guess I'm used to Donna Eden's work and others which give lots of practical meridians and exercises that you can do to clear chakras, work with meridians, etc.  I'm used to meditation instructors who don't feel a need to hide behind a paywall in order to help people.  Yes, I know she needs to make a living, and I respect that.  But I think this book would be more effective if she at least offered some basic exercises/info in the book, and then perhaps sold her own more advanced programs.  So, for meditation, she could say, choose a mantra with meaning for yourself, like "love" or "peace" or "light".  Sit comfortably either on a meditation cushion, or in a chair with your spine erect and as you inhale, with your tongue on the roof of your mouth, say your mantra in your mindor what not.  She may also include this info in her podcasts or radio show for Hay House, but once again, it could have been included here as well.  The book is not excessively long.  There was space.I do appreciate her focus on laying the foundation of daily or regular practice before one can receive what she calls higher initiations.  I liked her interfaith approach--which is very inclusive. I just wish there had been a bit more practical information as well.  Perhaps there will be more free content added to her website to support the book.  I hope so.

My Dad is part Lenape (Delaware Indian)so while I can't always find things related to his traditions, I do like to find anything I can regarding Native spirituality, teaching stories, etc. (Yes, I know that different tribes are not all the same).  It was under the desire that I picked up "Returning to the Lakota Way."  I had not previously read any of Joseph Marshall's works--so was not familiar with the author.  The author himself grew up on the Rosebud Sioux/Sicangu Lakota Reservation in Idaho and spoke Lakota as his native tongue.  It's not just some Western guy with a love of Native Spirituality sharing stories, but somebody who authentically grew up hearing themand living by them.  That holds so much more weight to me.The stories talk about universal character traits (not sure what to call them) like silence, tolerance, simplicity, wisdom, patience, etc.  These are old values, tried and trued values, which one will find in a wide variety of faiths across the globe.  Yet there's something about teaching stories, be it these, the parables that Jesus used, or Sufi and Buddhist tales, which stay with you much longer than  a mere lecture.  You are not soon going to forget the stories you read here.  That's the value of this stories why they are timelesswhy they are so powerful.Yet the author does not just tell a well known story, he also adds his own experience and commentary from growing up Lakota.I plan to seek out more by this author.  This brief taste has wetted my appetite for more.

I own Trista's previous book, "The Girl God", and I wasn't sure if this would hold up to the very high bar she set before.  I was completely wrong!  I actually may like "Mother Earth" more.  It has the same lovely illustrations by Elizabeth Slettnes.  It has wonderful, carefully chosen quotes throughout--basically with each illustration.  I love the link between how the daughter treats the Mom, and how we treat the Earth.  It actually reminded me more of the divine feminine, our first mother, than her first book.  It made me more conscious of the little choices I make and how they not only impact the Earth, but also impact my relationship with the Divine.It will be a treasureto pass down from mother to daughterand to granddaughterand so on.  I have the kindle version, but will order a "real" copy as well.Highly highly recommended.

This stuff tastes just like normal sugar-free jell-o, only it's made with beef gelatin (verified from the manufacturer)and has a bunch more fiber.  Mix it the sameadded two cups of boiling water.stirredand put in the fridge.  Tastesgreat.  Will be buying more.

I'm trying this diet called The Simple Diet: A Doctor's Science-Based Plan. Basically, the guy who wrote it used to (and possibly still does) run physician supervised diets for those with a lot of weight to lose. Basically you eat two frozen meals per day and three protein shakes per day (can also include nonfat greek yogurt), as well as at least five servings of fruits/veggies per day. You can also include meal bars, up to I think five per week. So, I wanted to try some possible meal bars.I don't like meal bars. I never have. I don't like protein shakes either. So whatever I say, take it with a grain of salt if you actually like them. These are O.K. They have that slightly weird mouthfeel and are a bit dry. They'd be more palatable with a large glass of milk. :) Honestly, for me, I find the Fiber One Protein Coconut Almond Chewy Bars, 5-Count 1.17 oz. bars (Pack of 6) or Kashi bars better (especially the Kashi Dark Chocolate Coconut Layered Granola Bars (1 Box = 6 Bars) (2 Pack), but they don't all have the same nutritional profile. I like their nutritional info, just not the taste. ;)  I think my problem is when I read "dark chocolate nut", I'm expecting something like a dark chocolate brownie with nuts.  Never taste that good.

Belkin just makes cool products.  This is right up there.  Super short, only 6 inch or 15cm long.  It is a glowing Pink so you can Never lose it.  It charges my iPhone from my computer at school or at home.  It works equally well with the multi-plug charging unit in the kitchen.  I love it.  Thanks for making a utility item a little cooler

This is my third Perky Pet Hummingbird Feeder.  In 2013, I got the 8120-2 Green Antique bottle.  It, too, had no place for the hummingbirds to rest as they drink.  But with solid, yet elegant construction, I like them both.  In 2014, I picked up the 710B Elegant Copper hummingbird feeder.  Now it does have a rest or perch for the birds to stop flying while they eat.  Funny thing....I don't think they care.  They play so much while they eat, that they just adapt to whatever they have to.  A glass bottle is so much easier to keep clean than plastic.  All of the plastic hummingbird feeders have been replaced by these Perky Pet Hummingbird feeders.  If you like watching these great, little birds fly around and feed and play, then get any one of the Perky Pet feeder I have indicated above.  You will love it.  In fact, it will gives me hours of quiet meditation as I sit in my outside rocking chair and hear and watch these graceful creatures buzz and eat.  Wicked cool.

This is a nice unit. It does the things it says it can do.ProsVery light.It protects the iPadBluetooth works wellRecharges quicklySimple, clean keyboard.Color matches my black iPad.ConsDoes not autocorrect like an iPad does so I am slower at typingKeyboard is smaller than ergo keyboards I normally useNot as mobile as you need a flat surface to type.So you can see that if you are not bothered by lack of autocorrect or a non-ergo keyboard, then this is for you.  If you use it as a notebook style, then it would fit the bill.

Top quality.  I collect bottle openers.  I like themes.  I have some going back to the 50s, when they were actually made in good old USA.  I use that as my standard, or center.  This is a nice theme.  I know it has a Christmas theme, but here in Texas....where we feed the deer all year long to then hunt them in the Fall......this is a all year theme.  I think it fit perfectly in my collection.  I hope this helps someone.
This is a total hoot.  This is Kevin Kline in his element.  A great musical.  It is done very close to the Broadway version.  I like that.  I hope this helps someone.

I like the concept.  Why?  I am a big believer in reduce, reuse and recycle.  So I have spent a small fortune on rechargeable batteries.  Funny thing is they lose their ability to charge after some period of time.  Then they are just junk.  So I have moved back to regular batteries.  When you buy in bulk you save.  However, the last batteries in the pack go bad.  So not nice.  It looks like energizer is recycling (just a bit), but giving me a huge shelf life.  I like that already.  They work like normal batteries.  Only time will tell if in 2027, if I still have any left, if it works.  Will let you all know with an update.
I really like this collection of Glen Campbell songs.  I like him in his acting.  I like him in his singing.  I admire him as he as retired due to his illness.  Just a great gentleman.

This guarantees that that the iPhone 5S that I only use for music in my classroom is ALWAYS fully charged.  Yes, I upgraded to the iPhone 6S Plus and did not need my iPhone 5 for calling.....but as an iPod it rocks.  So in my classroom I can plug into the Belkin charger station and never run out of power.  Thank you Belkin for making my life that much better.

This is a hit right out of the park.  We have had a fountain type water fall for about ten years now.  NONE of our cats have ever taken a drink from the fountain.  Even though a couple of our family members WILL drink out of certain sinks.  Go figure.  I started doing the math.  Our cats DON'T like the fountain.  Hey, don't get a fountain then pea brain.  Petsafe is not a fountain.  It merely maintains circulation of the water.  The filter is a third the size of our last unit.  The pump is at least twice as quiet as the last one.  Our two bosses, Paisley and Bindi, think it is quite the cool unit.  And it comes in a cool purple color.  They love it compared to the fountain.  If you have quirky bosses like we do, get this.  I hope this helps someone.

I got these primarily for my wife when she wants to listen to her music in private.  She has issues with the head products out there that fit into your ear.  She does not like the ear plug types.  Panasonic addresses those concerns.  This unit folds up extremely small footprint.  I placed it in my camera bag for out recent trip.  I like the ear plug types and have no issue, and I did try these before my wife took control.  These will not block as much noise as the ear plug type does, but IF you have issues with an ear plug type...then these are extremely comfortable.  Very light.  Nice sound control.  I hope this helps someone.
I like the way the series is played out.  It does stick well to the actual truth about Caesar as far as I have read.  It shows a very gritty truth.

The color is so neutral that it goes with anything and everything that I own.  The nice china or the everyday dishes.  I like that.  We are normally very low key with our style, and this goes a long way to keep that theme.  I placemat does add quality though, and I am very pleased with the overall look and feel.  Hope this helps someone.

Weighing in at just over 6 ounces, you know that you have a watch on your wrist.  Solid feel.  Large face with blended tones.  I have not placed a watch on my wrist in over ten years due to the invasion of cell phones.  However, I am now finding that I like what is consider retro to some.  Does it make me feel younger?  Only time will tell.  This is actually good to go if you dive or swim.  Sorry, that's not happening, but for those of you who don't ever want to take it off.....you go for it.  The instruction book that comes with the watch, covers all the specific settings you could use on your watch.  Don't know if I will use it for anything other than just keeping time, but hey, it looks neat.

This rocks.  I am trying to dress down, but not really dress down.  Quality is tight.  Fit is great.  Since the cooler weather has hit, it is perfect to wear.  I love it with my jeans and cap.  Well done.

An absolute, total hit with my kids.  I know Star Wars is coming out, but my little kids just like Mr. Potato Head.  It is a fabulous marketing ploy by the people behind Star Wars.....who cares.  My kids love it.  It is just a Mr. Potato Head, but hey after you have 7 or 8.....you need to get 9 and 10 characters.  It is just pure FUN.  I hope this helps.

After starting on my search for healthy eating about three years ago, I came to the understanding that nuts, nuts, nuts SHOULD be the center of anyone's search to good health.  I am not talking about low calorie.  I am not talking about diet items.  I am talking about how we should eat to be more healthy and have more energy.....by the way, you WILL lose weight.  Patrick Evans-Hylton explains, in a very picture perfect book, what we should do and eat using nuts.  I found it fun and exciting.  You see, if you replace or add to your meats in dishes, the amount of meat goes down or away, and the calorie count really does not make any difference.  I have at least three or four nuts at my house at ALL times now.  You really need to read to understand how you can help yourself.

Perfect for the little ones.....the ones who put EVERYTHING in their mouths.  There are no parts small enough to be an issue with the mouth.  This has a extremely small footprint for those who have space issues.  The pieces store in one side, but if you flip it over you have a tray with a plate and area for items to eat.  A great way to expose little ones to the real life without the actual mess of real life.  A play time to explore.  It is safe yet functional.  It is compact yet expansive.  It is sturdy yet colorful.  I like it.  I hope this helps someone.

As a history major, I want to scream how cool this Readers Digest version of History is presented.  I am not saying that in a negative way.  Our society is broken up into texts and messages and sound bites.  That is the area that this thing called HISTORY has to compete.  So for Mr. Hyslop to put together this accurate account of History that does not take 14 weeks to understand.......it just......Genius.  Does it go into depth.  No.  Does it give a full picture of the event. Yes.  It captures the event, whether it is a War, a battle, an event.......he covers it.  If, and the key word is IF, someone wants to follow up on a War or event or whatever......you just Google or Bing it......while you sit in your chair reading this book.  So hats off to Mr. Hyslop to figuring a way out to make History cool again......with neat pictures to help.
Soft, comfortable, nice.  The one I had years ago was much shorter and not as soft.  I really like the comfort of this wrap.  It is pretty simple in design, but the detail and quality are top notch.

We are cat caregivers.....over 35 years and counting.  As the staff, we constantly strive to find even better food for our masters.  Our current female bosses, Paisley and Bindi, have told us they like Solid Gold product.  Let me explain.  As early 80s caregivers, we were not as active as we should have been.....and accidents happened.  In the early 90s, a lovely lady named Angel came to live with us.  She had a extremely sensitive stomach and the research began.  Hill's Science Diet was what we as staff found.  It was and IS an extremely great product.  In fact, it is still our primary food for our bosses.  However, about 5 years ago, after Angel went to become a kitty angel of her own, we decided to try to give our bosses extra treats.  But we wanted to trick them into food just as good as they ate for all their normal Science Diet meals.  Since our owners liked PetSmart, we bought our "treat" food like Blue (all mixes) and Simple Nourish (turkey and oatmeal is their favorite) at PetSmart and then in the evening when we staff got home from our other jobs....we would treat the girls to food that was as good as Science Diet....but called a treat.....ingenious.  It worked.  So that is how we introduce new foods to them to see if they like it.  So a week ago, we introduced Solid Gold as their treat.  Their main meals are still Science Diet and the previous treat was Simple Nourish Turkey and Oatmeal.....so the odds were stacked against Solid Gold.  Since the smell is different as the product is different, the lead boss, Bindi the elder, held back ever so gently...maybe 30 seconds.  Then it was a treat fest.  It has been the same every evening since.  Solid Gold will now be an equal to Blue and all Simple Nourish EXCEPT Turkey and Oatmeal...that just rocks for the bosses.  I hope the telling of my tale, how ever so low it has been told by this mere staff of the bosses, Paisley and Bindi, helps another staff member in their quest for food for their bosses and masters.  As Alton says, Good Eats.

This is a nice addition to my specialty tools, and it comes with an interesting slant......it is TSA approved.  Now, I need to state that I have not taken it on a flight, but I plan to next month.  It's a good solid weight of 9 ounces.  The flip open to the pliers and other tools is so smooth.  The sheath to carry it has a solid clip which can be removed without taking off your belt.  All 16 tools I have used as stand-alone tools, so I know I will get around to all of them someday.  Easily I will use 6 to 8 of them on a regular basis.  When open in full extend mode, it can measure up to 9 inches (ruler engraved into side).  I am extremely pleased with the SOG, after buying a number of other similar products that did not have the same quality as an SOG.Update:  I flew across the USA last week.  I took my insert of the product put the SOG in my carry on bag.  For the flight out it was fine.  For the return flight (I was pre TSA boarding), I was called over by a quiet, nice TSA agent.  He asked if he could go thru my bag.  I said fine.  I figured I knew what he was after.  It was the SOG unit.  He pulled it out and asked me about it.  I told him I got it on the guarantee that it was a TSA approved item.  He was nice, opened all the parts, and found no issue.  He did NOT look at my receipt or paperwork.  He approved it.  So as far as I am concerned, the SOG unit is APPROVED by TSA.  Happy flying.PS....I did use the unit at my destination, so I was not just carrying it.
Great series.  I liked it a lot.  Great escape from normal life.

I wanted a different look for my wedding band, and this fit the bill.  I went from gold the titanium.  Cost is not the issue for me......comfort and look is what I like.  I got it slightly larger than my previous band.....it fits better.  Smoother with the on/off the finger aspect.  I like it lots.

For those of you who don't like the cords in a big power strip, that itself has a 3 or 6 foot long cord........here it is.  I have used things similar to this before, but nothing with this much high quality.  You need to remove the center screw from your wall plug and this unit comes with a self-mounted screw.  In addition, since the upper wall plug is what is used for power, this is manufactured with a dummy extension for the lower grounding plug on the bottom.  The end result is a very solidly mounted wall plug.  Bonus is the two USB slots at the top of the wall unit.  Great product for my use.

This is a 8 by 11 size folder / appointment book.  Most of us are used to a little day planner that is much smaller.  The cover is flexible and covers the pages well.  As someone who needs a day planner, times two, I will rely on this planner.  In between my computer telling me I have an appointment.....this comfortable day planner can do the same thing and without electricity.  Those of you who remember a time before electricity would be well advised to consider this as your planner.  I did.

Oh my gosh is this neat.  I have not gotten state of the art stuff in years.  This ROCKS.  I still have Bose 201 and 301 bookshelf speakers from the 1980s.......read that.....more than 30 years and they are still just clicking along.  Bose today is state of the art. Many family members have joined today's technology.  I was slow.  Not ever again.  I plan to replace most of my current music areas with Bose.  This unit is now in the kitchen after being placed elsewhere.  That is the cool thing about WiFi.....you just pick it up and MOVE it.  Takes all of two minutes.  Control it with the remote or ANY of your iPhones or iPads.  Just download the Bose app for FREE.  Preset stations from ANYWHERE in the world.....and then just rock it.  This is a little bit like being 16 again as I approach 60.  I must admit it took me just a bit to figure it all out, but give me a break....I'm old.  I now have it figured out and when my wife came home from work last night I had put a preset channel from Hawaii in the Bose unit.  That was her college days in the 70s....she thought it was cool to pull in a station she listened to 40 years ago.  This is for old and young.  The young get it, but the old will respect what it does.

This tempered glass thing is the way to go.  I covered two iPhones fresh from the factory.  The protectors arrived a few days before the phones came.  Shipping was fast and easy.  Entire process took less than 5 minutes.  I did not need to clean my screen as the phone had never been used, however, Poweradd included a towelette in each container if someone did need it.  We immediately placed the phones in cases to keep phones and screens even more protected.  I'm set.  The phones look great.  Thanks.

This is a book for a certain type of person.  It is for an intelligent person who was brought up reading DIRECTIONS to learn how to build, bake, and learn a new skill.  In today's Google/ Apple world where you just have to "figure it out by hitting buttons" and usually saying a few inappropriate words under your breathe while you hunt and peck.......this is a throw back to a nicer time in the world of tech.  So as I approach my sixth decade on this lovely green Earth, it is such a treat to get a book with great color pictures and simple instructions.  Some of the stuff I can navigate with a hunt and peck, because I do know a thing or two.  However, there is lots I don't know and finally I can explore the more advanced parts of Window 10 instead of just staying in my very small comfort zone.Thanks for thinking of we mature older people who really can still learn.  I love the book.  Already picked up a few tricks that I never would have figured out on my own.
Good series.  Lots of action.  Cool plots.

I do so love everything OXO puts out.  They make things for things you don't even know you need.....i.e. I have just had a HUGE mouthwash bottle sitting on my little sink for decades.  Why?  Don't know.  This has one quarter the footprint of my big mouthwash bottle.  It matches all the brushed nickel accents we put in the Master Bath when we remodeled a few years ago.  Classy.  It looks like it belongs exactly where it is.  It does only hold 12 ounces, so that means every two weeks or so you have to actually fill it up.  Oh, the horror.  Very neat addition to my bathroom sink.  Thanks OXO.

I take a lunch to school every day.  I am an Elementary School teacher.  What I was doing was placing my lunch into the refrigerator in our teacher lounge.....the other side of the our building.  Now I can place my lunch under my desk and it stays cold easily until my lunchtime.  The cooling packs are the sides.  Simple idea that works well.  I am in an inside, AC controlled building.  Therefore, the temps are mild and the lunch bag is not subjected to high temps or lots of movement.  If, however, your situation is similar to mine, then this is a really good solution to a mildly annoying problem.It is well made.  Zipper top, with flap that velcros down.  Loop handle makes grip easy too.  I have plenty of room for all my food items.

I love the Red, White and Blue theme.  Go team.  This is well made.  iPad snapped right in.  It swivels easily.  I also like the strap attachment and the stylist pen.  It is all I need to protect my iPad.

This is my first attempt at using a tempered glass screen protector.  I must say I was very impressed.  I did watch a few videos of other people attaching the tempered glass to iPads before I even ordered.  The instructions for Anker tempered glass were different than some of the other videos that I watched.  But instead of trying to install differently than Anker instructions, I followed Anker instructions to a T.  It worked out perfectly.  They send everything you will need to install.  Since I and my wife just got brand new iPads, I did not even open the iPad box until I had the Anker Tempered glass.  Therefore, I had no cleaning to do as they had never been turned on my me.  There are tabs that you attach to the glass so you can dry fit the product.  Only when you are 100% sure all is right, do you remove the back cover of the sticking side of the tempered glass.  My wife was not sure since it is GLASS, but they put something on it to not let it smudge as much or something.  Now they are both inside their nice cases with a life time guaranteed Anker tempered glass.  It was money well spent.  Step on up the glass revolution.

I am sure there will be a ton of reviews about the great job Jabra SPORT COACH does as they work out.  I am a different generation from the young kids on the slick Jabra video.  That does NOT mean that I can't enjoy using this high tech device as I do the things that my generation just calls "work".  Not work out, but work.  I absolutely love this concept.Over the past 30 years I have tried dozens of different products to use with the electronic products of our time.  From cassettes to walkmans to flash to WiFi, I have tried them all.  WiFi products have matured enough, and Jabra has hit a home run.  Set up is easy.  Apps load fast.  Just follow the directions.  It has different size earbuds....I use a large for my right ear and a medium for my left.  There are clips to adjust the length of the cord.  A small USB 8 to 10 inch charging cord fits into the little pouch with all the earbuds and clips.  Charging takes 2 hours, but it will then run full out for about 6 or 7 hours before it needs charging again.  About one hour before your battery is at zero, a smooth female British voice states "Battery low".  At approximately the 30 minute point, she tells you again.  Finally, about one minute before she informs you a third time.  I used it over this past weekend.  On a solid charge, Saturday I used it for about 4.5 hours doing errands and shopping.  I just cruised around listening to my tunes.  It was neat to be in a store, but really by myself since I did not hear anyone around me.  I did not recharge but continued to use the Jabra on Sunday while I worked around my house.  Mowing, edging, sweeping, trimming trees, doing some work in my wood shop....just basically "working" outside.  It finally lost charge after about 3 hours.  So I estimate between 5 to 7 hours of use between charges.The sounds are awesome.  Dolby has a part into this product and that brings quality to the table.  I am very impressed.  It not just for work outs.  Get it if you just need to do things and want to listen to your music without bothering anyone.  Really.  It's that good.

Got a new computer and my camera did not seem to want to talk to it to download pictures.  I have 5 cards worth (4000) plus the 1500 pictures on my current card in my Canon EOS.  The old process of connecting my camera and slowly copying is now history.  With Gearonic's little gizmo, I transferred all my pictures to my new computer with so much ease that I was dancing with joy.  It is just a basic process of copying, but it is quick and painless.  I have SDCFH compact cards.  It fits all the other standard cards too, but I only use the SDCFH port.

Having animals for 35 years, now empty nesters, we need to have our little friends to keep us company.  Our two friends are Paisley and Bindi who are female cats.  The videos on the Petcube website are great.  What I realized after I placed the camera in the first position was that the laser  blended in with our red tinted rug.  That prompted a new location.  Then I came to understand that since there is no light ability on the cube (and they don't ever state there is) that it needs to be somewhere in the house that has a light on all the time, or you can't see anything at night thru the app on your phone.  Everything works including the laser, but you just can't see due to low lighting in your house.  Most of you would know that but I am kinda slow on the uptake.  The microphone part of the app is very cool.  You can talk to your pets while you are miles away thru your phone and then thru the speaker on the Petcube.  You can take quality pictures of your furry friends and although I have not gotten a funny shot yet......I will in the future.  It is a fun little gadget and I am finding out that I now like little gadgets.  Just ordered the new iPhone 6s plus, and the quality upgrade from my little iPhone 4 is going to make this Petcube even neater in my eyes.  New gadgets need new tech stuff to make them sing.

Extremely small footprint.  Very portable.  No other power source needed.  Although it is just an external HD, it has a cool color and does look good beside the Xbox 360.  I plugged it in easy enough into the back of my Xbox 360 elite with the usb drive.  Formatted it in my settings and I have 1862 Gb available.  Data transfers pretty well.  You have to be logged into a specific user profile if you want to transfer specific user data (saved games and such).  I am amazed at the technology to compact more storage capacity in smaller places.  Never have to delete a game again.

A very art-filled look at our 16th President in his youth.  Filmed in black and white, with little dialogue, and highly stylized, it still gives a truthful feel to the story.  I was captured in the photography.  I don't think it fits in a category.  It's just good.

Having read numerous biographies on both Presidents, so I understand much more than the film shows.  With that being said, I do think it presents a honest and full account of the Presidents.....on a much shorter window and not going into as much depth as books can.  I initially thought it would be so-so even though Burns produced it.....but I found I liked it very much.

My family has been cooking with cast iron frying pans for 30+ years, but our pots have mostly been Calphalon.  Our Calphalon 6 Quart pot is used quite often and even though Calphalon does have a lifetime warranty, we decided to move to a cast iron setting.  Now with a cast iron grill and frying pans which we use with our gas stove, we are adding a Dutch Oven.  We will not really cook Mexican food, as we are stew and crockpot peoples.  You can cook all types of slow cooked foods in this.I like the fact that it is ceramic coated which makes clean up a breeze.  However, a basic cast iron product is easy to clean also.  We use plastic scrapers from Pampered Chef and they do a bang up job.There are little plastic clips that come with the unit so when you flip the lid over for storage you do not chip the unit.  These will fail.  Just get a large, soft cotton dishtowel to layer in between the pot and lid.  That will also help with moisture control.
What a great and exciting series!  My wife and I have totally loved all 5 seasons.  This is a must watch series in our view.  Enjoy.

I have had my Stanley Wood Chisel Set for well over 20 years.  I take very good care of them.  Good quality.  I have used them many times over these two decades for many, many projects.  However, the TEKTON wood chisel set is about 40 percent longer.  This gives me a truer ability to line things up correctly.  It is easier to grasp.  I am not saying my Stanley set is a substandard tool.  I am saying that the TEKTON set equals my old Stanley set.  So I have now replaced my Stanley set, where they will be used on less technical projects.  The TEKTON are a fine addition to my wood chisel tools.  I hope this helps someone.

This is the neatest thing since sliced bread.  Really.  These refills are JUST the refills.  I purchased a kit at my local Sam's store.  It comes with 30 refills AND the wand.  You need the wand.  It works just as advertised.  Easy to clean with and it goes everywhere in the bowl.  When you are done you just go to your trashcan and release the cleaning piece into the trash.  No gloves needed.  No mask.  It smells nice.  It is super fast.  I don't know why I did not get these sooner.  It doesn't make cleaning a toilet fun, but it does make it fast and painless.

I love the big numbers for the time.  Super easy to see.  Small footprint for such a neat clock.  Batteries included with clock...all the buttons and controls are on top.  That is great because stuff on the side and behind are a pain.  The USB charging amp will not get used all the time, but it is way cool that I could charge my phone if I needed to.  The alarm is plenty loud and the radio comes with a two foot long antenna for better reception.  Neat.  It even has a daylight savings switch on the back so when you switch between the daylight on/off savings, all you need to do is flip the switch in the back instead of any reset.  That is a nice addition.  So I retired my old clock to the guest bedroom.

As a Science Diet customer for over 15 years, I use them as the basis of my judgements.  My wife and I long ago went on a search for quality food for our cats.....and we have had great pets over these 35 years.  So as Science Diet as our main food, I started looking for food to trick our cats as a treat.  I want their treats to be the same quality as Science Diet.....i.e. tricking them into eating "junk treats" that are actually healthy.  It is a way to try out new foods to see if they like other quality foods.  My oldest cat didn't jump into this when I passed it out for a treat, but as the younger cat (who normal just hangs back until her old sister is done) jumped in to munch away, older sister decided it was just fine.  After that both ate normal amounts.  So our cats like it.  The ingredients are high quality.  What's not to like.  Hope this helps.

My wife and I are Calphalon and Pamper Chef lovers.  The less we have to clean up after cooking the better.  I must admit that the Calphalon products are getting old in the tooth and there are now sticking issues that require soaking.  The products today seem to get better every day.  I can definitely recommend Greenlife.  My wife and I now plan of changing out certain old Calphalon products with new Greenlife products.  No oil required.  No sticking.  No mess clean up.  Perfect.  Just what the cook ordered.  Get some today.

These towels come in a pack of three and are beautiful right out of the packaging. They are made well and none of the stitching has come out after washing. I like how the accent design continues all the way from the left of the right, so you can actually fold the towels in half, rather than thirds, and still have the entire design show. These towels arent too soft, but are nice and absorb liquids well.

If youre looking for a camping mat to accompany you on long hikes and week-long camping trips in the middle of nowhere, look no further. This mat weighs in at just 12.2 oz., which makes it one of the most lightweight options out there for individuals looking to go ultra-light. In addition to adding hardly any weight to your pack, this sleeping mat is also compact. The packaging this comes in claims the size is comparable to a soda can of some sort, which is only slightly accurate.  Needless to say, its bigger than a soda can, but really only by an inch or two either way. Its still incredibly tiny compared to every other sleeping pack I have carried.The diagram suggests you can blow this particular mat up in 5 breaths, but that is inaccurate. The body and head pillow need to be blow up separately and they take 6 breaths and 2 breaths respectively, equaling a total of 8 breaths to blow it up. I was giving large, full breaths when testing this item out. Now, this is only 3 extra breaths when compared to the manufacturers suggested amount, which in reality is only a couple extra seconds. No big deal.Now, my wife (59, 150 pounds), my daughter (59, 142 pounds) and I (510, 170 pounds) all tried this sleep pack out on tile floor once it was blown up. My wife and I are in our late fifties, our daughter in her mid-twenties, and we all thought it was pretty comfortable. We each laid on our backs and our sides. My wife has back problems and thought the body part was still comfortable, though she did complain about the pillow. My daughter and I both liked the pillow very much because it almost provides a pocket to cradle your head, and its awesome whether you are sleeping on your back or side. The bottom of the sleeping back has the holes filled in; my daughter suggested carry this design feature up the spine to provide a little bit more support and comfort, as her tailbone and hips fell in the cracks and were a bit uncomfortable. I didnt have an issue and thought it was comfortable. Keep in mind we didnt sleep in this throughout the night, only tested it for about 10-15 minutes each.Rolling this pack up to its compact state is pretty simple. I wasnt able to fit it perfectly back in the bag, but with practice Im sure I could. Overall, I like the pack and think it will be attractive to people looking to go ultra-light. I think you might sacrifice a little comfort in order for it to be compact and lightweight, but choose your battles. If youre looking for a lightweight, compact option that does provide some decent support, I would recommend this sleeping mat.

I like to utilize technology and all it has to offer, but Im still old school and like having a physical planner to keep with me. This one is great for the minimalist who still wants paper copies of their day to day activities. In the beginning of the planner, there is a three year reference page that shows from 2014-2016 at a glance. Each month has its own tab, which makes it incredibly easy to flip between them. This particular one starts in July 2015 and goes to June 2016. At the beginning of each tab, there is a two page spread for the current month. Each date has 5-6 lines to write on (depending on if a holiday is typed in), which doesnt offer a whole lot of space if you have meeting and appointments that run all day to keep track of. However, I do like the fact that they have a countdown until the last day of the year and they also show how many days it has been since the start of the year.Each week is divided onto two pages: Monday-Thursday on the left-hand side, Friday-Sunday on the right. Each day has 16 lines to utilize. Six contact and six note pages are provided in the back of the planner. The final two pages are an event calendar, which is gridded and fairly small, and a list of holidays for the year.Overall, this is a great sized planner that would work for the minimalist. People who want to write more, or just have more to write, might do better with a larger size. I also like the fact that the planner is spiraled and flexible, which makes it incredibly easy to write in and deal with.

There are only 12,000 reviews so far......so mine does not count for much.  It's cool.  It's neat.  It makes me feel important.  Amazon WILL continue to upgrade this as we all go forward.  It's paid for......no fees going forward.  That's neat.  It is nice to have something at the leading edge of technology rather than what we 60 year olds get.......hand me downs from the kids.  HAH.
This is a wonderful series.  I am totally into this concept from 100 years ago.  The acting is great, the sets are really original, and we are totally involved.
Needed an inexpensive, yet worthwhile cover for my phone.  Last one bit the dust.  I like the colors.  I like the product.  I just like how it protects my phone.  Thanks.

This is a product introduced to my wife and I by our Yoga fit daughter.  This hurts so bad it must work.  After only a few weeks it actually does not hurt as much and I sleep better.  I don't know if it is only LuxFit, but I bet it is.  What a cool, inexpensive, neat fitness tool.  I hope this helps some person decide.

As I continue my journey thru my blessed life, I need to always learn new things.  Bill Blankschaen's new book, A Story Worth Telling, is about each of us thinking about what we are called to do in Christ, and then to do that.  It is an easy book to read as it does not slam you with a specific agenda.  It is structured to lead you through a series of exercises that may help you decide.  I don't think that any one book can be your answer to understanding the Bible, but then, neither does Mr. Blankschaen as he refers us to other great books that helped him.  I like his concepts of prayer and reflection.  I like his core belief that faith guides everything.  I think it would help a person that is a searcher like myself.  Nicely done.

I have decided that I too needed to take better care of my feet.  After watching the ladies of my life help to make their feet softer by using similar products, I thought I needed to do the same.  I always thought that the process was a little painful, and maybe it is with other products.  The Probelle foot file is very easy to use and there is NO discomfort.  The handle grip is very sturdy and conforms well to my hand.  So now along with lotion to my joints to keep my skin from cracking, I have another nifty tool to help me.  I hope this helps.

I read many reviews, lots were negative.  I bought it anyway.  I will use it on my driveway and sidewalks.  I don't have a deck.  I am 5 ft 10 inches.That being said, it would be nicer if the extension was 4 to 6 inches longer.  It is still a great buy based on the time it saves me.  Easy to assemble, Easy to attach and take apart.  Does a good job cleaning.  Actually better than I thought after reading all the negative reviews.  This has been one of my better buys for value and effectiveness.  I like it.

A very nice little piece of history.  An attachment of the DVD makes this a wonderful little reminder of that time in America when he had just entered into WWII.  Winston Churchill comes to Washington for Christmas 1941.  Mr. McCullough narrates this story of a small piece of our American history.  Uplifting.

I like the light scent.  As an eczema person, my entire life, I must deal with the issue of dry and cracked skin constantly.  Hence my search for quality products.  I keep lotion everywhere, just in case.  AHAVA is a nice addition to my collection.  It is not a hydrocortisone cream, or an anti-itch lotion.  It is a lightly scented, solid hand creme.  This is a fine product.

I like this concept.  A knife and a flashlight.  Coast has a solid brand reputation .  The light is quite bright and innovative.  The only thing special that you need to understand is how to release the blade to close it.  Unlike most of Coast, or any other brand for that matter, designs where the release catch is on the upper rear part of the handle; the release for the LK375 is actually underneath the unit.  As you hold the knife in your right hand with the cutting blade facing you, take your right thumb and push a metal holding bracket to your left of the blade.  This releases the blade to fold in for storage.  I hope this helps

Cool idea.  My wife is using these in her PPCD classroom.  DM2 is a super, hit movie to little kids.  The minions are so funny.  Don't think normal placemats.  These are super, super thin.  There is no backing to this, but just one piece.  That is why you can put them in the dishwasher if you needed to.  I don't think you would ever have to place these into a dishwasher, but it is good to know.  Again, I love the design and concept.

Got this for my son-in-law.  He loves hats.  Now that they live in Reno and do a lot of outdoors activities, he wears a hat everyday.  And since he shaved his head, a hat is a must in cool and colder weather.  This is well made and will last for many, many years.
Change the way you think about food.  Educate yourself to be smarter.  Learn so you can stay healthy.  Read this book.  Tell others.

This is a great, cool way to bring the original Tron back to life.  The original Tron was such an out-of-this world experience back in the day before real CGI.  Those of us who saw the original in theaters and could envision a day when real CGI or special effects would make the story even better are now very pleased.  And to be able to get Jeff Bridges and Bruce Boxleitner back is just too cool.
This is just a feel good movie.  Good versus bad.  Innocent versus complex evil.  Nice versus bad.  I just have to watch it every so often to smile.

Ken Follett is a master story teller.  He takes real history, with real events and weaves fictional characters around these real events to tell an exciting story about our past.  This is what all true historians should do to capture the imagination of those who find history boring.  It is a great way to suck people into important history lessons.

OXO Good Grips GreenSaver Crisper Filter is a very neat product.  Even though we have a state of art refrigerator with all the bells and whistles, I was less than impressed with the quicker spoilage of leafy plants, root veggies like carrots, and squash and cucumbers.Since putting it neatly inside my crisper on the left wall of the crisper, I have found that the leafy plants are the biggest winners here.  I know it is helping with the carrots, too.  My wife and I eat the cucumbers and squash too fast for me to make a comment yet with them.  I will come back in a few months to update.So far, so good.  It is an inexpensive item.  Easy to replace the charcoal bag three or four times a year.  What's not to like here.  I hope this helps.

A toolkit should have a multimeter in it.  This thing is very small, which is what it states.  So it would be easy to have it in a drawer instead of outside in the garage.  That will make is more useful for quick action.  In fact, I just tackled a problem with a light kit cord on one of my ceiling fans.  It was easy to use.  It does seem to be able to work with most issues.However, the thing I question is its ability to detect live wires/devices remotely.  I am kind of uber safe when it comes to electricity.  I was almost zapped back to the stone age 20 years ago with a faulty extension cord and a vacuum and some water....needless to say I trust nothing unless I am sure.  I don't think I would use this remotely.  Too spotty for me.But if you don't use it for any remote work, I think it would be a nice, small multimeter for your toolkit.  I hope that helps.

I have owned lots of boots growing up.  I started with the idea that they had to fit like a glove.  I have evolved off of that idea as I have grown older and understand myself better.  I got these with a little wiggle room in them.  I now understand that by layering with my socks I can customize my boot and I have less rubbing issues.  These are solid work boots.  As I don't hunt, I won't use them as such, but I am sure they would be fine for that as well.  Thick, textured sole.  I also like the fact that they don't come super high up my leg.  I am only trying to protect my foot and ankle area.  The shorter stock height allows me to step higher thru the brush.....I've got 10 acres in hill country that I stomp around in.  I am going to get many, many years use out of these work boots.

Man this is made well.  The colors are way cool.  The zipper and materials are top notch.  We got a pyrex insert to go inside and it fits like a glove.  There is Velcro at the top of the handle, so in addition to a comfortable hand grip, it is also Velcroed in place.  This will be great to take hot food to our family get together times.  I hope this helps someone.

I got this for my wife and she reviewed as follows:This is a serum, for night use.  On the bottle it is described as a "nightly purifying micro-peel".  I followed the directions - cleansed my face,  then smoothed on the PROx.  It says to use 2-4 drops - I used 4.  It felt sticky, so I went to read for a few minutes before turning in, thinking the product would either a) soak into my skin or b) dry.  It did neither.  I felt like it just "sat" on my face. (I've always thought a "peel" was a product that dried on your skin, then you peeled it off - pulling out the dirt/impurities on your skin with it.)  I finally went to bed after 20 minutes - hey, I was tired!  I woke up the next morning and the PROx still felt sticky on my face and there was a "nice" residue on my pillowcase.I tried the product again 2 days later, and this time only used 2 drops.  Better results, at least with the stickiness.  Not nearly as sticky and no residue on the pillowcase - my advise - use VERY sparingly!!!  Haven't seen much of a difference...yet, but then again, I've only used the product a few times.  The directions also advise you to use a sunscreen (SPF 15 or higher) after you cleanse your face in the morning. **Note - 2 weeks later - I'm still using the product, not every night, but 2-3 times a week.  Went for my massage yesterday, and they were offering a free facial analysis, so I stuck my head in the "booth".  She noted some dryness around my eyes, (duh!) some oiliness around my nose (again, duh!) but she said it looked like I had a low number of enlarged pores...hmmm maybe this stuff really does work!  I had this done a couple of years ago (just before a full facial) and my enlarged pore count was pretty high!So, I've edited this review from my original, which was pretty harsh, and I'm going to give it the benefit of the doubt...end quoteI hope this helps someone

I had one of these type of products during my pregnancy and it helped reduce my back pain a lot! I have arthritis in my spine and it was a great help in reducing the pain/muscle fatigue. I read about using abdominal binders post op after a hysterectomy and thought it might be helpful agin so I bought this one. I AM SOOO GLAD I DID!  My Dr had me in a much larger/wider cheaper version post op and it helped make getting into and out of bed much better/less painful and easier.  Eventually the one the Dr had me in got to uncomfortable though but I still needed that "extra support" feeling. This is where I began to use this one! It helped making sleeping on my side feel "more secure" along with my walking up and down the neighborhood and grocery store while I was recovering! It was a nice addition to make my recovery much more comfortable along with a 12 inch Wedge pillow that I bought here on Amazon too! Makes it easier to roll out of bed when your abs aren't quite ready to cooperate with lifting up out of bed. I wish I would have worn this binder post c-section and had the wedge pillow I now have because my life would have been much more comfortable post baby too! Live and learn from my mistakes.... If you are in your 20's it might not be that big of a necessity.. But as an older Mom at 35 with autoimmune arthritis these tools would have made life a little more bearable in those healing moments. ;)

Nice colors available in a ballpoint. They write really smooth without skipping and I like the clicker version. With these I don't have to worry about lids wandering off or rolling off the table. They are a dream to use on my son's Super Spirograph!! It comes with three gel pens and these ballpoints are actually much better at layering colors on the paper. The gel pens eventually make holes in the paper from being to wet. No problems like that with these ballpoint pens!

Absolutely beautiful! The pearls were a really nice size, smooth and a beautiful finish. Very classy looking for any woman to love!Just a thought... If you think you might want an extra inch or two, buy an extender. You will probably have to Change the clasp on the extender to the style used for pearls but a local jeweler should be able to easily do that.  It will offer more flexibility in neck lines... ;)

From Conception to Aging this wedge can help with lots of life's Adventures! I was thrilled to find this at an excellent price on Amazon. Years ago I was hesitant to buy one for $100.00, but at this price point I gladly paid!  I bought this mainly for using post-op (hysterectomy) but I figured I could use it for my occasional heart-burn (hiatal hernia) break through also. It was a blessing to have post op and made it much easier to roll out of bed at home for those first couple of weeks when sleeping on my side or stomach wasn't an option yet. Very comfortable, great to read with and probably nice to use to watch TV in bed too (although I didn't do that). I also had the opportunity to use it for that breakthrough heat burn that would normally keep me up for a few hours. I was able to take a Rolaid and Pepcid and go right back to sleep with this wonderful incline! It's very comfortable but just high enough that sleeping on my side with it is a challenge unless I squirm towards the very bottom in the middle of the night. At times I just used a soft beaded neck roll pillow and at times I used my Standard size "soft and squishy" pillow for comfort on top of the wedge for my head.SMELLS: NONE HERE AFTER AIRING OUT AND I WAS BLESSED WITH THE MOST SENSITIVE NOSE I KNOW... I could smell my son's dirty diapers when he was in his bedroom and I was in the living room. Lots of watery eyes for me but no diaper rash here! LOL Makes me wonder if different warehouses have different smells.. ?POST-OP DREAM:  I wish I would of had this post C-Section, gallbladder and tonsillectomy (as an adult, horrible pain to lay flat). I even had eye surgery a week before I bought this and I'm sure it would have helped with the swelling more than just ice.  There were times I used my heating pad too in between the wedge and my back and it molded nicely enough to have heat applied in all places. I'm thinking based on logic and things I have heard from friends and family it would help with most head and neck surgeries to even chest/breast, shoulder and arm surgeries where swelling or lack of use of abdominal muscles might be a challenge. Could be helpful with knee surgery to but might need to add pillows to the declined side to help keep your feet elevated or buy a second wedge to make a square.. Sinus stuffiness... Sleep apnea, snoring.. Lots of applications... Be creative!
Gorgeous on my hand and looks very expensive! Nice size and color of citrine without looking to big/fake. Wonderful buy and very happy. :)

Beautiful green peridot! Was an excellent price and value, yet no one will know how much of a value it was... ;)  I really liked that the stone was separated a little with the space between it and the heart. Surprisingly it makes it look a little "bigger" and "show up" more!

Best erasable pencils vs Crayola's version. You'll need an excellent handheld sharpener, like the BRASS BULLET (available on Amazon) before you can use this 24 count set though. It appears as though the 12 count set comes already sharpened based on the pictures shown. These laydown MUCH smoother than the Crayola version!  Granted they are more expensive but they feel and look so much better they are worth the $11.00 ish that I paid.  There is a reasonable range of colors with this 24 count set. It includes a White, Black, Gray and a Light Peach! The closest two colors in the set are the Vermillion and the Orange. They are strong enough to handle a really sharp tips and color in small spaces and yet smooth enough to lay the color down well.  From sketches to coloring they can handle the job! They are closest to the Prismacolor Verithin line but they erase better. I just wish more colors were offered in this line for my "adult" coloring books. I haven't tried the other brands available in the erasable version (but have tried the regular versions). This is a solid performer at a reasonable cost. These are made by Prismacolor like the Scholar line. The erasable Scholar line only comes available in a 12 count though. I'm just guessing but I bet they have a more "powdery" feel and less of a sharp tip than this line. Based on the feel of the regular Scholar line vs the Verithin which these feel closest to.Erasability: These erase better than then Verithin line as shown in the photo that has the Violet Blue Verithin erased vs the Col-Erase shown in the Blue, Purple and Black. The pink erasers work well on the pencil ends but I prefer to use the white ones made by Pentel or Staedtler. They don't "eat away" at the paper as much.Lay Down: Color is smooth! Smoother than the Crayola Erasables and feels better when using and sharpening. Nice sharp tips with the right sharpener!FYI: These Individual Colored Pencils are available at Dick Blick for less than $1.00.. Handy if you use a lot of a couple of colors.SHARPENERS: The Brass Bullet provides the sharpest tips but requires a trash can. The Prismacolor Premier is a great all around sharpener with less mess and offers the colored pencil hole that seems to provide a nice tip without eating up your colored pencils. The Faber-Castell in the triangular shape is great for the triangular shaped colored pencils out there and offers 4 holes to sharpen the variety of sizes but makes a little bit of a mess when the colored shavings from the tips falls out when you open it. I love all three for different reasons.. Tips for proper sharpening can be found on the Prismacolor website and Dick Blicks website.PRISMACOLOR TEMPLATE: GO TO THE PRISMACOLOR WEBSITE AND CLICK ON THEIR COLORED PENCIL INFORMATION (any type).  You will see a small banner about halfway down the page on the right with a green pencil that says "Download Here".. You should be able to click on that and then print your very own copy! Hope this helps! ;)Or here is the link, but I HIGHLY recommend you go to some of the primary "artist's" brands website for tips and techniques with colored pencils.. Copy and paste into your browser.http://www.prismacolor.com/Style%20Library/PrismaColor/media/promotions/PrismacolorColoredPencilsChart2.pdf

These erase pretty well. They lay down a little different than the standard Crayola colored pencils. They seem a "little more resistant to color".... I had to go over the same areas a few times to get the template colored in the picture. The result was good, it just required a little more work to get them colored in. I erased the right side of the scribbles of the 3 colors on the notebook paper in the attached picture. As far as doing what is advertised they did a great job! If you like easy, dark laydown I think the Watercolor version of Crayola pencils are the BEST, even used dry.. I have a review of them with a picture included. I also included the regular Crayola pencils on the Watercolor review. When it comes to my adult coloring books I won't be using these. I'll stick to my non-erasable colored pencils.. Hope this helps...;)BEST ERASABLE/"NORMAL" PRODUCT FOR COLOR CODING:  Try the Frixion erasable colored ink pens by Pilot. I prefer the "Clicker" version. They don't do well in the heat, but are great for the home or office. If they accidentally get exposed to the heat the ink turns invisible. Yikes! They can be "brought  back" to color by putting in a freezer. I don't recommend them to color with but are excellent in a planner for color coding etc.. The black is a little more on the grayish black look, but the colors are excellent! Pink, purple, turquoise, red, green, blue, navy and orange. Lots of choices! The "d" is partially erased in the picture on the word "erased."

These have a Chisel Tip on them (unlike the typical broad line markers from Crayola) and a decent range of colors. There isn't a black marker though which I find a little odd since these are called "Poster" markers and the number one color most people would want to use is black. Most of the colors range more towards the classic colors except the pink is more of a hot pink. Here is a picture of the colors you get. These aren't named on the marker themselves (unlike the typical sets) so I made up the names. I guess the company thinks if you are old enough to make a poster you don't need names on the markers. ;)

This is a nice set of colors. The lids are a little hard to get fully snapped on when they are new. (Might get better over time with use?) Here is a picture of the range of colors. Notice you don't get a black, or a true red really. (My son will be disappointed since it's his favorite color.) The Plum is a darker purple than the classic. The Emerald green and the Azure are very close to a standard Blue and Green when they aren't right next to the Classic version. Hope this helps! ;)CLEANING: Someone mentioned that this didn't wash off as easily as they had hoped... Try Mr Clean's Magic Erasers! They work wonders for removing everything from dirty hand prints, dead bug smears, to getting ink off walls! Just a little water, a little scrub with the eraser and your walls will look like new!

Nice pencils for true artists! I'm not as excited to use dry on adult coloring books. They were a little more "streaked in how they laid down dry on paper than some of my other pencils. I'm sure they could be blended better with water etc, but only a few of my adult coloring books are made to handle "water painting" too. Here's how they look on a template found on the Prismacolor website. I saw lots of pictures of artwork by true artists use these and they are spectacular looking in those pictures. They are special in that they can draw on silk, once they are dry they become permanent ink and more information is available on the Derwent website and Dick Blick's had some informational links too. Their special talents are being held back by trying to color in the lines!Here's the link for the Prismacolor template since I have been getting requests.. Seriously check out the Derwent, Prismacolor's and Dick Blick's website for tips and techniques with colored pencils... Tips for broken leads within pencils, proper sharpening techniques, pictures of just what these products are capable of.. Etc.  Copy and paste the link into your browser..http://www.prismacolor.com/Style%20Library/PrismaColor/media/promotions/PrismacolorColoredPencilsChart2.pdf

These are quick and easy mini versions of the larger Dover Stained Glass coloring books. It says "Dover Little Activity Books" in the upper left hand corner on these mini 4x6 ish versions of their coloring books. Because of reading other reviews I understood how small they really are.. What I couldn't get a grasp of is what they meant by "Stained Glass Effects." The pictures are printed on a transparent paper (vellum?) with heavy black lines outlining the images, which is how you get the stained glass effect when hung up on a window. For the best effects you need to color both sides of the paper for the best effect.  Hope that helps clarify what this means to someone else. ;) I have added pictures and the instructions from within the front and back cover too. It lists all the flowers you get to color in this book. There are ONLY 8! You could argue that's times two if you want the stained glass effect since you have to color the backside of the page too.ADDITIONAL THOUGHTS: I purchased a larger horse stained glass coloring book from Dover and made a black and white plain copy to color/experiment with and it looks Great! So, if you have the desire to have a "large" 4x6 ish single flower template (perfect to cut out and put on a small card) to experiment shading techniques on this might be helpful if the thick black lines don't get in the way too much. You could possibly set your printer to a lighter setting to help or trace a copy using this as a guide to make your own template..you could even make a smaller one.  There can be more value here if you think about it... ;)I have included the black and white copy I made of my larger/normal sized Dover stained glass horse book so you can imagine how a black and white would turn out. NOTE: I didn't lighten up this copy.HAVE FUN PLAYING!

I have this coloring book and the Supersize one with the Unicorn on the front. This one is thinner and has less pages. The biggest difference that's surprising are the variations of pictures to color between the two. This "Peace and Love" book has much less detailed pictures that are easier for younger children or for older ones who really want to stay with in the lines. You can easily achieve a nice within the lines picture with crayons with the majority of the pictures in this book. If you purchase the "Rainbow Majesty" you will have a lot more detailed pictures and lots of pictures with girls that are quite stylish and will need to consider colored pencils to stay in the lines for the majority of the pages. The quality of the paper in both books is the same and extremely thin/old style (not maker quality).I reviewed "Rainbow Majesty" and attached a lot of pictures of it's pages if you want to see the difference.

I bought this same looking set from eBay (based on packaging). The sets in the red box, with the bird are the water colors. These with the Knights on the front are colored pencils. My set is written in English though and says "Made in Indonesia" on the back of the box. I have some other sets by this same manufacturer and some are made in Brazil, another in Germany. The quality does seem a little different from each country/factory with the Polychromos from Germany being the best. This one says "Classic Colored Pencils" on the front and that the leads are 3.3 mm and specially "SV" bonded to prevent breakage. A few tips broke in shipping so I got the chance to try the sharpener out that came with this set. It worked fine, as far as putting a better tip on them. It stores in the base of the "tray" that slides out of the box a nice feature if you are on the go. They do not have names printed on them, just numbers. The pencils are octagonal shaped and don't roll. These tips are on the harder side of the spectrum when coloring and took quite a bit of pressure to get the lightest yellow, pink and gray to show up on my template. I am an adult that colors in adult coloring books and not drawing sketches by the way.Color Range: I really like the colors within this set.. Due to the varied range within the colors themselves. Each blue, green etc is distinct. This might be a disadvantage for blending multiple shades of 1 color, so keep that in mind (I am coloring and want contrast). This set reminds me a little of the Marco Raffine set of 48 in "firmness, feel" and numbering system.  There is not a very good light peach combo in this set vs the Marco Raffine, but this is one of the better/darker blacks I have seen than in most sets.Hardness: Based on a little experience coloring with Crayola colored pencils vs Crayola Watercolor pencils, and Faber Castell Art Grip colored pencils vs their Aquarelle/watercolor version.. The Watercolor versions seem to be a softer lead within their own brands, if that's what you prefer.. FYII have included some color templates from the other versions and brands for you to see the difference (labeled at the tops/bottoms of the columns) and you might have a better idea of what you are getting. There is a dramatic difference between the Crayola regular version and their Watercolor version for instance. Hope it helps. ;)

Nice book but depends on your expectations. The ones I grew up with didn't have as many girls and were large simple, easy to color with crayon pictures. This book with the Unicorn has some easy pictures but a lot of the pictures have a lot more detail (and black ink) that will probably require colored pencils for those people who care to stay within the lines. ;) I'm guessing 50% of this book has pictures with girls in them to color. This is a bigger coloring book than the one I got from the dollar store as shown in the pictures. The one with the heart peace symbol on the front I got at Dollar Tree. The last two pictures are of it's cover and an example of it's style. The rest of the coloring pages are found within this book.  I unfortunately got this book with a crease that transfers through every page.. :(  Just a heads up on the differences so you have appropriate expectations. Hope this helps!

Ok, I have a rather large set of Prismacolors and a lot of the cheaper Faber-Castell etc. sets of colored pencils. These  "stand out" from the pack (keep in mind that I am coloring more than doing sketches etc) in regards to "ease of use". They are just really smooth and easy on my arthritic hands. They are a med round barrel, similar to a Bic Stick Pen.. With their color names on the side. They also cost more and seem to substantially cost more and more with each quantity increase in set size? So, if you want the most colors for your money and a really nice product, get the larger Prismacolor sets. There are videos online to have them sharpen better (might need to warm up the wax, if the lead is internally broken) etc.  but...in comparison..COMPARISON: I have applied this set of 36 Polychromos on a template that ironically has the Crayola Watercolor 24 count set and a Spectrum Brights Marker set. The Polychromos produce colors similar in saturation similar to the Spectrum marker set and even close to the Crayola Watercolor (these are much better than regular Crayola pencils in smoothness). Polychromos are just smoother in color "lay-down" and "better" in regards to pressure necessary to achieve that smooth rich consistency.  If you are not sure you want to invest the money in these, just order 1 -2 individual pencils from .. Blick, Amazon, an art supply store (haven't seen them sold that way at my local stores.. FYI) or where ever you can find them individually. I bought 2 from .. Blick and they were a reasonable cost but they just made me want more of them.. Maybe it's just me, but they seem much easier on my hands, but then again..might be that "spreading butter" factor. The cost online was so "cheap" you can probably come out ahead buying this set of 36 count and then individually purchasing additional colors you feel you need later on.. Just a thought.. If you are on the fence, I really recommend buying 1-2 individual pencils first and go from there. You can even buy a Prismacolor individually to compare (they are at my local art stores). You won't have any regrets that way..BUDGET: If budget is your primary concern, then buy a Watercolor Crayola set or a Faber-Castell set that's less expensive (skip the art grips and just buy the set with the Koala). You can always buy an individual Polychromos or Prismacolor and decide if the difference in cost is worth it to you. The Prismacolor Scholar is pretty nice for the price too (my set isn't complete, bought used, names are added where colors are missing though for the 60 ct set).  I have some other brands colored on the templates too. Each is labeled at the top and/or bottom of the columns.TIN BOX: It's surprisingly thin.. Not much taller than the pencils themselves. Opens and closes easily. Nice storage option.Hope this helps ;)

I like these markers, I just wish they had a name on them too instead of just a number since a lot of the colors are really close (especially the pinks, two of the yellows, two of the greens and two tans.. the lower number is lighter). I might have to get my label maker out and give some of them a name myself..  I also like the plastic box this set comes in. I'm not sure how long it will hold up but it's compact and seems great for now. They have a grey ring next to the lid/cap for the nib tip (like the Copics). Helpful to know when you are picking them up to color. Here's a Prismacolor template with the colors from the Light Set. I didn't find the Spectrum Noir template until later.. You will probably want to download a template to use. Especially for colors this close (can be a good thing for shading). Here's a picture of the "Lights" set, followed by the "Brights" set. Hope this helps! ;)Resources: go to Spectrum Noir's website for blank templates and tutorials on different color combinations and shading techniques!Other Storage: I bought an art bin storage case too for some of my other markers but this can just slide in and takes up less space. They have a single width case and a double wide one with extra marker inserts that can added if you prefer. I just wish the hinged lid could "pop" on and off for setting next to me at times, but I like being able to store them horizontally and not permenantly on a desk etc. There are nice plastic rows of shelf/trays you can buy that sit on a desk too.

I like these markers, I just wish they had a name on them too instead of just a number since a lot of the colors are fairly close(can be good for shading techniques). I think I will have to get my label maker out and give them a name myself..  I also like the plastic box this set comes in. I'm not sure how long it will hold up but it's compact and seems great for now. They have a grey ring next to the lid/cap for the nib tip (like the Copics). Helpful to know when you are picking them up to color. Here's a Prismacolor template with the colors from the "Brights" Set followed by a picture of the "Light" set.  They are labeled at the top of each column.
