One word, WOW! And they're not even burn in yet as this writing (less than 20 hours). These little cans sound as good if not better than the big cans from Audio-Technica ATHM50S Professional Monitor Headphones, which costs three times more. Well, it's not a fair comparison. ATHM50 is over the ear cans vs E10 is in the ear cans. Over the ear cans definitely is more comfortable. But these cans are comfortable enough to sleep in bed with it, VS you can't with the big cans.Cowon Z2-16WH 3.7-Inch AMOLED 800 x 480 Capacitive Touchscreen MP3 Player makes E10 sings! BTW, Cowon Z2 is an AWESOME PMP. It makes iPod Touch sounds like a kid's toy. Anyways, $35 for these little can is a steal!

There's no argument about Cowon PMP sound quality, they are simply the best PMP on the market. Then it comes down to other vital features and UI. Cowon's own UI is a bit awkward, but it's not a deal breaker. A PMP without Wifi is a deal breaker for me, and X9 doesn't have Wifi which means no internet radio. So I went with Z2 instead, and couldn't be more satisfy with Z2.I paid 205 bucks for a refurnished 16gb Z2 directly from Cowon (JetAudio seller), btw refurbished unit has 1 year warranty and comes in a retail box. Z2 is running on a full Android 2.3 OS with BT and Wifi, plus a 800x840 AMOLED 3.7" screen. And you can run Google Play on Z2 (google Google_Play_market__3.4.6.zip, anythingbutipod will lead you to how to install Google Play on Z2). So all my Android apps can be install on Z2.X9 has an awesome battery life, but Z2 gets more bang for your bucks and functions too.

These cans really shine with FLAC (any lossless format). Use these cans with MP3s (music from iTunes,Amazon and Zune) is kind of like put racing tires (ATH50S) on a Toyota Camry (MP3 & MP3 player); the racing tires won't be used to their full potentials.Lossless format uses a variable bit rate to sample a song without compression VS MP3 samples a song at a fixed 256 kbps bit rate with compression. Average FLAC bit rate is about 800 to 1000+ kpbs vs MP3 256kpbs, you can see how much details are dropped in MP3 compression.Device matters too, consumer class players like ipod, zune, and android won't bring out the full potential of these cans, even with a headphone amp. Apple & MS devices don't support FLAC, there are workarounds but the limitation is in the hardware. Check out Cowon devices, a less known brand to consumers, but not to audiophiles. Beware, Cowon has a crappy UI lol. But once you hit play button and put on these cans, you're in a different universe.

Fish oil supplements come in two forms: Triglycerides (TG) and Ethyl Esters (EE). Majority of fish oil supplements on the market is Ethyl Esters (EE) because it's much cheaper to produce EE than TG.However EE is a synthetic substrate from micro distillation of crude fish oil and ethanol. So it's not really a "natural" supplement. EE also produces more side effects than TG because it's a synthetic substrate.Michael Gross, MD, and Susan Klein, ND wrote an article on Triglycerides vs. Ethyl Esters, it's on the net. It's a good reading material.This Kirland fish oil is using EE, that explains the low price. It's a good option if you can't afford the TG. But if you have a sensitive stomach and need to take fish oil, then look for one made with TG.
It is so light that I often forgot it's on top of my head, I did it twice going through airport security. Polarized lens are great for water related activities. $25 is a steal!

This review is for Lumix LX5. LX5 is a tight fit in depth, the lens is right up against hard shell case when it is zipped. That leaves no room for the internal pocket to store anything. Plus if the case lands on the hard shell side first from an accidental drop, the LX5 lens probably won't survive.Pros:- Price: $10- Stylish- Easy to access the cameraCons:- Not enough padding. It's nice and thick on the back panel, but barely any on the sides and front is hard shell with no padding.- Plush Linging:  It's soft, but it will sheds eventually. Not idea for expensive camera.- Internal storage pocket shares the same space as camera, extra battery and SD storage case could scratch the camera body (if you can make them fit).I recommend Tamrac 5691 Black Digital 1 Camera Bag (Black). It's a perfect snug fit for LX5 from all sides, except from the top. The storage pocket is separated from the camera pocket, and store a tone of stuff. It can hold the entire LX5 battery charger. It's not cheap, but a good protection for a $350 camera.

It tastes great and fills you up, but it's loaded with sugar. Two out of top three ingredients are syrups. A candy Snicker bar (junk food) has 13g sugar, this one has 20g sugar.For muscle recovery, I've switched from this to thinkThin Protein Bar, Chunky Peanut Butter, Gluten Free, 10 - 2.1-Ounce Bars. ThinkThin uses sugar alcohol instead of conventional sugar. Google sugar alcohol, if you're not familiar with it. And ThinkThin use whey protein as a part of its protein blend. Whey protein is the best protein for muscle recovery.The best protein bars for muscle recovery are homemade, it's super easy to make (a bit messy). There are a tone of recipes on the net.

Some of the reviewers eat these for weight control purpose, which I don't think that's what these bars are for. 20g protein bars like these are designed for muscle recovery after weight lifting workout. ThinkThin protein bars use whey protein isloate; which is the best protein for muscle recovery. I've been eating Cliff Protein bar for body building, although it's 95% organic but it has too much sugar. ThinkThin protein bars provide same amount of protein as the Cliff Bar with less sugar.These bars use sugar alcohol, instead of conventional sugar. Sugar alcohol is a sweetener commonly found in "Sugar Free" gums. It has less calories and doesn't cause tooth decay as conventional sugar does. Nonetheless, it's a sugar. I hope ThinkThin would start making these with organic ingredients.For those who are interesting in snack bars (instead of protein bars) for weight control, Pure Bar Organic Wild Blueberry, Raw Fruit & Nut Bar, 1.7-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12) are awesome.

This phone is AWESOME! WP7.5 is intuitive, although its UI needs refinements still; which I was counting on MS for future upgrade when I bought it. Today's WP8 announcement by MS confirmed ALL current WP7 devices CAN NOT upgrade to WP8, really Microsoft?! Talking about epic fail. Who in the right mind would code a OS without supporting legacy hardware? Microsoft would and did LOL. MS said WP7 device will get 7.8 upgrade which is WP8 like. That will be the last major update for all WP7 devices.Enough rants, I mainly use it to sync with Outlook via MS Office 365, which costs 6 bucks a month. You can also sync Outlook via MS Live, a "free" service like GMail. But like Google, MS Live has virtually no privacy. Everything you do with MS Live are subject to be scanned for marketing purpose.WP7 & MS Office 365 works surprisingly well, it's almost seamless. It's deal for small business owners who want to sync with Outlook & MS office. MS Office 365 monthly fee is actually very competitive, it offers feature like web app, web hosting, cloud service...etc.If you want to play HD games, then better wait for WP8 devices which will support multi-core CPU and high end mobile GPU.

Four months update, downgraded from 3 to 1 star: The skin loss its elasticity just after four months of light use. Now it comes loose easily. Failed.It fits very well, nice and snug. However, overall quality is just so so. The seam that goes around the side is very noticeable, some area even have "leftover" silicone sticking out.The actual product doesn't look as good as the photos here. It's like the juicy Big Mac ad, the real thing doesn't quite live up to the ad, LOL. It's semi translucent and camera button is a cut out instead of covered as shown in the photos.Despite the quality, it seems to be able to do its job; which is provide additional protection from catastrophic drop and scratches. The phone recessed about 1/16" from the skin all around, that should provide a good protection from scratchings.Unfortunately, there isn't a much options for i937. My first choice Diztronic, but they said there's no plan for i937 model.I might return it since mine has some kind of stuff in the silicone as they didn't clean the mold.

This dip stand is an innovated product, it lets you do make many different exercises; a good solution for people with limited space. However, there a few things that I don't like about it.1. It wobbles, not much. But enough to cause strain to the wrists.2. The handle bar is not paralleled. They are either point inward or outward, depends on which direction you're using it. That cause more strain to the wrists.3. The price, $80 (exclude shipping) it kind of pricy for what it is.I already have other workout equipment and am only looking for a compact dip stand to do the dips. Reviews here lead me to Ez2care Comfy Handle Classic Folding Walker, Adjustable Height 32-39", Lightweight. Yes, you read it right. It's a granny's walker and it works fantastically as a dip stand at 1/3 of the cost of this stand. If you want to go even cheaper, go to your local Goodwill store. They often have the used walkers for less than 10 dollars. Make sure you don't get the ones with wheels.I think this stand is worth it if you don't already own other exercise equipment. But if you're wanting to do dips only, then walker is a great solution. Plus it's a good conversation piece, ha ha.

This drive is not pre-formatted, it took about 4.5 hours to format this 2TB HDD with eSATA connection on a i7 workstation. It'll probably take 18+ hours to format this guy with a USB 2.0.A HDD docking station with eSATA is a very handy tool. Of course, you'll need a eSATA PCI card if your computer doesn't have one.

Let's be clear, Everlast doesn't claim it as a heavy bag and it's not. It's a striking bag, the bag itself weights around 25 lbs or so (a rough estimate), it's pretty light weight. It flexes quite a bit with just light punches to the center of the bag.When you punch/kick a hanging heavy bag, it swings around with the entire weight of the bag, 80, 100 lbs whatever it be. It would come back at you with that full weight of momentum, and you'll feel it when you hit it again. It's a good way to develop the power of punches and kicks.With this striking bag, you don't get that heavy weight feedback from the bag. Even when it flexes back at you, it just doesn't have that heavy feedback. So if you're looking to develop punch and kick strength, then you better stick with a hanging heavy bag. With that said, this one can be good for cardio workout or something.I live in a tiny apartment where hanging a heavy bag is not an option. So I was looking for a free standing heavy bag, which I don't think it exist. This type of bag is actually not ideal for apartment, unless you don't have a downstairs neighbor. The energy from the hits transfer to the base, creates a deep vibration on the floor.PRO- Well built & solid materials- A good solution for small space- StableCON- flex to easilyLastly, I use furniture slider to move it around. Have a good workout!

TB to dollar ratio, this is an awesome deal. With that said, I would not use it as a primary drive for OS or crucial data storage, NAS/home server. Because it wasn't designed for that as the description stated.For OS drive, SSD is the way to go. For crucial data storage and NAS/home sever, either Caviar Black or Western Digital 2 TB RE4 - WD2003FYYS. Those two drives cost significantly more the this one, but they are in a different class. It all comes down to how much you value your data and time.I've been using the previous generation of the Caviar Green as a backup drive since Sept-2009, still got all green light from recent SMART scan (knocks on wood). Mechanical hard drive will fail eventually, scan your drive with a SMART monitor periodically. Stay away from fan less external hard drive and hard drive enclosure; heat shortens the lifespan significantly.

The strong odor (a form of toxic fume) lasted for almost a full week. It stinks up not just the bathroom, but the bedroom too, yaks! Quality control isn't all there, loose end stitching all over the place, but it holds them together. I think all the rave reviews are for earlier production, something happens to the recent ones.

I had one of these which ended up failing, so I reached out to SanDisk customer support and they replaced it without a problem after a couple of back and forth emails. I needed a new MicroSD card for a new phone, and since their customer service was great, and I've historically (other than the one failure) had great success with their products.

Incredibly fun game! I was surprised on a few occasions at the emotions that this game manages to evoke with absolutely no dialogue. The game play itself is great fun. I didn't find any of the levels all that difficult, but it was a great way to waste some time on a flight. I wish there were more levels!

The fact that there isn't really a way to properly swaddle the legs makes this a pointless product and a far cry from a "miracle".I believe the purpose of swaddling is to somewhat recreate the feeling of being in the womb, which will calm your baby and help him/her sleep. Sadly, due to the design of this blanket, there isn't a way to properly swaddle your infants legs, so they'll be able to kick freely and will most likely wake themselves up if they are prone to kicking like our baby is.If your baby tries to kick out his/her legs when swaddled normally, then you'll probably experience the same failure with this product so I'd recommend saving your money.

I tinted my side-view mirror signals with this and it has held up remarkably well. I also tinted my fog-lights, but due to the heat put out by those the tint has burned a bit, which is to be expected and is no fault of the product.Using a heat gun I was able to get a great fit with the tint. Note that there is a protective layer you peel to stick, and also a protective film over the top once you have it applied.

I was surprised my car didn't come with this (2013 Maxima), but I wanted one, so I ordered it.This includes the long cargo net as pictures as well as the smaller nets that go on each side. The install was simple and the fit is spot on!

Replaced all the LEDs in my 2013 Nissan Maxima. These are a huge improvement over the stock gross yellow tinted lights. These are crisp and clear. A lot of people will recommend going with VLEDs or another pricier solution - for the price of ONE VLED I can get two orders of these. I've had mine in for about 8 months now....none of them have failed yet, and if they do I have extras! Highly recommended!

Awesome for zoodles (zucchini noodles)! We use this about once a week.This product works wonderfully, the issue is that they're difficult to clean. Some other spiral slicers include cleaning tools with them, and they're at the same price point as this one. I'm sure they all function similarly, so save yourself a (small) headache and get one with a cleaning utensil and you won't be sorry.

We have a 4 month old and we have been going through batteries for his various toys with reckless abandon! These amazon batteries work very well and are comparable to more expensive brands like duracell and energizer. I'll continue to purchase amazon basics batteries moving forward

NOTE! There are small pipe cleaners in the big bottles! I've had these for 4 months now and JUST realized this the other day (after purchasing our own pipe cleaners).Now, that being said, these are the only bottles we use now. We started with a medula calma bottle which was recommended by our pediatrician as it supposedly best simulates a nipple (to prevent your baby from getting so used to a bottle that he/she no longer wants to breastfeed. After a couple of weeks our baby didn't seem to be a fan of the medula calma, but still nursed on these bottles without issue.We have one bottle that leaks, we haven't yet narrowed down exactly what the problem is with it. All others work fine.The biggest drawback of these bottles is easily how many components they are - when it's time to clean them and you have 5 bottles to clean, you're going to be at it for a little while.

I first used pink himalayan salt years and years ago in the mill in the kitchen. I've been using it ever since then! I put tellicherry peppercorns and this himalayan salt on any meat I cook, as well as veggies. Tastes great every time!

I've used this as an umbrella light, and I also even put it on my chandelier during a power outtage we experienced in the northeast and it has worked great for both applications.It was a little tough getting it to latch initially around the umbrella, but I just needed to use a little more elbow grease to get the job done.As stated in the product description there are 3 levels of light output. Operation is pretty straight forward

Disclaimer: I was provided this item for free in exchange for my review.I'll be honest, I wasn't expecting much out of this little thing when I unpacked it.Afterward I hastily filled it up with some water and plugged it in and turned it on.The dense mist that is generated really surprised me. My mother-in-law had a whole-room humidifier that put out a dense mist (on a much larger scale than this little guy) that reminds me of this.This is great for our baby room for a few reasons.1- the soft light glow emitted acts as a nightlight.2- the auto-off safety feature when you leave it on until it runs out of water3- we've central air in the house, so the air inside is incredibly dry, and this perfect for humidifying a small area, such as his crib when he sleeps.I've yet to use any aromatic oil in it, but will probably do so in the future, but that's another cool feature.

9:43 Mins Disclaimer: I was provided this mouse for free in exchange for my review.Pros:PriceWeights included to make mouse heavierHigh-quality CordMouse gaming software for assigning buttons - loads of configurables here, including macros!Lights can be changed - though there's an oddity - see the video for more info on that.On-the-fly DPI changing.Loads of configurable buttonsGreat fit for my large handsCons:When compared to higher quality gaming mice (Logitech G500S for example) the mouse isn't quite as smooth - but it's still perfectly acceptableNo horizontal scrolling with the mouse wheel (something I really only use for spreadsheets, Visio, Photoshop...et al - not really needed for gaming, I'm just nitpicking.Bottom line: At $30 this mouse is a total bargain when you take into consideration all of the bells and whistles you're getting. It's not quite up to par with the $100+ gaming mice...but at a fraction of the cost you'd be crazy to expect it to be.If you're on a budget and you're looking for a gaming mouse, then look no further...this thing will wow you.

6:23 Mins Disclaimer: I was provided this product for free in exchange for my review.My video review covers almost everything below.Pros:Reliable functionality at the $20 price pointGood fit in my ears - didn't fall out when runningDecent audio quality (basically on point with what you should expect at this price range in a bluetooth headset)Voice-activated call answer/decline with "yes" or "no"Possibly a pro for you (not for me) - these aren't the type of earbud that creates a noise-isolating seal in your ear.Call clarity, both on incoming and receiving, is on par with all other bluetooth devices I've used in the past.Cons:Control box is somewhat large for this type of headsetControls for volume/skip tracks is opposite what I'm accustomed to in other bluetooth headsets. This headset is long-press for volume adjustments, and short single press for track forward/back.Pairing was a bit wonky as evidenced in my video. The first time I tried to pair it I had to scan twice. I the unpaired, and tried it again (in the video) and that time it didn't show up in listed devices until the 3rd time scanning. My phone is an LG G3, and I've never experienced issues pairing bluetooth devices before, so I don't believe my phone is to blame here.I don't feel like any of the cons are incredibly detrimental to the overall functionality, but between all of them I feel like this falls a little short of a 5-star product.

5:34 Mins Disclaimer: I was provided this product for free to review.This light is a great solution if you need something to use on the move with multiple power options.One thing I forgot to mention in my video was the feet that swing out to make it much more stable on flat surfaces.

6:15 MinsAs noted in my review (and the product specifications for these!) they will most likely need to be trimmed to fit your vehicle. I had some old mats in a 2007 dodge caliber that needed to be replaced. Since it's an aging vehicle I didn't feel like shelling out a ton of money on new mats, so these fit the bill.

8:56 Mins I'm an amateur photographer, and for a couple of years I've been using one of those incredibly cheap, flimsy, craptastic aluminum $20 tripods. (Zeikos, if you were wondering).I was in the market for something a level up from that, but I also didn't want to break the bank. The reviews of this tripod were quite favorable, and the price was right, so I pulled the trigger.Hopefully my video review will help shine some light on this tripod, but I'll also outline the pros/cons here.Pros:Height. I'm 6'4" and at max height I barely have to bend over to be able to look through the viewfinder on my DSLR.Price. At $100 it's a great tripod, and it includes a ball head with great functionality.Extras - the bag included to haul it around, as well as a softer bag for the ball head, as well as a velcro pouch - see the video for a quick peek at each.Build Quality - I'm not sure how qualified I am to speak to build quality being the amateur that I am....this is the highest quality tripod I've bought...but at $100 it seems like a bargain for the price.Cons: (These are going to be nitpicky non-issue items since I don't really feel like this thing has any cons)The small pieces where you loosen the legs come up and away, just a mild annoyance more than anything (I showed this in the video)The AFAITH product name as pictured isn't what was on my stuff - it was a chinese company name. Hardly a problem, just worth noting (Also shown in the video)Bottom Line: I'm going to echo what the vast majority of other reviews have said - this thing is awesome and you can't go wrong for $100. Yeah it's Chinese....but the build quality seems to be above expectations at this price point. If you're on a budget, and you're an amateur photographer looking to upgrade from one of those cheap tripods and you can swing $100....then don't think twice about picking this up - you won't be sorry.

4:27 Mins Disclaimer: I was provided this product for free in exchange for my honest review.Pros:Good fit in my ears using the medium sized inserts and buds.Music quality is on par with what you'd expect from a $25 bluetooth headsetCall quality is also on par with what you'd expect.I generally like my music loud, and battery life fell slightly short of the specifications, but that's to be expected when I've the volume maxed.Cons:I could nitpick over the length of the charging cable, but I don't really feel like a long charging cable is necessary for these.At times I had to move the microphone closer to my mouth while on the phone to improve clarity for the person I was speaking too.Bottom line: There are a number of contenders at this price range in the bluetooth sweat-proof market. I also reviewed the MPOW Swift headset, and if you don't mind moving up to the $30 price range I'd recommend those over these simply because the controls are on the ear-piece itself and that's a personal preference of mine.However...if $25 is the maximum you're willing to spend then these are a solid choice.
I'll be buying these again! Great flavor, inexpensive, AND biodegradable too? Yes, please! This type of biodegradable packaging should be mandated for all k-cups.

Don't waste your money on this. Spend more and get something that's not going to break the first time you use it.I purchased this to get through bones such as chicken and pork shoulder roasts. The very first time I used it happened to be on a pork shoulder bone. On the first strike a piece of metal actually BROKE off of the cleaver and stayed in the meat. Incredibly unsafe. Pictures are attached for reference.

5:38 Mins Full disclosure: I was provided a pair of these earbuds for free in exchange for my honest review.My pursuit of good headphones for running has been long, arduous, and wrought with annoyances. I'll briefly summarize my experiences to see if they resonate with your personal experience.I purchased the LG HBS700. Great sound, great battery life, and great functionality....incredibly annoying to run with. They'd constantly slide one way or the other on my neck. I tried regular earbuds - the cord is so annoying it results with them not being an option for me.I then shelled out about $140 for the JayBirds. Something this expensive MUST work amazingly well. But the bounce in the cord around the back of my head made them simply not worth the cost of entry. I returned them.Then an MPOW representative reached out to me to see if I'd be interested in test-driving the MPOW swift earbuds which I graciously accepted. Let's get started.--The Good--The cost. The competition at this price point is severely lacking. MPOW wins in an absolute landslide.The build quality. Noting that at this point I haven't completely put the MPOW Swift through its paces - but I'll be updating accordingly as time goes on. So far it appears very well built. The cord itself on the earbuds is high quality and doesn't succumb to much movement. Sound you hear in the earbuds from the cord movement is surprisingly minimal.The audio quality, keeping in mind the price point and purpose of these earbuds (exercise, by and large) leaves very little to be desired. Great highs and very acceptable lows.Ease of use. Pairing the device is simple - but that brings me to one of my "small issues" the button you have to press to power on and pair is also where the light is emitted from to indicate what "mode" you're in (powered on, pairing, or off). This is remedied simply by using a smaller part of your finger to press the button. Not a big issue, but could have been designed a little better. The volume keys control the volume, and when held will advance songs or go back songs.Once you have it paired once, the next time you turn on the headset the quickness with which it reconnects was quite surprising to me. My bluetooth speakers and other headphones take about 15 seconds to reconnect. These headphones are about 1-2 seconds after you've turned them on.Battery life is incredible. I worked an 8 hour shift with these and they still weren't completely depleted. Note that the volume wasn't cranked to the max during this time, but it was still moderately loud.--The bad--"Bad" is a bit of a stretch here. I wouldn't say anything is bad about these. Annoying, perhaps. The aforementioned fact that the lights that indicate the mode are on the button you have to press is a bit of a design flaw, but easily avoided by pressing the button while not completely covering the light.The charging cable doesn't come with a wall-outlet adapter. A non-issue for me since I have plenty kicking around the house from smartphones of yore. Something that others should keep in mind.For now this product is an easy 5-star item, especially considering what other competition is out there at the price point these are being sold at.I'll update my review, as with all my reviews, periodically with new information as I see fit. Thanks for reading/watching - I hope this review has helped you make a decision on this item.

3:25 Mins To summarize my video review - the Bright Charge! Rapid Charger is a decent charger with a couple of bells and whistles. Rapid, however - in my personal experience - not so much.Update 4/6/2015: It has been 4 days since my review, and I've an addition. As seen in my video the light at the end of the charger comes on when you touch it....I believe that is the normal intended behavior....however over the past couple of nights I've awoken to find the bright LED light on, while plugged into my device (either a Galaxy Tab, or my LG G3). At first I thought something must have been touching it somehow, but there was nothing touching it.I unplugged it from my device and plugged it back in at which point the light went off. This happened again last night, and I repeated the process. Then 5 minutes later the light came back on again inexplicably.Because of this I'm lowing my review to 2-stars and I'll most likely be covering the light with electrical tape to avoid being woken up by the bright LED in the future.
Prior to purchasing any Mommylicious Maternity items I would strongly encourage anyone to google search their company and read more about how incredibly horrendous their customer service is.

I love backpacks that do what you need them to do and do it well.I was using a Canon Powershot G12 for a while and my Naneu Echo sling served me very well as long as I had it. Then I upgraded to my DSLR (Nikon D5100) and eventually accrued enough lenses to warrant an upgrade. So, the hunt began. After doing loads of research I ended up landing on the Sony LCSBP3. Between the functionality, style, and price, it had everything I was looking for (and then some! a spot for a laptop, and a rain-cover? Sure, why not!)I love the ability to quickly be able to swing the pack around to my front to retrieve my camera. No more having to have the camera around my neck at all times for quick access - extremely annoying (and sometimes impossible) depending on the size of the lens you're using.I've 3 lenses for my Nikon D5100. The 55-300MM lens, the 35MM prime lens, and the kit lens the camera came with. I'm also able to accommodate my flash in the compartments inside the bag. The top compartment holds all of my other gear including cleaning supplies, filters, extra batteries, extra memory cards, et al.If you're upgrading from a P&S or you're just now getting into the world of DSLRs then chances are this pack is big enough to haul the gear you have. Or, if you've a ton of gear, I imagine this bag is big enough for you to take a long a kit that should cover most, if not all, of the shots you'll want to take.

Used to apply paper templates to wood. I'd spray on the adhesive and let it sit for a bit, and then apply it. This method allows the paper to not form as strong a bond which is perfect for transferring templates to wood. I'll be back for more when I run out.

I had one of these in my shower on a wall bar and the plastic arm ended up breaking. My existing unit had NO markings on what the brand was, so I measured it and pulled the trigger on this one. Thankfully it's a perfect match (both size and finish!). The plastic on this one seems beefier so hopefully it lasts longer.
As others have indicated the adhesive is akin to a sticky note and it's not really something I'd trust and I always reinforce the closure with scotch tape.

I bought these so I'd have some replacements on hand when I almost certainly misplace/lose one of my Nikon lens caps. I did put one on a lens I purchased on ebay that didn't come with a cap. I ultimately opted to not employ the strap/holder as it was more of a nuisance than anything as I'm accustomed to simply putting the lens caps in a pocket.

The stitching on this case leaves a bit to be desired, but it's hard to fault it when the cost of entry is ten dollars. I would still recommend this. I've been using it for my Toshiba Thrive and while the fit isn't like a glove, it still works just fine.

I don't really know who would need FOURTEEN of these things, but c'est la vie. I needed one for the arbor pulley on my Craftsman 113 table saw. I had to sand it down every so slightly to properly sit in the groove, but after that I threw on my machined pulleys and it's nice and snug and doesn't budge at all. Added a link belt to my saw and it runs extremely smooth with very little vibration.

It's pretty disappointing that this isn't included with the 22-580 in the first place. Between that and the fact that in order to store the planer and lift the tables, you have to remove the dust port, which isn't very good design and seems like more of an afterthought.That being said, the product works perfectly fine. I've been using a shop vac with it, which is less than ideal, since if I take much more than 1/16" in 1 pass it'll clog up - but that's on me since I should  really be using a true dust collection system anyway.Trying to use this thing without a dust collector will make a huge mess, unless you really want to create a huge pile of wood shavings.

I used these on a bib/medal rack I built for my wife and they look great. I finger-tightened them as far as I could and finished up using a pair of pliers to make them nice and tight. They didn't bend at all under the torque of the pliers, which was my primary concern. The zinc plating also stayed completely intact.

I didn't have a very good experience with these, unfortunately. I find my sanding mat grips items much better due to the surface area that's in contact with it.I tried using these to support a small work piece for sanding and it walked all over the place. I put 'em up on the shelf a couple months ago and they haven't been back out since, and I kinda doubt they ever will be.

I'm a woodworking hobbyist and I was looking for a solution to wearing safety glasses with a mask and having the glasses fog up. If you've done this, then you know exactly what I'm talking about. Those cheap masks (and even some of the more expensive ones with the small filters) just don't create a proper seal, so it's sort of defeating the purpose if air is escaping above your nose - or anywhere, for that matter.Enter this awesome respirator! After putting it on and tightening it accordingly to your face size you'll notice a big difference right away. As long as you purchase the right size and fit it appropriately you won't have any air escaping where it shouldn't be.Finally, I can wear glasses in the shop and a respirator and not have to worry about my glasses fogging up!There is a newer version of this mask that has a quick release so you can quickly drop the mask down, and I think it's only slightly more expensive - if I had it to do over again I'd go with that one for the added convenience.

My only other experience with plug cutters, before the Grizzly kit here, was a CMT 3/8" Plug cutter which, while it got the job done, it did so in a less than ideal manner. Because of the bit's slight wobble the plugs it would yield were slightly tapered. Note that it was definitely the bit here, as the drill press I was using ran true with a multitude of other bits.I've used all sizes of this Grizzly kit and there is no wobble from the bit. The plugs are the same on each end when measured using a micrometer. Can't beat the price for this kit, and the performance so far is a great value for the money.

I've been working on some projects that I'm rough cutting on my band saw and then subsequently sanding down closer to what I'm actually looking for using these on my drill press.I was originally going to pick up an oscillating spindle sander, but I figured I'd give this method a shot instead and I'm glad I did!These are also easy to just toss in my regular drill if I'm looking for additional manual control. Note that the grit on these is quite low so you won't be doing any super fine detailing, but if you're in the same camp that I was then look no further.

I am incredibly happy with this candle! It looks good enough to actually eat since its so realistic. Down to the metal pan its in and especially the crust, amazing crumbly crust.Its also one of the most scented I have ever had, it has a strong scent even when not lit. When it is lit the pumpkin pie reaches the other side of the house. When it arrived it seemed to be well protected with a tight plastic wrapping around the candle and some bubble wrap stuffed all around it in the box so it arrived in great condition. I did take some photos of the candle after a week of using and some of the crust has fallen off. This was due to handling so I would recommend being careful picking it up and such as the edges of the metal pan are thin and the crust will break a bit.The candle is a lot larger than I thought it would be, bigger than my hand spread out. 5 inches wide, a few inches tall. When burning it does not melt up quickly and seems to last a long time. I have barely even made a dent in it after a week of using every day.Overall, the candle is just beautiful and I feel like taking a bite all the time. It smells as good as it looks no doubt. I will definitely be getting more of these for the holidays.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I can get enough of Black Tie Mercantile's candy! So, so, good. These ones are among my favorites because they beat out a well known brand name of sour straws that I used to get by the single pack all the time. More flavor plus have more of the little sour sugar stuff packed on to the straws. Super sour! Super better. Also, the percent daily values aren't half bad. So that gives me a nudge towards these for the win.They arrived quick and in a cute black box that actually seems pretty appropriate for expecting candy. It has character. Inside were 10 packs of sour straws. Two of each flavor, five flavors total. I promptly tested each one...My favorite definitely has to be the strawberry because to me it is the most sour out of all five flavors. Its a surprise because I thought that one of the known sour flavors would have been the most sour like green apple or pink lemonade. Nonetheless, they are all delicious and I like them all. Each pack has 9 straws so I did get a good taste test out of them.They are fat free and have 175 calories per whole package, also 33g of sugar each. Black Tie Mercantile candy, these Dorval Sour Power Straws are just yum and I will have my next box on the way soon. Highly recommended if you love sour and love gummy candy with some chewiness.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I probably wear this bra way to often but I love it. The comfort and the relaxed feel but with good support for running around makes it that good. Im really impressed and satisfied with the order.The bra comes in a few colors, I ordered the white one. It looks cute with the grey piping and grey bottom band. Has a sporty look with the angled pinstripes on the side. It has been super comfy, i'll wear it from morning til night without problems and the material is very stretchy. I actually ordered a size medium although I do have a pretty small chest size. I'm about 5ft 2in and 115 lbs, normal bra size is a 32B. It fits me well but has quite a bit of give if needed. I stretched it wide and all around with my hands to check it out and it would probably fit a woman a couple cups larger because of the major stretch it has.The inside has some thin padding which I most always wear with the bra but there is a hole on both sides where the padding can be removed. I have removed only once and wore the bra but I felt like I did not have enough support without the padding so I put them back in. Without those paddings I think it is a little thin in the front.The back of the bra is so cute, has a criss cross pattern so it makes the shoulder straps hit high more towards the neck which gives me even more support and lift that way. The back straps are comfortable. Also, no tags. No scratchy feel. The bra is labeled with the size and wash instructions but its actually printed on the back strap, on the inside. The material is on there as well in print.Overall, I love the Miny Women's Comfort Cross bra. Its made well and all the seams are tight. Perfect for on the go or just hanging out at home.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Most of the time I pair this with my french press and it makes the best sized grounds for it, leaving no pieces in my coffee. For my drip coffee pot I use it and make the grounds a little bigger. Works well every time and seems to keep the quality and consistency throughout use so far, to which it has been used daily since it arrived.Its a little heavy, sturdy heavy though, built well and comes apart very easy for cleaning. The included brush is perfect for it and reaches all the little nooks and crannies. The grinder has a knob on it which rotates so that I can choose the level or how course I want my beans to be. While turning the handle I can also visually see it being done which is handy, the window in front is easily viewed since its on both sides. Handle is easy to turn and to grip but does take a bit of muscle in the first minute or so with the full solid beans. It seems to be attached a lot better than my previous manual grinder which broke. Every time I grind I cant get over the amazing aroma the beans produce from being freshly ground, it makes the absolute best cup of coffee. I will never go back to pre ground. Another thing, its nice to be able to just make what I need instead of a large pile at once. A few cups is what I get from filling the grinder with beans. This way, I can do it once a day and have the freshest cup of joe possible. Works great, I would recommend to all the coffee addicts!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

These are just fantastic. I have always preferred black out panels over regular curtains but have only ever had plain, boring ones so I was thrilled to hang these up. The design is gorgeous and gives some flair to a basic window and the long, long, length makes my living room look bigger.They arrived quick and in a set of 2, each panel is 38" wide when measured flat. 84" in length. When hung up with a pole through the top holes each panel ends up losing a couple inches to be about 34" wide. Take that into account when measuring windows.I think they are made beautifully, all of the seams are nice and even. Very tightly sewn and no loose threads anywhere. The material is very nice and since its a jacquard fabric its really strong but has some stretch to it. They're also a bit heavy and thick so I feel they will be great for the winter to be a little extra insulation on the windows.The color that I got is the deep and really rich red and it is very much true to the color on the listing picture. I am loving the pattern on the panels, its intricate with a swirl design that is a darker shade than the rest so it stands out.  Silver grommets are a pretty accent as well!Most of all what is important is that they do blackout greatly. Light is blocked out with nothing peeping through. Mid-day, bright sun, and still they keep it out. Perfect for me since it is always so hot here and without the light coming in, its a lot cooler inside. I am really liking the curtains and will be getting more for the spare bedroom.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I am in love with the outcome I got from these butterfly 3D decals. I was picturing something entirely different that what they actually were when they arrived but they ended up being better than I hoped for in terms of how 3d they look.They arrived in baggies separated by color. Five different colors, all very bright and vivid. Each color has a few different sized butterflies in the bag, small, medium, and large. They do come flattened and need to be adjusted to make the 3D look. I just took both the wings and bent them outwards a little bit which was really easy since the butterflies are a thin plastic and are very pliable to work with.All of them stick to my wall really well even with my wall being textured so it does not have to be a flat surface to apply. They seem to stick to literally everything. The back of each one has like a little ball of adhesive smaller than my pinky fingernail. So its the smallest surface area that is actually stuck onto the wall which is what gives them that 3D look, like how they look like they are floating since hardly anything touches the wall. It really is so pretty!The butterflies can be placed and taken down and then replaced many times, the adhesive doesn't lose its stick so they can be reused over and over for different settings if need be. I placed a couple down lower so that my little boy could look and touch some and they ended up still in good shape so with a toddler who can be destructive that shows they are tough. The material seems strong. I prefer to stick them to the wall but there is also a little magnet in each of them so there are other options if I didn't want to adhere to the wall, the magnet is strong and they stay up well on the fridge.I love the overall outcome and I think they would make a beautiful addition to a weddings decor or a childrens party. Right now I just have them in my kids room and they look awesome! So pretty!I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Too cool! I heard about these type of color changing spoons in the past and have wanted to try them out for some time. I ordered these BabieB ones and I am not disappointed! Its a really cool feature to have especially when safety is the number one factor I look for in childrens products.They arrived quickly, in a pack of 5. All are a different color so they appeal well to the little ones. My little niece has been using them with her jarred baby food and some purees which we heat up before feeding her. They work by just simply sticking the spoon in the food and stirring it around for a few seconds. If the spoon changes on the colored part of it, to white, then the food is too hot for baby. If the colored part of the spoon does not change then its cool enough for baby. Simple as that, nothing crazy. Definitely handy though and an easy way to test quickly.The spoons are rubbery in feel but do not bend, it reminds me of the coating on some toothbrush handles. It does make it easier for my niece to grip and hang onto the spoons especially with the curve they have where baby's hand goes. The only thing I would change about them would be the actual spoon part where the "cupped" area is since some food falls off easily. If it was deeper and more rounded I think the food would stay on better but they are close to being flat with a little curve. Overall, love them, and would highly recommend new parents try them out. I wish I would have had these when my little boy was a baby!I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

These bowls have been perfect for our weekly road trips for my sons specialist doctor. Since we have to make the trip every week, 4 hours each way, it makes it a lot easier to pack snacks and such because the lids actually stay put so much better than the plasticware I was using before. It is difficult for my toddler to take the lids off so in turn it leaves me with less random messes and more saved food.They are great at home as well of course, with the suction cup being able to stick onto his high chair table. Suction is good and does work well on the plastic. I just place the bowl on the table and push down to get a good stick. The bowls all have handles on the sides so my son loves to carry around his cereal in them or whatever he has and I love the safety factor, all plastic, BPA free, and super easy to wash. I have not had problems with staining from food. I stuck one in the microwave yesterday to warm up some leftover spaghetti for him and all was fine. Same with the dishwasher but usually I just hand wash. Also the pack comes with three bowls, all are different sizes which happen to be able to stack together inside one another so packing for travel or saving room on storage at home has been great!I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I received the dolly in a box full of all the pieces and parts which needed to be built together before using. Building was not a problem and was fairly easy to do so. Upon opening the box all the pieces were in I discovered that they included a screwdriver! How cool is that? I didn't even need to provide my own tools to put it together which is extremely handy. Also, there was an included tape measure that will be perfect to measure furniture before putting on the dolly. Great additions. On the listing picture it shows an included level although I DID NOT see one of those in the box.So putting it together. It took about 15 minutes to put on all the feet and wheels, corners, sticker things, etc. ONLY because I actually used my own electric drill for the total of 16 small screws that are for the wheels. The other screws which are the 8 black for adjusting the length of the dolly were easily put in by hand. If I were to use the included screwdriver I assume it would have taken an additional 10-15 minutes.All of the pieces went together nicely, evenly, without issues. I am surprised at the durability of the dolly. All the plastic is very hard and thick, definitely strong. The metal feet are a great quality along with the wheels being thick and super hard. The whole thing has a great construction.I found that the wheels swivel well. I did not have problems with them turning or getting stuck, all are really smooth. The dolly does adjust and can be pulled larger just by unscrewing the black screws a bit and making it larger or smaller that way. It does not move once locked in. So nothing will roll off even if on a small downslope.I have to say I am impressed with it. For the current listing price, its a great deal. I will definitely use this often and it will help when moving.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Its a great bag and has worked really well for me as an upscale looking diaper bag which I carry as my purse anyways so I dont need multiple bags. Since its so large I have everything in it plus plenty of room so that it doesn't look stuffed up.It arrived in great timing, only a couple days. Good condition, protected by a dust bag. The bag is a good size, a little wider than I thought it would be so in turn it looks a little short but I still think its cute. Even the handles were wrapped up in plastic. Inside is really pretty, lined in a silky fabric. The fabric inside is light colored so it might stain easily. Also, would be hard to wash the lining but the outside is very easy to clean since its a faux leather and can just be simply wiped clean.The leather is a beautiful color (I received the 'Brown') which is like an orange / rust. It is definitely an IN color for the fall season and will go with a lot of the current fall styles and shades. Its a fake leather so it does arrive a bit firm, not as soft as real leather of course but it seems to be softening up a bit as I use it more.There are a bunch of handy pockets. One of the sides has a zippered pocket along with the main large pocket which has a zipper as well. The inside has some various ones about the size for a cell or some keys. A zippered one which is great for my wallet and some pens and checkbook. Plenty of room and makes for good organization.It does seem to be built nicely, all of the seams are even and tight along with the handles firmly on the bag. I do not see it having issues with the construction. Its also very lightweight!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I have a few flashlights around the same lumens as this one and it has compared well to those, keeping a bright light and multiple settings is unique so I prefer to use this one when heading out at night or coming home.The current cost for it is good and in my opinion worth it because of the features it has like being able to switch light settings from bright, medium, and even a cool looking strobe light. The flashlight also has a dial near the head that can be turned to change the focus from very thin and sharper to a wide angle for more spacious lighting. All this is actually done a lot easier than I expected and I dont really have to put in much effort to find the right setting at the time. Thats especially great in the dark when I wouldn't be able to see the flashlight anyways.While on Bright, the light is definitely vivid. Its the setting I use most, with a lot of strength and area coverage. It reaches really far down the street when I shine down it so nothing can hide! Other than the light settings it came with some additional accessories, the bike mount which I have not installed just yet but looks simple enough to do. No tools or anything are required to put it on. Also, the flashlight has a couple attachments like the lanyard that I like to keep around my wrist so I dont drop it and the metal clip on the side (very different!) which can be attached to my belt if I wanted.Its a good length, fits right in my hand at a bit less than 6 inches. It weighs more than I thought it would, has a nice durable weight to it. Note- the flashlight takes 3 AAA batteries that are NOT included and are installed into it by unscrewing the flashlight. It is pretty easy to do but comes with a manual if needed.I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

This dish has been wonderful for large casseroles! It seems to heat food thoroughly without any overcooked areas, all even throughout the food. I made a green bean casserole in it last week that turned out amazing. Since the dish is nice and deep I can add more but still have it evenly baked. Last night was lasagna night and the meal turned out so nicely. Of course its a great place for the food to be in but it also looks really nice for presentation. The sides/handles have a textured feel with a cool design and the edges are smooth and rounded off.It was in great condition when it arrived, with no marks or scratches, so it was well protected. The size is the same as it says in the listing, 2 inches deep and 10.25 long by 6.5 wide. When its time for cleanup the dish washes nicely and does not give me problems with stuck on food even with that sticky lasagna. Most times I will stick in the dishwasher, no issues.The dish is a strong, nice glass. Made of borosilicate which in my opinion is the best option for glassware being as its a lot safer in case of drops it wont spread sharp ugly pieces all over, mostly staying contained. Its a super great dish as well as pretty!I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

If your looking for a scooter that has a safety factor along with an age appropriate design, this is great and has worked so well for my toddler! He is young and not ready for anything that he would have to manage balance on his own so this Tackedoo scooter with one wheel in the back and double wheels up front gives him that balance he needs. No matter what, the scooter stays firmly on the ground so peace of mind is at play.The scooter arrived quickly and in a funny triangle box, all I had to do was pull it out and pull the handle up. It was folded. When folded up, its quite small so storage is no problem. It was a little smaller than I had anticipated but a good height for my kid nonetheless. From the deck where he has his feet to the handlebars (which is a t-bar) is about 2 foot. That does give some room where he reaches down to hold instead of the bars being right in front of him. It makes no difference and is still easy for him to ride. The weight limit says 44 lbs, my son is about 30 lbs, I actually stood on it for a few seconds to try it out before he did and it still held up without bowing or weakening so its extremely durable and built strongly.The entire scooter hardly weighs much at all. Just a few total pounds making it really light and great for little ones. Even with the scooter being lightweight, the pieces and parts and dense. Thick, sturdy, and seemingly tough. Deck is reinforced and the steering springs are strong.I noticed that this scooter is different from others with the way it works. Instead of the handle bars being turned to make the wheels turn, it works by leaning. Lean to the left and the wheels adjust to turn left, same with the right. The handlebars do not move at all. They are firmly stuck in one spot. On the back there is a break, my son just has to lift his foot up and on it so its pretty easy. The break works super well, one touch and it stops the scooter in its tracks with no problem.The wheels on the scooter are smooth and run so nicely on so many surfaces. Of course outside on the sidewalks but even inside on a thick carpet did not slow it down. That was great to be able to have my son practice on the carpet before heading out to the big dogs. Its a perfect height and size for my kid and it provides so much entertainment while being a source of activity so that kids are not inside in front of the tv all day. I think he really loves it and will grow with it for a few more years of use.For this review I am taking everything into account, the quality and craftsmanship along with the current cost and its totally worth it. I would highly recommend it!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

This organizer is an awesome option for makeup storage. I have stuffed it full and still have some space left if needed. The drawers with the non-slip piece of material in them has been handy, keeping lipsticks and liners from rolling around when I shut or open it.It arrived in great condition, all wrapped up to prevent any damage to the very clear and clean acrylic. No scratches or scuffs on it, it was perfectly new and pristine. Since the entire thing is clear acrylic I can see everything inside. No more searching around for the right shade of shadow or the new matte raspberry lippy! Its all right in front of me. The organizer has nice wide drawers, bigger than I thought they would be. Just about 5-6 inches deep with a little over 9 inches wide. Each drawer has around 2 inches of space from top to bottom so its easy to fit a couple palettes stacked and side by side. Plenty of my compacts and single sized shadows fit too.The top half has a ton of different little compartments, different sizes and lengths. Some area on the side for compacts or whatever, a few inches wide. The compartments right now I have some smaller eyeshadow brushes and liner brushes in, as well as some general lipsticks. Great area for mascaras. The way its shaped like a half circle is super cute, unlike a lot of other acrylic organizers I have (most are just flat and simple).All together, its sturdy and built really well. Thick acrylic that wont break easily. All of the drawers slide nicely, no sticking. I do want to mention that the drawers are not connected to the box, but are just slid into it. So if pulled to far out they will come out. This is actually good for me though because I like to pull whole drawers out while doing my makeup. If working on my eyes, i'll pull the "eye stuff drawer" out. The top half fits well onto the bottom and does not slide around at all. The whole thing is a nice quality so for the current listing cost comparing to others of similar likeness, its worth it and a good deal. I have had no issues and right now am obsessed! Love the organizer and the neatness I have now!I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

Gosh I really liked this wig! For this review I am basing my rating on the features and quality of the wig along side the current price which is amazingly low for what I got. I wanted it just for some dress up and a change of my look for going out without having to go a full permanent direction. It works out well for me and I love the style.The color of the wig in the listing picture is a super bright red and when mine arrived it was exactly on point. Matched up. The red is vivid and wild! Love that. The length, measures up to about 28 to 29 inches at the longest point and has some really cute layers. The bangs are a bit longer than I wanted but I trimmed them up a little and it looks good. The hair even feels good, pretty soft for synthetic hair and definitely pulls the real look off. I would not think anyone would guess it was fake other than being so bright and obvious that way of course. Since the roots area is completely packed with hair and sewn in very tight, the lining is invisible. All evenly sewn into the lining.The wig came with a cap and a comb as well. Comb is okay, it works for untangling without making it all frizzy. Sometimes a little bit of hair will shed but its not an unreasonable or unexpected amount, just a normal shedding that happens. I havent had any bare spots or absurd hair loss on the wig. When combing with the included comb there is not a lot of hair pulled.On the underside is a mesh cap that is pretty stretchy. I dont have a large head, actually its kind of small, and it fits me perfectly with plenty of room to spare. Since there is a stretchy band that is attached underneath it I can tighten the wig on my head so it wont move around. Personally I do not use the strap much and instead I use some bobby pins which works nicely for me. It has not adjusted or fallen off ever while wearing.I do want to mention that when the wig arrived it was shiny. My real hair is not close to that amount of shine so to get the wig looking 10X more realistic looking I put some baby powder in a bowl and used a huge kabuki brush to brush all over the wig with the powder making sure to blend it in well so the white powder was gone but the shine was non existent anymore. It looks fantastic with the powder so its not super shiny anymore.The red is so wild and brings out such a fun playful side of me. I love wearing it out and people asking about it! I know that EmaxDesign makes some other colors of wigs as well so I plan on getting another for Halloween coming up. They would be perfect for adding to a costume.Another note: I tried to use a curling iron and a hair straightener on the wig and it seems to be ok at a low temperature, under 200 degrees Fahrenheit is okay. The curling iron added a little bit of extra wave to it but the straightener was better and smoothed out the waves nicely.****I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I love the brushes! The whole set of 10 has all of the brushes I need to do a full face of makeup, including an eyeliner brush and an angled eyeshadow brush. The set arrived quickly and packed into a black drawstring pouch so portability is easy. After washing the brushes I did not notice a change in the way the bristles feel so they seem to keep that softness regardless. The bristles are dense and packed with the fibers.They have nice handles as well, with gold toned metal attached to a black stem. They're beautiful and for the current listing price, worth it.I received this product for free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

These cases have been great for downsizing. We had a ton of dvd's that have been collected over the years, tons just stacking up and filling up a dvd stand with no more room. I have a few different cosmetic organizers since I have so much makeup and I just love the way they look. The clear drawers, everything see through makes it look great and being able to see exactly where all my lipsticks and compacts, palettes, and jewelry are without even opening it up.It arrived quick and in really great shape, there were no scratches or marks and was super clean and clear. The closet was a bit of good and bad. With it being very compact in the box I had no idea it would be so large, so the end result is great being as it fits a lot of clothing. When opening it up and laying out all of the pieces and parts it was a little confusing figuring out which was what just from the illustrations on the instructions but eventually I got it.Setting it up was a little hassle since there is an extreme amount of bars and connectors, every piece needs to be correct and the right side or like me, you will end up having to take down a lot to fix one piece. With the layers of fabric for the shelves, I thought they are alright for setting lightweight stuff onto, anything heavier like a stack of jeans would be iffy.I did notice that toward the end of building the closet a bunch of the poles would pop out from the connectors while I was trying to connect another, too loose maybe.
